Four of us stayed here for a college reunion last weekend.  We were all on a budget, and wanted to go to the Wynn nightclubs, so this hotel was in the perfect location.  Because of its proximity to Fashion Show Mall, we were also able to eat a few cheap meals (Chipotle and Grimaldi's) and do some shopping at the giant F21.  We saved a lot on cab fare from walking back and forth from the Wynn\/Encore as well.  

The room was very clean and spacious, even for four of us.  The beds are comfy, and the bathroom was clean and had a big mirror (essential for us ladies), although it could use a vent or fan.  For the price, we didn't expect stellar service or a beautiful interior, and we strategically didn't hang out in the casino or hotel itself for very long, opting instead to explore the nicer nearby hotels.  Housekeeping was very nice about bringing us extra towels, and our room was close to the elevators and the ice machine, so the room was perfect for our needs.  The casino and common areas were very smoky, but surprisingly our room itself was completely free of that gross smoke smell, which was great because I can't stand smoke.  

The only low point was when we requested a wine and beer bottle opener and had to pay $5 for it, only to realize they only brought us a wine bottle opener.  I had to call several times and wait on hold to correct the situation, but this was just a minor incident.  

We did eat at the Coffee Shop in the lobby one morning when we were too tired and hungover to venture out, and it was not great, but not bad (greasy breakfast food that did the job).  On our last day, we called for and got a late checkout (noon instead of 11), the bell desk held our bags for us, and we printed our boarding passes at the free kiosk at the back of the lobby (very convenient!)  Check-in and check-out were fast and painless (I booked and paid through Hotels.com).  

Our total fee (including tax, $28\/night resort fees, etc.) for three nights (Thursday-Sunday) was $653, not bad for a Spring Break weekend for four people.  Four stars based solely on value - if I was on the same budget during my next Vegas trip, I would absolutely stay here again.

We stayed 12-27-12-30 and were in a petite suite.  It was a great deal with 30% off because we stayed three nights, at check-in (the line was long, but seemed to move pretty steadily) we were upgraded to a nice strip view room on a higher floor.  We had a great view and a peek at the Bellagio fountains.  The room was nice with two bathrooms, whirlpool tub and big comfy bed.  My wife got a manicure and pedicure from the newly remodeled spa and she said it was nice, although they had only been open one day.  The staff was helpful and attentive.  We would definitely go back, especially when there are great deals on rooms.

Extremely rude and argumentative customer service received from manager Jeff Trince. Appalled to be treated by an employee in such a way in the hospitality industry. Charged for unauthorized charges which the hotel refused to remove. Hotel hallway smelled of vomit. Requested to be moved to another wing.

I really did enjoy this hotel because the lady was very nice to upgrade our room to strip view for free and it was clean and renovated.
They even offered us a free bottle of champagne to celebrate a birthday 
Some people got unlucky I guess but I didn't have a single problem. 

Pros:if u like country the bar n resto Gillys was awesome, didn't get a chance to eat here 
For drinks the bar n resto Senor frogs was awesome the drinks were strong! 
Didn't get a chance to eat here 
Check in and check out was fast and easy 
Location is awesome central close to mostly everything important 
Liked the smell inside it was like you were on vacation (other then the cigarette smokers everywhere lol) 


Cons:
Hated the fast food choices here 
They need a food court 

I was terrified after reading another review of someone breaking into there room. My room had scratches as if someone had tried to break into our room I didn't notice this till a few days being there so I can't say if this happened while there or if it was there but I brought everything expensive with me when I left my room . They do have security at the elevators and you need to show your room card to get in but anyone can make a fake or it could be an employee trying to break in 
Who knows so be careful. They know your there with money 

Anyways all in all I would say it is a nice hotel 
I would recommend it

Had a great stay for my first time in vegas.

PROS: *Rooms were clean. 
*Housekeeping did a great job keeping the place tidy and supplying all necessitys needed. 
*There were many restaurants, although a bit pricey but not unusual for Las Vegas.
*I liked the fact that there is a 24 hr CVS in the hotel. *The tram going to the mirage and the fashion mall close by was a huge bonus. Overall the location was perfect on the strip and close to the bus and many other hotels.
*The entertainment was definitely a bonus, the shows at Kahunas and the theatre. Also the parties at the pool, gilleys and senor frog made our stay exciting.

CONS: *What was not so amusing were the annoying sweepstake people harrassing you every second in the corridor for a free trip and a deal on a show with dinner. 
*I was also not pleased with the hotel stopping the pirate show. 

OVERALL: Despite the lack of luster and glam like other up to date hotels in the area, if you are looking for a quiet, clean,cheap place to stay on the strip this is definitely the place for you.

I love staying here! They seem to have some of the most reasonable prices on the strip. The check in\/check out process has been a breeze! The staff has always been kind and helpful. The hotel rooms are clean and have good views basically any side you're on. I like that the pool isn't necessarily a big party pool, but still has a good atmosphere and good music and drinks! We got a cabana for a day last trip and that was an amazing experience. Our server was very very attentive and fun. She even had a beer pong table brought over for us. They re-stocked the fridge as soon as we needed it. There are plenty of chairs and best of all, you can escape the sun for a bit under the cabana! The location of TI on the strip is very convenient. Negatives: there are very few outlets in the rooms so finding a place to charge your phone is a pain and the bathrooms don't have vents\/fans. Overall, I'd recommend staying here.

I'm not sure this place needs a 986th review, but I hope to bring some attention to a pseudo-scam this hotel and many others in Las Vegas partake in.

 The Resort Fee

 I'm not sure how much longer this will be legal but for now, TI thinks it's ok to advertise a price for booking, and then when you check in, say you owe them $25 extra a night as a "resort fee". They say it's a great deal, you get free local calls, a newspaper, a 2 for 1 drink coupon, and you can print your boarding passes free in the lobby. This charge is NOT optional, even if you don't use what they force on you. 

 It's seriously the bait and switch scam. If TI wants $25 extra a night, it needs to add it to the base rate that is ADVERTISED.

 The only reason I'm not rating TI a 1-star is because they are not the only place in Vegas that does this, but they are one of the most expensive. 

 Other strikes are: The bars are overpriced and lacking in fun. Restaurants are twice as much as an off-strip option. The pool is a little small.

We chose to stay here due to its great location and reasonable price.

From here, I walked to the Fashion Show Mall, the Wynn, the Venetian, etc

On a Sat afternoon, the front desk had a long line but it went pretty quick.  Vdrana? (lady from Bosnia)from the Front desk staff was very pleasant. Even though they didn't have any king rooms or strip view, she did give me a renovated room on a high floor with view of the back of the hotel which was not bad.  She was also nice enough to offer an amenity for my bday!

The room was nice and clean. It has a safe and mini fridge in the closet. Bathroom has one sink but a big counter to lay all your toiletries on.

The hotel also has a spa, fitness center and a great variety of restaurants: pizzeria, buffet, steakhouse with happy hour ($7 cocktails and flatbreads), señor frogs, kahunaville (which has a tahitian show and latin nights on saturdays), a saloon, frozen yogurt, etc.  During our stay, we got to try the Happy Hour at the steakhouse which was pretty good and used our 2 for 1 voucher that they give you upon check in for the buffet and that was unfortunately very bad (see separate review).  

I also checked out their pool which was a bit small but nice with cabanas and music.

I was a little apprehensive about security due to previous reviews but felt safe especially because they had security guards checking room keys by the elevators.

This hotel is not the hippest but not cheesy as I imagined it.  I would come back if the price is right!

Good:
nice remodel
clean rooms
decent prices
fast room service
pho restaurant inside casino

Bad:
"resort fee"
no nightclub inside
super long check in lines

Although the hotel has removed much of the pirate theme (unfortunately?), the hotel itself was great and I would stay here again. The hotel is not as giant as some of others, so it isn't overwhelming to walk around. The rooms were pretty clean and really big - especially the bathrooms (though the shower heads could be replaced with nicer ones). Beds were comfortable and had nice blankets and sheets. We even had a nice view of the strip and the pool. I thought the rooms were just as nice as they looked in photos. Price was unbeatable. Lines to check in weren't too bad either. Not too many kids, hotel felt safe as they check your room key prior to entering the elevator areas. Seemed to have a decent amount of machines for gambling. CVS inside the hotel too nice a nice plus. Pool area was also very pleasant - though the DJ came on at noon and was way too loud for an older crowd so we left the pool area. Nice that they have a tram that goes from TI to the Mirage. 
The biggest \/ main con to staying at this hotel is the SMELL. It was SO smokey. The vents in the hotel ceiling were black. They need a better ventilation system for the smoke. It was unbearable to walk through the hotel because of the low ceilings. For this reason, I'm not sure I would stay here again. It was just a horrible, stale smokey smell that you cannot get out of your hair\/clothes.
Bedbugs!!!!  Need I say more?  My kids stayed here memorial day weekend and called  hotel management but it didn't seem to phase them.  So gross.  Unfortunately they do not let you post no stars.

How does the front desk guy still have a job?

Disclaimer: This is a true story. I did not leave out any facts and I have no personal bias against TI. I've been Yelping since 2011 and rarely do I write a scathing review unless I think something unreasonable happened that the public should know.

The day after we made our reservation, the room rates went down. So we called to find out whether TI does price adjustment, and if not whether cancellation was possible.

We called around 1:00 AM and apparently the reservation department was closed, so we got transferred to the front desk. Some guy picked up. He sounded like a young guy in his early 20s and annoyed. (I will not give out his name out of respect for his personal privacy, but TI should know who worked the 1:00 AM shift this day if they really wanted to find out.) We called and gave him our reservation number. He pulled up our account. We asked him if price adjustment was possible and if not, if we are eligible to cancel our reservation. He paused for a few seconds and said,

"It's been canceled." and hung up the phone. 

Let me repeat this in case you didn't catch it the first time. He hung up on us. This entire conversation with him took place within 1 minute. If you are wondering whether we were unreasonable or rude on our part, I assure you we were not. We couldn't have pissed him off in 1 minute. We called, asked the question, and after several seconds, got the hung up.

I was sort of in disbelief\/shock for a good several minutes about what just happened. I texted my friends who had been to TI to ask if their customer service was this rude. They said no, and that guest services are usually friendly and accommodating, and that this kind of treatment usually never happens in ANY Vegas hotels.

About an hour later I found out that the show tickets we bought as a package deal would cost us cancellation fees. So we called back to reactivate the reservation. The same guy picked up. He said, "ok so you only canceled about an hour ago... and you still wanna come in on X day?" I said politely as possible, fearing he might put us in some crappy room, "Yes please. Thank you."

He said, "Ok I'll note it... (pause)... bye." and hung up the phone before I hung up.
I checked my reservation about half an hour and it was still canceled. It was 2:30 AM by then so I went to bed to check the next day.

I checked this morning for my reservation. IT WAS STILL CANCELED. This guy never followed through with the "note." I had to call the reservation department to reinstate it.

So there you have it. I understand that this guy might had a bad day but he is still representing someone else's business\/livelihood. He has to work with some level of professionalism. I don't understand how TI management does not review employee phone calls and how they can let these rogue employee be the face of the hotel. At this point, my only prayer is that I won't be stuck in some crappy room in retaliation and I won't be further harassed during my stay with inconveniences.

The Good:
1. Location
2. Decent size room with a nice view despite being a "Hotwire Customer". 
3. Early check-in (10 am) - not a problem
4. Late check-out (2 pm) - not a problem

The Bad:
1. The so-called "Resort Fee" supposedly includes free Wi-Fi which does NOT work pretty much anywhere in the hotel. Plus, TI is NOT a resort so the whole thing is a rip-off
2. Bathroom - no ventilator, no shower caps, no q-tips. Ugly old towels.
3. TV - very small for the room size 

Overall, TI is a good budget choice with great location in the middle of the strip, but I doubt I'll ever stay here again.

The rooms here are pretty decent. They were very helpful getting the in laws checked in. The hotel is clean and offers many amenities for all kinds of people.

The parking here is really easy whether you are parking in the garage or the valet. It is a great location to get to many other casinos and also the mall. 

It is also home to Mystere which is a great show and I highly recommend it. They also have great restaurants here, a favorite is Stack.

All in all I really like Treasure Island and all it has to offer. You can also find great deals online. The only bad thing is that it seems that all of the hotels now on the strip are charging the resort fee of 25.00 and that is really just a joke. Every time someone sticks a penny in a machine, that is their resort fee.

Good check-in, updated rooms. Nice beds. very poor casino floor, Expensive ($8.50$) casino floor drinks.  bad vanilla air "freshener". Expensive room service, no customer service to be found. Unhelpful casino hosts.  Small pool, wickedly exensive pool drinks. ($8 beer, $24 rum runner .wow! )  no decent restaurants. Be prepared to leave for food.  Top fail: $20 resort fee in addition to room rate for no good reason. Factor this into your room cost. Very poor "included" night club: see Audigier

Very affordable and comfortable room, is a very brief synopsis of TI.  

The service was friendly and almost overly efficient.  We called the front desk for extra towels and toiletries and were sent a huge stack of towels and a heaping bag of every type of travel sized potion you can think of, enough for 3 of us to take home at least 2 of each kind.  The room had a great view and was within walking distance of all the attractions we wanted to visit.  Great place to shower and nap, as that is really all it was used for.

I'll give Treasure Island a glowing review for a few reasons:

1) It's literally across the street from the Fashion Show Mall, if you're a girl (although this may apply to some guys), you'll appreciate not having to trek down the hot ass strip to buy some extra accessories, last-minute shoes, or a new outfit altogether before going out that night. Total score! And also, if you don't want to spend hoards of money on food, you can enjoy the mall's Food Court and all it has to offer.

2) It's adjacent to many of the hottest nightclubs: XS, Tryst, Surrender, TAO, LAVO, JET, Pure etc. Yes, you have to take a cab to Marquee, but that's only one club compared to the handful that are within walking distance from the TI.

3) The rooms are comfortable and housekeeping was friendly [unlike some housekeepers that give extreme attitude]. 

4) There's a Walgreens across the street. I can't even begin to tell you how many times we walked over there for crap that we forgot to pack. Total score #2!

Why the TI is 1 star short from the full 5:

1) Our room was right above the stunt show that they perform 100x a day between the hours of 10AM-12AM (I'm making those times up), but that doesn't matter, what matters is how NOISY and obnoxious it was to be awoken by gunfire, bellowing, and splashes everyday! UGH. 

If we had a different room location, TI would for sure have 5 stars from me.

Disgusting stay away !!! Rooms smell horrible place has not been remodeled probably the worst service and customer support I've ever gotten at any Las Vegas hotel they credited me $40 dollars for my unconvinced after they switched 3 different rooms. Sheets were torn apart. Air condition inside room is loud doesn't let you sleep. Water barely goes down the drain in the bathroom as well as shower.

Me and hubby finally got to go some where without our kids and we chose Vegas of coarse.  Stayed at the Treasure Island.  Check in took about 15 mins with the wait in line but that is to be expected when everybody seems to land at the same time but once we got up there it was wham bam thank you ma'am.  We got the petite suite on the 34th floor right off the elevator which you appreciate on those late nights didn't have to stagger down a hall only had to stagger just a bit.  Had a beautiful view of the mountains.  Bed was ahhhhhhhhhhh no other way to describe it.  Love the fact that you needed a key to use the elevators because my hubby's brother and wife would have to call for us to come down and meet them they just couldn't show up lol.  So in a way it kept the riff raft away.  The 2 bathrooms were great especially the whirlpool tub another ahhhhhhhhh there.  Didn't really watch tv while I was there I mean come on who goes to Vegas to watch tv.  Rooms were clean however you do have to call housekeeping when you get there to get a do not disturb sign cause everywhere I have ever stayed at they are always missing.  Casino floor is clean.  Room Service I enjoyed alot.  Buffet was excellent.  The mexican restaurant ah not my cup of tea didn't really enjoy that.  They have a tram that will take you over to the Mirage which is right next door.  Venetian is right across the street and so is a Walgreens so get your soveniers there alot cheaper than buying in the hotel\/casinos.  All of the staff were very friendly and helpful.  Never had to wait for a taxi the workers made sure we got one right away.

WOW! The service was amazing here, had a quick check in and the desk definitely helped us out with all of our needs. We also ordered room service and it was quick! The food was amazing. Definitely a nice place to stay, the rooms were super clean and I absolutely loved how it was laid out. I shared a room with two of my girl friends and two queen sized beds and a lot of space to put our stuff was perfect!

Un bon endroit pour claquer du fric ! tout est fait pour que vous en dépensez un max ! ( Vegas...) c'est le jeu....! les pools party sont top avec le DJ, de superbes créatures vous serviront des bières jusque dans la piscine : a faire entre potes....!

I wish I had checked the reviews before we choose this hotel. The pool is just so-so fairly small. I thought it would be family friendly. And it closed early for a party which was a bummer for the kids. No free wi-fi- sucked for the kids too. The food in the hotel really sucked too. Only plus was Starbucks but the prices $12 for two talls???? They did offer free valet that was nice. And for $30 check out at 3pm. Liked that too. We found it nicely located to shopping and other hotels (with better food).

The check in service was great. The lady who helped us get settled was so nice and gave us drink tickets!

The rooms were a good size, beds were comfortable and everything was clean. I wish the bathrooms were a bit bigger but that's only because we have 5 girls in a room. 

Definitely a good location on the strip!

This is an excellent property. It is located right on the Strip.  The hotel has many restaurants and bars inside. The registration lobby is large and inviting. The casino floor is large and smoke-filled.  My spacious room on the 26th floor was very large, clean, and quiet, with 2 comfortable queen-size beds, a flat-screen TV, work desk. The bathroom was spacious, clean, and well-lit. The internet speed was great. The pool was large, clean, inviting, and used by many of the guests. I would choose to stay at this property again in the future.

If you're in Vegas with a smaller group (less than 4), TI is a great option.

The rooms are affordable, yet clean.  The beds are comfortable.  The main downside is the lack of food options downstairs.  Gambling tables downstairs have $10 minimums at certain times of day - great for novice gamblers such as myself!  The sports room is large and has comfortable seating.  

Their suit style rooms are large with one king size bed and a long couch.  Lots of floor space but little sleeping space, not sure how I feel about this.  I'll probably just stick with their standard rooms if I stay in TI.  There are always sales going on too so you can get a great deal all year round!

This place is ok. If you're a no frills or budget conscious type of person this place may be for you. The room we got was decent. A bed and bathroom. It wasn't old\/dirty but it wasn't posh. Housekeeping was good. 
There is no high-end eateries besides Social House. Not to say good food is only at trendy places. We all know that's not true. But you want to go to a few uber nice places while in Vegas. The buffet is awful. 
The casino does look dated. The craps dealers were funny and good to us. Drink service was decent. 
TI is in a great location, next to Fashion Show Mall and right across the street from the Big Four(Venetian\/Palazzo\/Wynn\/Encore). 
I would say if you have a modest budget stay here and cross the street to get your fun on.

I would leave a ZERO star rating if I could!!  This hotel was awful!  The beds were so old that 3 days into my 6 day stay I had to change hotels.  There was no problem when checking out and I was told I would receive a refund for the remaining part of my stay within 24 hours.  Not the case.  Now 4 days later I am to spend hours of my time on the phone trying to get my refund.  One of managers is lying stating that I said I had an emergency and that is why I had to leave.  I NEVER said that!  They are asking for a medical note to refund my remaining days!!  I NEVER had an emergency!  This hotel is a joke.  Pay a few extra dollars and stay at a better hotel!!

Treasure Island is better off close down. I booked a double queen room 4 months ago for tonight and the check in manager told me they are overbooked and can only give me a king bed room or get out. Helloooo I booked 4 freakin months ago!!! The managed Orzan something is SUPER RUDE, at 11:45pm Xmas Eve after I have booked and paid for a deposit 4 freakin months ago and after 10hrs drive to Treasure Island, he told me they have no double queen room, ask me to settle for King room or get out. HELLO?!!! Is this how you run a business?

We've stayed here twice now and so far it hasn't disappoint. The staff, from the valet to the buffet crew, is really nice and friendly. Since we've stayed here before we were sent an invitation for a two night stay for free. We didn't have to wait in line when we checked in and the front desk rep who helped us hooked us up with nice coupons and a room with a panoramic view of the strip! It pays to be really nice with your front desk person :)

As far as the casino is concerned it is well kept and the waitresses who helped us get our drink on were fast and friendly. I guess they need to be on it to get their tips in order and have you drunk to the bones so you'd gamble your ass off. But all in all, I'd say they're really good.

The restaurants we've visited have varied reviews and I'd probably review it individually. Overall id say it's ok since you get a wide range of options to choose from. There is just one incident wherein we had a bad run through with a staff in the bar who capitalized on our confusion while figuring out how to work our free plays on a machine on the bar. 

Overall, TI is a really decent place to stay in while in Vegas.

With TI's renovation, I'd have to say that the stay here was nice.  Our room was clean and equipped with the basics for a Vegas stay (considering you're not spending a lot of time in the room).  The casino itself is decent.  I think the best part of this hotel is the convenient location in the middle of the strip.  And the fact that Starbucks is located inside (but plan on long lines at almost any time of the day).

Overall if the price is right, I'd stay again.

Great location on the strip, very nice rooms! The beds are very comfy and the pillows are ahhhmazing. We got lucky and got a great view of the strip from the 24th floor. Problem is they charge a resort fee which was a surprise. The casino is extremely smoky along with this lingering perfume smell and they had broken slots all over the place. A wonderful stay though.

While roaming the internet for all things Vegas, a pop up ad for Treasure Island teased me with rates up to 50% off.  By signing up for TI Members Only emails, I gained access to incredible bargain rates that tipped the decision for our stay to Treasure Island.  We liked that fact that TI isn't one of those behemoth hotels that requires a 20 minute hike to get to your room.  Plus, rooms were recently remodeled and our deal came with two free buffets.

At check in, we were told our room had a resort view (i.e., overlooking the pool).  While technically true, we ended up with a great view of the Strip, looking south.  We were also given a buy one get one free buffet coupon for a weekday lunch or dinner.

Our room was obviously fairly new, with lots of dark wood and a modern design.  We were especially impressed with how large the bathroom was.  The carpet was a busy pattern designed to hide dirt, but closer inspection revealed a carpet in serious need of steam cleaning.  There were lots of stains.  The rooms also aren't very soundproof and you might consider bringing earplugs to block out the noise of late night revelers and slamming doors in the wee hours.

TI has a great selection of in-house restaurants.  The buffet space is also recently remodeled and very attractive.  We used our freebie coupon for dinner and enjoyed an expansive buffet with a Southern themed menu for the main section - bbq, sweet potatoes, greens and chicken fried steak were all passable.  It was supplemented with a pasta performance station, baked potato bar, a basic sampling of Chinese food, some Mediterranean appetizers and sushi.  The best part was the made to order salad station and the dessert buffet.  Do not pass up the mini donuts with caramel icing that have been warmed under a heat lamp!  Or the chocolate dipped strawberries!  We were surprised, and disappointed, to find the exact same menu a couple of days later at lunch, with the exception of the baked potato bar which had been replaced by out of the box frozen seafood selections.

Canter's Deli was incredible, offering large portions of delicious fare at affordable prices.  Think typical Jewish deli.  The matzo ball soup and pastrami sandwich are real treats and not to be missed.  Kahunaville is a party bar that opens for breakfast, too.  Be on the lookout for someone handing out coupons in the casino for their $7.99 breakfast special.

Treasure Island may not have the glitz and glam of some Las Vegas resorts, be we found it to be a great value in a great location.

Treasure Island was the perfect hotel for my first trip to Vegas. We stayed here for three nights (Tuesday, Wednesday, Thrusday) and were so excited by the great location. Across the street from Palazzo and The Venetian, and literally connected by an indoor tram to The Mirage. Also an easy walk to Ceasars Palace as well.

The casino was a bit smaller than other resorts on the strip, but we liked this because it was easy to navigate, and less crowded. There are a few resaurants and several cool bars here as well. We didnt go to Gilleys (the country bar) but definitely want to check it out on our next trip. Kahunaville bar was cheesy, but the buy one get one drink specials and bartenders doing tricks made it worth stopping into for a drink or two.

Our room was a tad small, but very updated and comfortable. Beds were cozy and clean and the view even at the back of the hotel was a great mountain view. 

Check in was a breeze but we did arrive late on a Tuesday night. When we left Friday morning the line was easily 200 people long.....and thats not an exagerated number. I counted 20 and didnt even get halfway down one row of a snaked line that bent around at least six times. So my point, try to arrive on a weekday or later in the afternoon if possible. 

Overall, we loved TI and will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Vegas.

We had a pretty good to upgrade to the tower suite when I booked over phone. Though initially there was some confusion in finding our room on the agreed rate, the lady at check-in was very helpful and we finally got our room. Tired we were with Vegas as our last stop on the road trip, I was pretty pleased with the view and the room service. The view could have got better if we were on higher floor or the side facing Bellagio or Caesar Palace. 17th floor wasn't bad after all. 4 stars is simply for the room with 1 star lost on the 'yukky' bad on the BOGO buffet.
totally loved T.I. it was my man & i first time stay in T.I. and it was beautiful from the casino, the rooms, the view, decor, overall, etc. It would be a place i would stay at again.

Love love LOVE the beds here at Treasure Island and for the price you pay it's actually one of the best places mid-strip for convenient access to everything you want and more. If I decided not to ball out on a trip to Vegas this and Paris would be my two places that I would love to stay. The hotel itself is classy but has a nice atmosphere that's half themed, half not. The pirates show in the front is a nice little touch about five times a night and the casino is quite a happening place despite the fact that when I was here I did not find any $5 tables ... although the economy may have changed that recently. 

The rooms have sort of a grey-ish theme to them and the beds are so comfortable you never want to get out of them. They're decently sized and the view is okay for the price you pay. The showers are wonderful and everything about the room and the service is just pleasant. It really gives you a nice escape from the busy bustle of Las Vegas but puts you right back there down the elevator if you need another whiff. 

I am especially a huge fan of their 24\/7 cafe because they serve the best fried chicken! I know this is so weird but I actually crave their spicy chicken wings when I go because they make them unique without any sauce and they're spicy and delicious! Definitely was very happy with my stay here.

I would've given this place a 4, maybe even a 5-star rating, but I'll get to that momentarily. 

If there's one thing I don't like, it's spoiled Negative Nancy's that love to complain about how this hotel is not like the Wynn or the Bellagio. It's NOT. Now please stop posting pictures of receipts showing how much you spent at Burberry and Ferragamo for an item made in Vietnam or Sri Lanka. Nobody cares. 

For its price, this hotel is really nice. The rooms have been recently renovated, and its location on the strip is almost perfect. But the main reason why I'm giving it a 3-star rating (I was even tempted to give a 2-star) is because somehow, some way, my protein shakes (of all things) went missing between my arrival and the bell desk taking my luggage upstairs. Now of course they were only $7, and it shouldn't be a big deal. But it's the principle that counts. It was still MY property. So yeah *Kanye shrug*

Pros:
- Nice renovated rooms.
- Safe and fridge in rooms.
- Decent dining options.
- Great location on the strip.
- Great views (if you're lucky).
- Pool is very nice.
- Easy check-in and check-out.

Cons:
- Having to show room key every time at the elevators.
- My frickin' protein shakes went missing.
- Self-parking is all the way in the back.
- Many of the dining places close early and open late.
- TV in room was slow and clunky.

Checked in on Sunday the 12 ..I was greeted by brianne from Oceanside California. I truly felt she went out of her way to help me with my stay..the casino is not to big but that is a huge plus .after check in u can easily find your room elevator. The atmosphere is great with people from all ages and all over the world. I really dnt have any complaints here o yeah there is a cvs on property that has anything u may need . Great stay will stay again when pool is open

Either completely eliminate the quasi-pirate theme and remodel or bring the pirates and royal navy back full force.  This half and half business is nonsensical.  The "Sirens of TI" show is way cheesy and does nothing but cause the sidewalk outside to clog up so people can't walk past.  

If you can manage to get inside past the facade and sharade, the casino isn't half bad and TI is in a pretty good location.  The dining options are decent also.  Don't know about the rooms.

I was in Vegas for a conference earlier this month (5\/6\/12 - 5\/9\/12) and was staying at Treasure Island. My reservation was booked and prepaid through Orbitz. The hotel where the conference was held was booked out which is why I ended up at Treasure Island. Two days into the conference (May 7), I was informed that a new block of rooms were released. So I contacted the front desk at Treasure Island and asked if I can check out two days early, and Ausi (hope I didn't massacre his first name too bad) said I can check out early and a refund will come back through Orbitz. Taking his word, I went ahead, packed my bags, checked out from Treasure Island and moved to the hotel where the conference was held.

On Thursday May 10, I contacted Orbitz to see when would I get a refund, so they put me on hold for around 10 mins while they contacted Treasure Island. After 10 mins, they told me that Treasure Island does not do refunds and that I should go ahead and contact Treasure Island directly. So I did, I contacted the main number (702-894-7111) and after talking to them, they transferred me to the Front Desk. After talking to the Front Desk, I was transferred to the sales department. The woman in sales said that I am a customer of Orbitz, Orbitz is the one who took my money and I should talk with them. I told her I did talk to Orbitz, Orbitz told me to contact the hotel, which is why I'm talking to you now, but she didn't care. When I told I spoke with the guy at Front Desk and he told me not to worry and I can checkout early, she said he wasn't supposed to... However, he did. She said that's not her problem, he wasn't supposed to talk to me in the first place, go contact Orbitz, and went ahead and HUNG UP ON ME!

Even without that, the place is a dump. When I got there on Saturday night, they gave me a smoking room even though I had requested a non-smoking room. They moved me into a non-smoking room on Sunday, but the room didn't have any towels. When I requested towels, they didn't bring them until at least an hour later (I waited for an hour, but ended up having to leave to go to my conference, without a shower or anything). Then this whole refund fiasco happened on Monday. And don't even get me started with the stains on the bed!

Trust me, there are a million other hotels and motels that are better, cleaner and cheaper on the Strip and off the strip. Just avoid Treasure Island at all costs.

I've stayed at New York, New York, the Aladdin, the Golden Nugget, Planet Hollywood, and T.I. This is my LEAST FAVORITE. Had a decent room with a nice view of the strip and the show outside, but it was LOUD, too bright, and there was mold in the grout in my bathroom. Also, the bathroom was something I would expect to find at a Best Western. Definitely the cheapest bathroom of the places I've stayed. In fact, my bathroom is a LOT nicer at home. Felt like I took a step down staying at this place. Hate the location. I could go on. This place is way overpriced for what you get.
Stayed here for Gilley's- still expected to pay cover for poor service in the hotel specifically chosen for my mother's birthday. My opinion, fuck this place

This was one of the more family friendly places I went to on the strip.  They have great customer service and you'll feel very safe here, you are not accosted by people trying to sell you stuff on the casino floor either, like at other casinos on the strip.  I ended up losing money here at the slots, but the decor and friendly atmosphere is nice.  It really felt like a lot of Mom's & Dad's were here, felt very comfortable and relaxing and a good mid range place for those looking to just have a good time.

The one downside to ALL of Vegas and the hotels is the smoking! Ugh! 
However, moving on... its the off season so I wasn't able to have my kids experience the Pirate Show that takes place out front.  

A ton of amenities, everything you could possibly want and need and even things you didn't know you needed.  
Helpful staff, cleanliness and attentiveness certainly a strong suit.  

Much like anywhere in Vegas, prices a little inflated so be prepared to drop some serious coin (& not just in the gambling sense)... bowl of cereal- $9

However, there are deals to be found, fridge in the rooms along with a safe and all your standard items (iron, hairdryer...) suggest buying quick eats and snacks and keep in your room- save your dineros for the exciting adventures and ample shows that you will find EVERYWHERE.

My dad found a package that included staying here. It's an older hotel with a less interesting facade. The room is fine with nothing to complain about, but it won't astonish you. We are catching Cirque De Soleil's Mystere at the theater tonight. Stayed for 3 nights. In the middle of the Strip.

From previous reviews, check in was kind of long for some, our check in was quick and easy. We were still sleep when housekeeping came, when we got ready to leave the room, we called housekeeping and they were up very quick. The room is huge and everything was very clean.

Treasure island was fun! We booked there for a night during our trip and the room was beautiful. Classic contemporary and sleek with a beautiful view. The ceilings were a little low in the casino. That's not a big deal though. Craps was good. We were also given a complimentary trip to the buffet. It was good. Not my favorite on the strip, but definitely a good. I would stay here again.

Room was nonrefundable, and affordable. Upon check-in, only non smoking floor was on top floor, corner view. Had windows on two walls, with view of the strip. Pleasantly appointed, rate was $119 for Sun-Tue. 

The front desk is still really dated, probably the hideous red jackets they were. Guess traveling each week it jumped out to me. 

Wow has the TI show changed. Was a bit to cheesy for me.

we stayed here for 2 days. 5 stars for peaceful place. 5 star for staff friendliness. 5 star for the location (close to almost every place you want to go in the strip). 5 star for NO incidentals deposits on standard rooms.  5 star for almost everything.. I love our stay in treasure island.

To my delight, the rooms here are very nice!! Modernly furnished and decorated, the bathroom was a nice size, comfy big bed, flat screen. I can tell they're trying to re-do themselves with the name change and the rooms, but they should re-do the outside of the place too. The pool area is pretty nice, and the casino has some of my favorite slots. I used the radio in the room to play my ipod while I was getting ready at night too :) Only complaint is that there is no food court, and the coffee shop near the lobby takes forever and a half to bring you your food when you're eating there late at night. Location of the hotel is nice cuz it's close to Caesar's and across from the Venetian and the Wynn.

The three stars could've been four...if we didn't wait and hour and twenty minutes to check-in. Honestly, it was like waiting for a Disneyland ride to check-in with the convoluted snaking line we stood in. When we first got in line (that was enormously long already), there were only three people checking guests in, which was entirely baffling for us guests and extremely irritating, especially considering we drove 10 hours to get there. When we did finally make it to the counter, check-in was quick, painless, and friendly. I just could not get over that ridiculous wait!

The re-model did them well. The room we had was comfortable and decorated well. Everything was clean, and had all of the amenities you would expect from a hotel room. Solid  room for the price.

I'd return, but I'm quite fearful of having to wait in that line again.

If you ever stay in treasure island try to stay in one of their suite.
it's really nice.
I stayed at their premier one bedroom suite which is over 1300 sq ft. with 2.5 bathroom.
the view is amazing, able to see all the action on the strip.
the location of treasure island is really good if you like shopping.
Right next to the fashion show (my favorite mall!)
you can find good deal by booking directly from TI's website.

I stayed here when I went to vegas this last weekend and I thought it was a nice hotel. It was not the fanciest hotel or newest hotel on the strip, but it was a good hotel. There were several restaurants there, and we ate at the coffee shop for breakfast which was pretty good.  The beds were very comfortable, and the view from our room was a really nice view of the strip.  I didn't really gamble at this specific hotel, so I can't comment on that part of the hotel. The location, though, was great, really close to the beautiful Wynn and right on the strip.  The sirens show was alright, it was pretty dumb, and who evers bright idea it was to have fire coming off close to people who were sitting in 100 plus degree weather, should get fired.  Lastly, the pool was a great place to cool off from the sun, but beware on the weekends it is super crowded, and when we were there it was very much like being in cancun on spring break.

Definitely underestimated this place!! While it might lack the fabulosity of the Aeria or Cosmo it certainly makes up for in charm and overall cleanliness of the place. I'll have to admit I was expecting this place to be a little run down but was pleasantly surprised by our rooms being more in the updated side of things. They have a none smoking section which was simply amazing because I cannot stand cigarette smoke. We definitely had a good night sleep since the beds were super comfy! It was like melting into a marshmallow. 

My only dislike for this hotel was the Kahuna restaurant downstairs! Other than that this was definitely a great place to stay.

I had wanted to stay here for years and was recently forced to for a cheer competition.  
The negative:
1.  They no longer have the pirate show.  Other then looking at the ships outside there really is nothing pirate or islandish about it.  
2.  Do not bring kids here.  There is nothing for them to do.  No arcades, no scenery, nothing. 
3.  The options for places to eat are limited.  There are no food courts with options to choose from.  All the restaurants are higher end with the exception of Senor Frogs and the Coffee Shop. 
4.  You will be paid more in wifi then just to risk going over in your data plan. If you opt to you use it good luck getting it to work.  Not one of the people in our group could get access to it all weekend. 

The positive:
1. Hotel is clean and smells good. I couldn't find the air fresheners so I am assuming it's in the vents. 
2.  Its across the street from the Fashion mall that has a great food court at regular mall prices. 
3.  Beds are super comfy but could use heavier blankets. 
4.  The foot court had a ton of options to choose from but the food was just average.  But I must say the place was very clean, and didn't feel like you were in a buffet.  Very well done but again you get what you pay for.  (3 people for $103!!!)
5.  There are two Starbucks which was a huge help considering there are no coffee makers in the rooms.  There are refrigerators which is a nice thing to have when traveling with kids. 
6.  Loved the soap and shampoo they supplied.  smelled and felt great. That's a hard thing to find in hotels these days a well.  
7.  Senor frogs was a fun spot.  
8.  Staff was very nice and helpful. Security guards at room towers could use some personality. 

All in all it was a decent stay but I would not stay there again.  I consider this checked off my bucket list.  I think I will keep to the other side of the strip where things are a little more lively and close.
sure, the Sirens of Treasure Island sexy pirate show is cheesy, but it is entertaining and free.

I was very disappointed with my stay at TI. I took my a large part and rented three rooms for two nights. I had what appeared to be a decent deal through hotels.com. The rooms came with a free buffet for two and were at a comparable rate. At the front desk, I was charged an additional resort fee for $56 dollars a room thus effectively negating the good deal. I was also advised that of the three rooms there was only one non-smoking available, this was at 6pm. With the $56 two day mandatory resort fee, we had the privilege of using the fitness room, using WIFI but only 1 device per room, and daily paper which you had to go to the lobby to pick-up.

The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and clean. There was a small refrigerator and a small safe for personal items. 

I brought a bottle of champagne to celebrate my daughter's twenty-first birthday. I called the front desk to get an ice bucket, there was none in the room, they gladly would bring one up for $5.41. If we wanted Champagne glasses would be an additional $5.41 for 2. 

I was getting slightly annoyed with all the nickle and dime charges for normal services. 

In the morning, I searched for a coffee maker and found none, not included. 

I tried the fitness room. There was a complete gym. The machines were well maintained. They had a nice variety of nautilus machines, cable systems and free weights. There were plenty of cardio machines. 

The free buffets which were included were for lunch 11-1 on weekdays. They offered a two for one special in exchange. They come with an all you can drink addition of $12. All you can drink was limited to Budweiser and cheap wine. After hearing feedback from my children on the buffet, I decided to pay full price for a meal elsewhere.

Next time, I will investigate my choices a little more. I will be staying at another hotel on my next visit to Vegas.

I think it's a beautiful hotel but is a tad bit expensive. They charge you a resort fee whether you use the pool or not. I went in March and it was quite cool so not really worth being outside. 
The hotel smelled a little bit funky almost like a church smell. It was almost overbearing at time. The room was nice and it's cool that you get upfront privileges to see the sirens show. I really liked it but it wasn't the best hotel I've ever stayed in. I think the hotel itself is beautiful.

We stayed here our first trip to Vegas way back when.
I think using hotwire we got a great deal so that was a great start.

The hotel itself is on the smaller side compared to many other larger hotels on the strip. However to me, it's just a place to sleep (if you feel so inclined) and as a base of operations.

Many things are close by and walkable, most of the Strip is actually walkable, albeit you just don't realize how vast some of these casinos are, because it takes so damn long to walk past them all, even one takes 10 mins.

The rooms are functional and ok.
The best thing is the convenience with a tram to Mirage to save your feet partially and ease of getting across the fancier Wynn and Encore.

For the price, I'd stay here again.

Vegas is one of those towns where I feel like you can either be thrifty, or spend a ton of money, but not really do much in between. I had never stayed on the strip before, and the closest my husband had ever gotten was the Stratosphere, so we were happy to be somewhere centrally located. In fact, I think location is TI's strongest suit: you are directly across from the Venetian and Palazzo, and Belaggio and Caesar's are under a mile away. 

We booked our hotel and flight together, and even on a weekend, TI ended up being only about $60 per night, which was a pretty good deal. Overall, the hotel was easy to navigate, clean, moderately priced, and obviously well located. We were supposed to have a cruddy view since we had a discounted rate, but we actually got a corner room, which is slightly larger, and a view of the strip from two sides of our room. The room was comfortable and adequate, and I was overall happy with our choice to stay here.

However, some things did detract from our stay: upon arriving, we had to wait 45 minutes to check in. Yes, it was a Friday, yes it was busy. But guess what? Fridays in Vegas are always busy, so perhaps TI should staff more than 3 people to check in guests, when they have room for at least 10 clerks at their front desk. Of these 3 staff members, 2 spent literally 20 minutes with a group of clients, so essentially only one person was working. He was exceptionally good at his job, but there was only one of him. 
The "resort fee" is $20 a day which is ridiculous. This includes access to the fitness center, and wifi. Wifi is normally $15 per day, but I would rather just not have wifi, or have to pay to use the fitness center. 

Our second night, I was awakened for 2 hours in the middle of the night by an endless stream of hotel guests walking up the stairs and by our room ceaselessly, and loudly. At first I thought it was one rude group, but as it continued I realized something must have gone wrong. Turns out the elevators stopped working, which meant people were having to walk all the way up to their rooms, (we were on floor 17). They were obviously unhappy about it, were loud and drunk and woke up everyone who was asleep. Although TI cannot make people be quiet, they did nothing to make up for this to anyone, including the guests who had to walk up 17+ flights of stairs. 

Although our room was clean, I was surprised that all horizontal surfaces in our room were covered in a week's worth of dust. I found it puzzling that surfaces were not wiped down between guests. Additionally, we passed several discarded room service carts that sat outside our neighbor's room for over 8 hours, and were never cleared.

i was relatively pleased with our stay, but I will not be running to return here if i can find a competitive hotel with a competitive rate.

Definitely a great location! Not a luxury resort to my standard.  Good enough for the price I paid.  Free parking! Friendly staff.  The pirate show outside the hotel was cancelled during my 4 days of stay without a notice.  Many people wasted time waiting outside. The buffet is so so and expensive. The 5-dollar blackjack is a plus.  I would recommend this place.
THE SIRENS OF TI: This is possibly the worst $(%&# I have ever seen. And I have seen some bad #(*%&Y#.

Pros: room is well-decorated, clean, and nicely sized.

Cons: no in-room coffee maker or fridge.  Missing "Privacy Please" hang tag caused an unwanted 8:30am wake up call.  8:30am in Vegas is WAY too early!

TI, this hotel in one form or another has been around for a while. The rooms are smaller than the newer hotels on the strip. The bathroom is a bit rundown and TV is tiny. But it is what it is...a hotel on the strip catering to those who do not want to spend the $$$$ to stay in the higher end hotels.

The room was comp to me...so if I had to pay I don't think I will want to stay here. The rooms are just way too small.

When I arrived inside the hotel (~12am), It gave me a bad impression, because I saw people smoking, people getting drunk, and then there's gambling. (but this is Vegas so whatever)...

Stayed here during my Christmas vacation with my family. We booked two rooms, one with a double bed, and one with single bed, but received two rooms with single king size beds. They asked housekeeping to roll up a bed, and he came two hours later. The housekeeping guy said "here you go" and left the bed by the door as soon as I opened it. That was not okay, because I had trouble rolling the mattress into the room and setting it down. 

The next day, we got a room change to another room with a double bed, but that room was father from the other room we booked and we requested both of our rooms near each other. On the positive side, Both of the rooms had a nice view of the street facing the Trump tower. The beds were comfy, no bed bugs were found, and the rooms were surprisingly clean despite the yelp reviews.

Food was on the pricey side (that's almost everything on the strip), but we only tried the pho while staying there, and ate out for all our other meals. 

There's a CVS on the first floor when you turn right when entering through the front door of the hotel, and the prices are similar to ones back home. I got a naked smoothie for about $3. They also sell souvenirs, some are pricey and some not. 

The part I disliked the most was walking from the parking garage to the hotel room elevators. You have to pass by shop and restaurants and slot machines just to get to the elevators. The part I liked the most was that there was a tram to the Mirage. It was convenient, because we didn't have to walk in the cold or ride the elevator to get there. 

Overall, it was an okay place to stay. The rooms were clean, but it wasn't the room we wanted. I didn't like walking through smoke permeated lobby. The location was near one end of the strip, but that was okay.

The carpet is dirty. They need to remodel the rooms. Everything is outdated. The only reason I book this hotel is convenience. It is walking distance to the mall, Venetian and Walgreens. I got the Southwest Vacation Package. I went there Friday June 17 to Monday June 20, 2011. I see most of the customers drop off the luggage and gamble at other casinos. 
Please remodel!

i stayed here with my company for a show we were doing for the 2nd year in a row and let me tell you the hotel has gone downhill! let start with check in.  looked like it went quickly when the girl checking me in just walks away and disappears for a good 15mins without a word.   She didn't even say to me i'll be right back!  so finally i get into my room and in the bathroom there's facial hair all over the sink that i wiped down myself! GROSS!  the rest of the room was fine.  Then what made me never want to go back there again is the fact that in the end i asked for my receipt for my corp CC and the girl constantly repeated herself over and over again in an obnoxious tone that i just told her to stop talking.  Didn't make any sense and she couldn't explain why she couldn't give me a receipt.  And the icing on the cake is they charge for EVERYTHING now! i needed a humidifier in my room and they wanted to charge me $15 a day for it.  Just so turned off by this hotel and my company will not be staying there next year!

The unofficial good bye."

Each time we stay at T.I. check in is fast and I love that about their customer service. On our last visit they even gave us a bottle of bubbly to welcome us. This time however we stayed with them as official parents so we had to tone it down, a bit.

If memory serves me correctly nothing has dramatically changed. Casino floors still smell smokey even though Nevada is enforcing the 'clean air act.' Tangerine is now replaced with that dude that makes those tacky t-shirt designs, Christian what's-his-name. Our room was on the 25th floor with views of both the strip of the east and beautiful sunsets to the west. 

I do have to complain about their beds and since I've been spoiled with staying in their suites in the past their beds in the deluxe room are one big bust. The mattress was not comfortable at all and found myself rolling down toward the center. Yuck! However I have to give them credit for using high thread count sheets.

Room service was on the pricey side and didn't offer anything interesting for dinner not even from their adjoining restaurants down stairs. I got a cobb salad even though what I really wanted was steak and eggs or a meal from Social House. 

I think it's safe to say we'll be staying next door next time. Thanks T.I.!

The hotel was decent for the price. I have stayed in a lot of hotels in Vegas and this was mediocre. The rooms were comfortable and clean, however it smelt awful! They recycle the smoke filled casino air and it honestly smells worse in the hallway near our room and in our room than it does in the casino. I literally was gagging. Spend a little more and stay in a nicer place. I wouldn't stay here again.

These guys messed everything up during a recent trip. Reservations, arriving and leaving dates etc.  The people out front were horrible in attitude and plain rude.  I will never stay at TI again when I go to Pubcon - from now on ... its all about the Wynn ..... nuff said - don't want to get my blood boiling again - oh yea and they charged me for Internet THAT I DIDN'T USE!!!!!  Still haven't reversed the charges...... (like a pirate - no pun intended -- GRRRRRRRRR)

Let me start off by addressing some of the issues that other yelpers have encountered with this particular hotel and casino.  I found the hotel room to be clean, the bed comfortable, and the service polite. We saw no roaches or spiders or any other vermin. Our bathroom had hot water and there were no cracks in the walls or hair in the sink or shower like I've seen mentioned in other posts. I am only giving three stars because it's still a get what you pay for type of casino\/hotel. The casino floor is smoky but what casino doesn't allow smoking?  This casino however doesn't seem to be well ventilated as other newer  which is probably why the smell of stale smoke is so prevalent. We got this room at a decent price and we didn't have too many complaints.

I have stayed here about half a dozen times. Perfect location, clean rooms and casino. Lots of places to eat. Buffet is great but a little pricey.
Connects to MGM via free tram.

We stayed one night over the memorial weekend. Got there on Sunday around 3pm. The checking in line was long. We were in the line for 45 mins. U can do express check in which charges you $40 with tax. 

We requested the non smoking room and not connected which brought us to 30th floor. The bed is comfy and clean. The bathroom is decent clean with a drier. The only complain is the carpet is dirty I think there was gum. 

I will come back for sure. Even tho its a bit more expensive.
Had the typical two queen beds. The room was clean and very inexpensive. The pool was nice, especially since it was 112 outside. Nothing fancy, but I wasn't expecting it so no let down.

I choose to stay at treasure island because of their good prices and a history of winning in their casino. I didn't have time to gamble this trip so I can't attest if that's true. We arrived around 10:30 to check in and the escalator down to the Lobby from self parking was broken. The elevator was around the corner or you could take stairs. There was no line to check in but the girls working the desk were the most boring, in happy I've ever seen in Vegas. We were informed our reserved king room was not available but we could do two queens and move to the king the next day. We opted to stay in the two queens so we didn't have to repack. After reading the previous reviews of being charged for the room twice I brought cash to pay for the room. The lady asked for the booking card and proceeded to charge the balance due on my card. I stopped her and asked if we could pay cash. She looked at me with attitude sighed and said "you don't want it on the card?" I said no and we finished the transaction she handed us the room keys and didn't tell us about any of the coupons, where room was located or what our room number was. I had to ask her how to get there and she said around the corner.

Our room was non smoking but you could smell the cigarets first thing walking in. The tv sucked, the iron didn't work, moths were flying in from the air vent but everything else was decent. The in room fridge and safe were nice to have. Upon getting ready the first night my shirt got wet from the countertop and there have been some residual clean agent in the counter and it left a bleach stain on my shirt. 

The crowd in the casino consist of older people, cheap tourist and hookers. The tram to the mirage was broken for our entire stay from Thursday through Monday. Not a big variety of food locations especially for later hours although the 24 Starbucks is nice to have so close.

The rooms are clean and you are on the strip other than that it is just average.  Pool is nice but the drink prices are just over the top!  Come on $19.50 for a Mai Tai that was barely average???

I would go back because the rooms are clean and you are on the strip!  I just wish that they would update the restaurants and the interior shops.  Parking is great if you have a large vehicle on the second floor of the lot.  Please tell me why people with little cars park on this floor that is for large vehicles only.  To be honest from the second floor where this parking is located it is a little harder to get into the Casino.  Treasure Island needs to patrol this lot and keep the small cars out...........sometimes it is hard to find a spot to park.

Came here for the Las Vegas Rock N Roll marathon, and this wasn't our first time to Vegas but our first time staying at Treasure Island!  Our friends usually stay here and it was their choice and the positives are 1) location, convenient to the Palazzo through the bridge 2) was convenient for the marathon, 3) has a big fitness room located inside the spa, 4) refrigerator in the room to store cold drinks, water, etc., 5) free bottled water during check-in at the front desk;  minuses are it's an older hotel, still has guards in front of the elevators for security and you need to show your hotel card to enter, casino is smaller than some of the newer hotels.  IF you get a package for the hotel, you can have a pass to the fitness room, 2 for 1 buffet voucher and 2 for 1 drink at one of the bars in the hotel.  There's a resort fee of $28 day for free internet access, newspaper, free boarding pass print out in the business center.  

I think if you're looking for a good deal at a reasonable price, TI is the place.

MEH. girl's weekend.

LOCATION: AWESOME, center of the strip. The location worked out well for a girl's weekend, esp since CVS was across the street (BIG PLUS!!).

Hotel:
A bit old for my taste, especially since we have so many other hotels in the area, but we booked this hotel on Hotwire, so didn't have a choice.

The plus side is that you don't have to pay the resort fee, so saved us a bit of money there.

Service:
The lady checking us in was awesome  she gave us a view of the strip when we asked. Smooth check in and even gave us 4 cards.

However, the guy calling the taxi with red hair seems to lack any sort of filter. We were confused as to who was going to take the first taxi because one of the girls was going back early and we were telling her to take the first taxi. The taxi guy whispers under his breath, "Guess no one speaks English." Why even say that? We did absolutely nothing to aggravate him. I can't believe TI employs people like this. Furthermore, I emailed their guest services directly to complain and haven't heard a response from them.

With so much competition in the area, one would think that TI would have top-notch customer service and am highly disappointed in our experience.

The last time I stayed at T.I. I was the ripe age of 12. This time around I waited 18 years and decided to return. It was for my 3 year wedding anniversary that my Husband and I chose to grab an inexpensive room in the middle of the strip. The check in was super easy, being that it was after 12am. We walked right up to the counter and were given the choice of two different rooms, shown the difference on a map, and explained which of the two was nicer. I slid out there to the desk agent that it was our anniversary and we were issued a complimentary bottle of champagne. (I really wish we had found the time to order it from room service!) We were on the 34th floor but the elevator made it feel like the 9th, a quick trip with elevators easily accessible at all times during our stay. The hallways were always clear of any debris, any other visitors, and always quiet. The room which had two beds was spacious, had a fantastic view, and the perfect air conditioner (something I always seem to complain about.) The bathroom had a decent size tub and large counter area. We really liked that upon opening the closet doors an automatic light would come on inside. We also used the bathroom light up mirror as a night light since the blackout curtains more than made the room dark. We will absolutely be staying at this hotel again and the price is completely acceptable!

Their valet is rude and inconsiderate as heck... The actual valet employees scolds you not only once, but over three times if your car isn't in the right lane then when you go to pick your car up which is in the same valet place you put it in... The rude ass staff tells you this is not valet and makes you walk further down... Like WTF, get it together grouch!

Since we were getting married at the West Chapel we decided to book a Tower Suite via the BOGO special they had going on. The staff and security were very sweet and always eager to help us find our way. The casino floor was laid out perfectly, not too tight. We played a few rounds of Black Jack and a few slots. I'm a hit and run kinda girl so once we won a certain amount I was like time to hit the cage lol. 

The Tower Suite has two bathrooms, one with a stand alone shower, the other with a jacuzzi bath tub. I was grateful for the extra bathrooms and closet space and it was perfect when it came time to get ready for the wedding. The bed is very comfy, no issues sleeping. My only issues with the room was that the sofa was old, faded, and hard it's time for them to get a new one. The carpet raised squares were black and we were afraid to walk around our own room barefoot. They really need to get ride of it because God only knows what is really lurking under there. You can't vacuum up deep built in dirt. Just toss the carpet and start fresh. If you have respiratory issues think twice. 

We will be heading back to Vegas soon, not sure if we'll stay here again or try another hotel on the strip.

I just recently stayed at the Treasure Island in Las Vegas, and i have to say im pretty disappointed. The hotel was okay but when you go yo vegas you expect it to be better then one you can go to close to house. The rooms were dirty the pool was small and only 4.5 feet deep at its deepest. I guess i would of gave them more of an average rating if it wasn't for them leaving a rotten taste in my mouth. They seem to charge me wrongly for everything. I bought my package online and i was giving certain fees and prices for everything.  But when it came time to check out they said they wouldn't honor my prices. The company seems really shady and the customer service there could use some work.

Great experience.  Spent 5 day at TI with my husband and son.  The hotel doesn't have too many family attractions,  but it close enough to many other hotels on the strip with different family options.  Pools is pretty small and family appropriate.  Great, clean, and comfortable rooms.  Staff was great.  Casino doesn't smell too much like smoke.  Only con would be the buffet.  I don't recommend eating at their buffet.

I've stayed at TI since I was 5 years old, when it was the old Treasure Island, aimed towards kids. They've now renovated it to TI aimed at men?
Before it was the hotel arcade, now it's Hooters. Before it was the pirates vs the English. Now it's big boobed sirens vs sexy pirate men.
Ha either way, my family and I still love TI
We've stayed at all the hotels along the strip (The Wynn, Luxor, Paris, Bellagio, etc)
But when making a quick, easy, last minute trip to Vegas, we book TI
You can't beat some of the ridiculously cheap deals 
Great rooms with views of the strip
Good buffets & restaurants
Will continue to stay at TI when in Vegas!

After staying at Bellagio, this really felt like a step back.  I found the casino to be OK, the rooms were furnished good, although you could see where they had begun to do upgrades, yet they had not made it impossible to tell.

I found the buffet to be quite good for breakfast and lunch.  But I will say the casino floor has a smell that is not very pleasant and it seemed to be present on most of the casino floor.

OK now for that sirens show.  I could not help but think I was watching a bad Britney Spears video.  Oh well and after several trips to Vegas, I have managed to spare my partner from seeing this spectacle.

Overall, a good resort but there are so many more that are better.

And oldie but goodie. Haven't stayed here in a while and had some friends stay here over the weekend and went to check it out again. Great place for a decent price. Good location if you're looking for things in that area.

I stayed here the 1st week of January and I got a great rate for a 3 night stay. The room I booked was what they called a "Petite Suite" it included two bathrooms and the option of a one king bed or two queen beds. The room was great and one of the bathrooms had a spa tube and the other one had a spacious shower, there was also plenty of closet space.  The hotel casino has great slots and the buffet was also good. My main complaints are that the room refrigerator didn't work well at all, I may as well have kept my beverages outside of it because the temperature in the fridge felt like the room temp. The other negative was that booking the room was a bit of a pain in the ass because according to the booking staff you may request that you get two beds in your suite but they do not guarantee that they will give it to you, for this reason they recommended that I show up on the day of my check in at 11am because they sometimes honer an early check- in and the double bed rooms go to first come 1st serve. Me and my party arrived at 11am, I waited in a long line and was told that my room was not ready and to come back within 2 hours. After waiting for two hours once again my room wasn't ready, apparently it hadn't been cleaned! We didn't get our room key until 3pm and had I known that, I wouldn't have gotten their so early. They also ended up telling me at check in that they required a $300 deposit  that was not mentioned at all at the time I booked my room. Overall in spite of the check in issues the place was a great place to relax, I strongly recommend that you check out their Spa and get a message. Lastly,  the hotel staff was pleasant with the exception of the valet parking guys! These guys were very rude and pushy and expected a tip even though they provided crappy service.

So, the room was nice, no doubt. Large enough, "ok" view, and super bathrooms. But there is absolutely NO customer service at this place.  
We went this weekend for our 25th Anniversary. I asked, when booking, to have something special in the room, like strawberries, chocolate covered ones, or something fun to acknowledge the occasion. I was told on the phone, I would have to request that with the front desk when I checked in. BUT....she said, we can have a complimentary bottle of Champagne waiting for you...
I told her that would be great, but could it be Cider. My wife doesn't drink....."ok, we can do that"
Got to the hotel, and as directed, I asked the front desk about having something special sent to the room.....I didn't mind paying for it...I wasn't looking for them to cover the cost, I just wanted to have something fun sent up. 
Front Desk:...."hold on a second"....goes to a manager and a minute later comes back, and says, "sure, we can have room service take care of that, and they will add it to your bill."...Cool. Sounds good.
Front Desk:...."oh, but we CAN have a complimentary bottle of Champagne sent up"....I said, no, I had asked for Cider...."Oh...ok, we can do that".

Ok, great....so Im set.
Right?....WRONG...

No strawberries show up, no bottles of anything show up the whole day. 
So, I get this random text from the hotel...asking if there's anything I need. I said, YES !!...the strawberries and\/or Cider.
Never a response came. 
Never a strawberry came.
Never a bottle, of anything came. 
Never a word from the hotel, management, room service...

So, TI, you stink !!

You pretty much only get one 25th Wedding Anniversary in life. I won't ever stay at the TI again. That I'm sure .

I stayed here 5 years ago and was unimpressed. Since then, they did a major overhaul... retheming the hotel from pirates to sirens (think scantily clad sea hussies). The rooms were reasonably priced yet well designed, the staff responsive, and the "scene" at the hotel was hopping. I'd stay here again for sure!

I did not stay in the hotel but did visit the casino and a few of the places inside the hotel. My first experience was at the country bar in the lobby. We had a great time, no complaints! The beer was cold and the music was good. On another night we walked over to check out the casino on a casino crawl and I personally found the interior to be pretty dated and drab. The smoke was out of control, the ventilation system could use a tune up I think. All in all it sort of is what it is... if that makes sense. Next trip I'll try to make it over to the pool and see another side of this place.

I really like this hotel the rooms are decent and clean. All the employees are nice except the guy the works at the entrance of the pool and the stupid rules about brining drinks into the pool from outside the hotel I had to chug mine just so I could sit near the pool. I don't wanna have to buy one of their expensive drinks just so I can drink out there.

They would not let my wife go up the elevators because she forgot her room key. The security guy was very rude and inconsiderate. Not to mention the restaurants are just awful. I've stayed here a few times but I won't be back.

I chose TI mainly because I was planning on seeing Mystere, and liked the location. I had also read great reviews about the bed, so here is my experience!

Check in: Very smooth, We were checking in at about 9pm so I was surprised to see about 10 people in front of us, but the line moved quickly and the woman that checked us in was very pleasant. We booked a tower suite, and she asked us smoking or non. We said whichever was located higher up, and while she phoned to find out the answer, she grabbed us an envelope with a bunch of promotions inside. We were given a complimentary drink ticket and a 20% off dinner to Kahunaville, a 2 for 1 buffet ticket, 2 free passes (44 dollar value) to the spa, and free entry into the night club. It also included a VIP ticket to the Sirens show, but I hear you can get VIP access with just your room key.

Tower Suite: Our room ended up being 32-011 (non smoking). Rooms 30 and up have their own elevators where you have to enter your room key so it will recognize what floor to stop on. Nice touch, it sure made me feel special! The room was HUGE. Very clean, spacious, and looked just like the pictures I have seen. The his bathroom has a glass door shower with the "rain" like shower head. The closet is small with sliding doors and a safe inside. The hers bathroom is much larger with lots of counter space, a make up area complete with a seat and a vanity mirror, a spacious closet with a dresser and plenty of hanging space, and a whirlpool tub. The room has a flat screen TV which is very nice and has plenty of channels. The rooms are dim even with several light fixtures, but this was fine with me. There is a couch which is pretty comfortable, a fridge, a dining table, and the double doors to the room is a beautiful touch. We slept in this room the first night, but the boy decided to switch rooms the next day because the bed had a rather deep dip in it on one side, when the tub was turned on sand came out of the faucet, and the fridge didn't work. Our second room was 7-050 which ended up being our room for the next 3 nights. It was still a tower suite, but the main room was slightly smaller. Everything worked well, the only problem we had with the second room was the bed. While it was plush and comfortable, apparently they don't have sheets that fit it, and the boy was really upset when we crawled into bed and our feet were touching bare mattress. He requested the bed to be changed, and when the maids came to replace the bedding,they had to try several different sheets before they could find one to cover it. Even after that fiasco, the sheets would slip around and expose the mattress because they are not fitted. Kind of odd, but a minor problem. Oh yes, and all of the reviews I read they talk of the ipod dock clock radio in the rooms, so I didn't bother to bring my ipod charger. Neither room that we had had the ipod dock. The first room was a bose machine, the second was just some generic clock radio. Oh well, didn't really need the ipod besides for the plane ride home! We got a movie one night and was surprised by their extensive movie choice list. If you want to call it a night and want to relax with a movie you won't be disappointed!

Room Service: We ordered room service twice which was very quick and not too pricey. Always try to order between _:10 and _:20 because they deliver on the 1\/2 hours. Our food was piping hot and made right before coming up. I would suggest the chicken tenders and the clubhouse sandwich. Both delicious! Do not make the mistake I made of ordering soda to the room. 3 bucks for each can when all I had to do was step out of my room, walk 10 feet and get 20 oz. bottles from the vending machine for the same price. Oops! Vending machines also have vitamin water which we both love.

Casino Floor: Rather small compared to other casinos, but I liked it a lot. Had a very cozy feel.
