I dont know what everyone is freaking about... the resort fees- everyone on the strip, or almost everyone has them. they cover the wifi, the newspaper, water bottles in the room, 20 dollars off your next stay vip passes to the sirens show and to the ed hardy themed club or whatever it is.., etc.... basic things. When I complained about it to the supervisor- because last time i stayed i didn't pay (they just passe this on Oct 1st) she gave me 2 breakfasts for me and my husband for our upcoming trip and bumped us up for free to the petite suite again like we had for our honeymoon, and paid under 400 for that with taxes, fees and all that for 4 nights.

I think Isla is a great place, a little pricey but worth it. The casino itself to me was a bit small, but the view we had with our room in October was amazing and had a great strip view. WE saw the mystere too, which was ok- if anyone saw knocked up, its the show they saw in that.

overall, we cant wait to come back in Aug for my husbands birthday. Another plus noon checkout, and if you call they bump it to 1. a great bonus on top of the remodeled rooms and BEST beds Ive ever slept on.

For the price they charge you to stay here, it's not worth it. 

This hotel has seen better days. It's dated, run down and quite frankly not much better than a motel 6. 

The rooms reek of marijuana, and the air conditioning is LOUD!!!

Complaints to management did nothing to stop the rampant drug use that was occurring during my stay on my floor and the solution to fix the A\/C was to turn it off. 

Bathroom in the room I stayed in was in disrepair. The toilet was cracked and the shower had no place to put the bar soap, shampoo or anything else you like to use while bathing (face wash, shaving etc...)

Over all I would avoid this overpriced, older hotel in favor of one worthy of my hard earned dollar.

Dirty glasses in the room never took the old towels out the bathroom , check out was not the best when asked how was my stay ,never once asked how can we help your next visit  so I would want to come back...

TI is a nice hotel. The rooms were very clean and the bed is very comfy. The bathroom was also decorated very nice to. The strip view was also great. The show at the ship is hussys not for familys. The restaurants in TI are ok. The christian Audiger night club your able to get in for free if your staying at the hotel an can get free drinks from 10-1am if your a girl an talk to the promoter standing at the front of the club at 5pm. Great hotel would stay there again.

My first vegas hotel experience. I got this room at a very affordable price for 3 days.. top it off i never play cards especially in casinos, my cuzzin kept on pushing to gamble and join the table which i did "free drinks" lol and i wouldnt believe it, i won $400 =] guess what i cashed out and spent that later on in the night..the rooms where great and very clean..the beds are comfortable to the extreme. Did not have one problem with Ti..

We were lured by the cheap prices. $300 dollars for a 950 sq. ft. suite. The suite looked really nice online. Very modern but maybe somewhat cheesy. We were deciding between the Wynn and TI. We knew the hotel itself at TI would not be great, but we felt like we wouldn't be spending much time there anyway. The location was good so we went for it.

When we checked in at around 9:30 pm. The first thing I noticed was that the carpet in the check in area was kind of dingy, but I didn't expect anything spectacular. When we checked in they informed us that our room had been downgraded from the Tower Suite to the Executive Suite. We said we had not requested the downgrade nor had we been informed of it. They got the manager. He said that the person in the Tower Suite that we were supposed to get had not checked out yet, so they had to downgrade us to the only other available suite. they automatically reduced our rate by $40 per night. We asked if we could be upgraded instead of downgraded, but they said they didn't have any  nicer suites available. In the end, they agreed to take an additional $20 each night. They forgot to take the additional $20 off for the second night, but that is a different story.

After all that annoyance, we got to our room and the room was just fine. It was basically the same as the Tower Suite, but just a little smaller. It was perfectly fine and a steal at $240 per night.

I am glad we stayed there this time because the low price offset our blackjack losses. But... I wouldn't stay there again.

Ok hotel, but rather overpriced and doesn't really offer anything that cool. Rooms were so so. I would definitely not stay here again. Also, for the prices you pay, I really wish they didn't charge you an additional 13 bucks\/day for wi-fi and 20 bucks\/day for the gym. Rip-off! Also, their buffet really kinda sucked compared to a lot of the others I have been to. The saving grace was the Canters and the Mexican food place that had $10 premium margaritas (in a city where drinks are averaging around $14 - this was a find!).

Great hotel and casino! Had a wonderful time.
   Lupe, the slot host is awesome. she is very kind and acknowledged my slot play and was generous with comps.  
  I know I will be back there soon. 
The rooms a huge and very very nice. What a great pool party and DJ they have.
   It just doesn't  get any better than treasure island!

i got to stay here TWICE because of work - i really cant complain about it but when your boss is staying at the venetian, IT IS A REASON TO COMPLAIN.

you get hotel envy.

for the most part, I HATE THE FACT THAT THE CASINOS, THE BAR, CANTERS DELI, and MIST BAR is just PLAIN DREARY. its like all the fuglies and the losers of vegas are here. UGH.

i ended up going to christian audigier nightclub because my other friends were in town - its not a bad club, its pretty okay, i believe. no cover for hotel guests just made me go. hahaha. (that and i had to wake up at 6am to get ready for work)

my room was okay, the king size bed was nice and comfy and the nice people at the front desk put me in a low floor near the elevator room. i love the fact that i was there because the last time i stayed my room was at the end of nowhere - working 12 hour days and walking a block and a half from the elevator to my room is no joke. (and no, i didnt mind that i had a view of the airconditioning unit of the hotel)

sadly the remote control and the tv was retarded AND THE HOTEL ROOM HAD NO FRIDGE. (weird)

the TOILETRIES SUCK BIG TIME, seems to me that its the same brand that budget hotels use just in a different container.

the bellboy who took my luggage at the belldesk WAS EXPECTING A TIP WHEN HE DIDNT EVEN TAKE THE THING FROM MY ROOM. really? what a dick. a tip for writing my name on a claim tag and chatting a little bit? (acting like a prostitute much?) 

id probably stay here again next  year because im not paying for my stay, but if i was, id rather go somewhere else.

there is definitely no treasure in this island. LOL

Went here for my 21st birthday and overall enjoyed my time. The machine payouts were mediocre but the hotel service was great. I loved the theme of the hotel and overall atmosphere the most. The room was very clean and happy they had security checking room keys before letting guests go up the hotel room floors (since the casino did get very busy from non hotel staying patrons). Overall enjoyed my stay and recommend.

Recent reviews got me worried before i came to TI. However, my 2 night stay turned out okay. Checkin was fast and easy. The buffet food was not too bad for buy one get one free. service was nice. Room and hallway were clean.

Just finished staying here with the wife for a couple days. Part of our little road trip. Treasure Island is pretty nice. That's the best way of putting it. Location is kind of centralize. Staff was very courteous and we had no complaints. 

I think some of the reviews have to do with the fact that this is Vegas. So instead of reviewing and rating the resort on its own, people review it comparing it to the Venitian, Ceaser Palace, and what not. Yeah, those resorts are a bit nicer and of course fancier but that's why there 2-3x times more expensive. 

All and all, the wife and I were pleased. It didn't break the bank and it was a nice resort.

The hotel in itself was very nice: walkable to the higher end hotels on the north end of the strip, KahunaVille had tasty affordable eats and Señor Frogs was a great free place to boogie down. That being said the resort fee was $28 per day and on a 3 night stay we paid about $84 NOT WORTH IT. The fee included some crappy coupons and Wifi that was so terrible I ended up turning It off and just using my 4G. Unless I get free rooms here I will NOT be staying here again.

Great Location!

- The room was nice, we were on the 33rd floor.  The view was wonderful, it was facing the strip.  
- 5 minute walk to Fashion show mall.  And 7 minute walk to Wynn and Encore.  
- There are restaurants inside the hotel, and star bucks too!  

Definitely a great place to stay, I think its much cheaper than many hotels in the strip.

The show is great! And that's the only good thing in the hotel!. The buffet was very very poor, not better even than any $10 Chinese buffet. If you think MGM buffet was poor, come to TL to see what's really poor!

Everything was ok except for an early check in fee of $44 that I was charged. I arrived early, went to front desk, front desk attendant told me room was ready and never verbally expressed an early check in fee. I thought I got lucky that my room was ready. When I called them to try to get it reversed they told me that they had signs posted, it's part of their policy and there is nothing they can do for me. Beware of the undisclosed early check in fee they will charge you if you check in earlier then 3 pm!!!

By far the worst hotel on the strip! If I could give this place no stars I would. 

If you want to go to Vegas DO NOT DO NOT STAY HERE! Your belongings are not safe in this hotel. One person will always have to stay in the hotel room and be awake just to make sure nobody comes in and steals your money and valuables. 

Security may seem helpful at first but they are not! Once you leave, you can say goodbye to the thousands of dollars stolen. All they will say is that you have to go through risk management. "You have to go through risk management" Risk management doesn't do anything. I won't be surprised if the hotel itself encourages its own employees to go into rooms and steal money. They conduct their own investigation of each case. They probably cover up their own tracks. 

This is a terrible place to stay and I would recommend to everyone NOT TO STAY HERE! I'd rather stay at a whatever hotel off the strip than ever stay at Treasure Island. My next steps are to report them to the Better Business Bureau!

I'm usually pretty long-winded with my reviews. But then, there's this:

I literally forgot-- completely fucking FORGOT-- that I stayed here for a few days last year.

PROS: Oh, wait, we got a cabana for like seventy bucks. I seem to remember that being adequate. I feel like we got a free buffet (although in hindsight, I feel like it wasn't very good).

CONS: Dude, no, seriously, my Partner-in-Crime and I had to think for roughly four or five minutes about where the hell we stayed that time we went to Vegas in August last year. 

VERDICT: no, really. I'm gonna go ahead and just call this place the Bermuda Triangle of my brain. Nothing sticks out as particularly lame, nothing seems to be piquing the "awesome" sphere of my brain (other than the company I was keeping), so, um, I'll give this place a vote of, "Um, sure?"

(NOTE: ..dude, no, srrsly. NOTHING about this place stands out in my brain and that concerns me, somewhat. I think I ACTUALLY may have paid to stay in Limbo.)
One of the cleanest and nicest hotels I've stayed at in Vegas, and I've stayed at over a dozen.

If it were possible to give this establishment   a 0 I would. I would never recommend this establishment for a nights stay, trip to the casino or the circ du soleil mystere show. I am appalled by how I was treated by the ticket manager of the box office Justin Hawker. During the show my family and I purchased a box of popcorn to enjoy. As the show began one of the circ du soleil mystere performers stuck his hand in our bucket of popcorn. I understand this was probably fun and games so we waited till after the show to ask for a refund because we no longer wanted the popcorn after this happen. We were told at the refreshment  stand to talk to the supervision (Justin). When we explained the situation Justin stated the performers don't do things like that. He had a rude tone and stated the best he could do was give us another bucket of popcorn. We again asked for a refund because the show was over and we had no need to take a bucket of popcorn home with us. Justin then stated he would not give us a refund and that we had to call circ du soleil directly to ask for a refund. When asked for that phone number he stated he didn't know. When asked for further clarification related to why we could not get a number to contact them, Justin became even more rude and dismissive. He acted very unprofessional stating he didn't have to give us an explanation and to get out of the theater because another show was stating. When asked for his supervisor he refused to give us a name stating that he was the supervisor. He then told other staff to call security because we were trying to argue,fight, and were threatening him. I was shocked and appalled at these lies he told! He caused a huge scene when we were trying ask him questions. I have never felt so disrespected and embarrassed in my life! He exemplified a horrible way to treat guests of Treasure Island. I will NEVER again go to this establishment. This situation was un called for and could have been avoided if Justin acted more like a professional. What a terrible way to treat guests! I have many choices of where I spend my money and I will be sure not to spend any more here at an establishment with management that handles small matters so unprofessionally.

Suites not up to Vegas standard I think.
You get what you pay for I guess.
Bad bad bad bad bad bad Service.i never go back there .becouse they charge me eveyday 50$ for nothing .and they dont have wireless in the sweet room .i never go back there .
Just reported this hotel to the Federal Trade Commission for false advertisement.  They will not honor their best price guarantee!  Just know this before you book!

Room and bathroom were clean, bed was very soft and comfy. Was not noisy at all. The soaps provided were very nice. Pool is not too large and def not glamorous like bellagio. Casino is very smokey like rest of hotels. Nice to see them washing carpet and vacuuming floors frequently. Bath had marble and tub was large, very clean. Big plus is close to bus route so easy to travel. For the most part employee were friendly and helpful, however the bell men were not very friendly. Kinda pissed off looking and gave one a tip for carrying my bag and he gave me a dirty look. Wth?

Stayed at Treasure Island during spring break.  Family of four for only $110 including $20 resort fee.  Great deal for good location on strip.  Rooms were comfortable and clean.  You can stay at TI for budget price and take a short walk to splurge on the Wynn's excellent buffet.

This place was just okay.  Check-in took forever.  I paid more here than what I paid to stay at the Palazzo a few months before, so I was expecting a four star hotel like priceline told me!  But it's probably 3 stars at best...nothing special, rooms are small, tv is smaller...it was just okay, average...I would only stay here again if it was free.
they didn't have strip view room they upgraded to the small suit with Jacuzzi. But I was insist to get strip view room. But they gave non strip view room. Also there was no jaccuzi in the room.

Arrrrrr... this place sucks, matey!

Check-in be requiring ye scurvy dogs to wait in a line that resembles the baggage check at most airports before a major holiday. Arrrrrr... it be taking 40 minutes to check in to this dreary hotel-- not exactly the kind of activity ye wants after traveling many nights following the north star. And while many hotels be eliminating "hotel fees", Treasure Island plunders $25 dollars nightly, which doesn't include basic pirate amenities like coffee in ye room. It does afford ye entrance to their buffet, which be the only authentic part of the experience because the food be tasting like rancid pirate chum! Did I mention our bed was broken?

I heard the scurvy jester who ran The Frontier into the ground purchased this place a few years back, which is why it be as nasty as the inside of a pirate's boot. The staff be acting rude and should be forced to walk the plank.

Point ye compass elsewhere, there be no treasure here!

OK I have this thing were I refuse to write reviews about anything in Vegas especially since i've been there so many times I think i've been to everything and well that would just take up too much time to review every bar and hotel. HOWEVER, treasure island has never ceased to fail me. The first time I came to Vegas (legally) I checked into the T I with my friends, and from what I can remember it was a fun trip while staying here but as the years have passed something always drags me back. I've stayed at really nice hotels such as the Bellagio, The Wynn, Excalibur etc..even crappy ones such as the Luxor (ugh, which reminds me I should probably write a horrible review for them) But in between all of those trips I still manage to stay at TI when I can just because it's one of those hotels that aren't TOO fancy and definately not low end. 

They have this scent every time you walk in that really gets me (I dunno, I'm  a sucker for small things I guess) It smells like baby oil of some sort. The slot machines in there are really good if you're not TOO much into gambling like myself (I'll play like 25 cent blackjack all night) .Customer service there is great. I'll never forget the time my friend and I were super wasted when we got to our hotel that we got into our pj's and next thing I know I'm locked out of the room and she's passed out- and I'm literally in a little black nightie, so I have to go all the way downstairs like 16 levels in an elevator and through the casino (and of course there were kids everywhere for some wedding so i'm stuck in the elevator with some 13 year old starring at me up and down) so then I go and ask customer service in this teeny little black dress to please give me a key since the hotel wasn't even in my name! I think they just felt sorry for me and let me in while holding in their laughs, but either way it was nice of them cause it was so embarrassing. Oh, and if it's your birthday tell them when you check in and they will send you a free bottle of champagne up to your room. They also have a buncha goodie buy 1 drink get 1 free coupons when you check in. 

The club there is really lame though, I mean for one its owned by that Ed Hardy guy, Christian Audigier so that says it all already...but since we got in free being hotel guests and all we gave it a shot, it's definately a place to be if you want to be surrounded by a buncha tools. Oh and the bartender was extremely rude. But besides that TI is a perfect hotel to stay at, and this is coming from a girl who's been to em all.

OH and that new $20 resort fee is bull, yes, but EVERY hotel does it not just TI... its a new Vegas rule now which is lame I know, but someone told me that if enough people complain about it then they are gonna get rid of it. So complain at the front desk about it when they mention it at the end! Throw a hissy fit. But then apologize and say it's not their fault cause TI employees are super sweet but the new Vegas rule is just BS.

Well with the pirate show being taken away.....which was made this establishment stand out.....TI is really not the same place. Now while I have never stayed here seeing the pirate show outside and the huge crowds that would gather around this was truly a unique experience for all who chose to watch. Now with that being said the buffet (as I reviewed earlier).....the Mystere Cirque show.....and the overall intimate feel of the place.....does make this an OKAY hotel and Casino. 

I do have one very important suggestion for this locale though.....if your attending a show here or just visiting in general park on LEVEL 3 near the SKYBRIDGE to the Casino. We found out by doing this you can walk right in.....get on the TRAM if you want.....do a little shopping.....stop by Krispy Kreme......go down the Escalator and there you will find the Mystere Theater and Gift Shop. The buffet is about 40 yards or so right down the hall from there and then the Casino itself. So as you can see by parking on LEVEL 3 you can pretty much experience the Highlights of this Hotel and Casino......easy in.....easy out.

NOTE: THIS IS ONE OF THE FEW CASINOS ON THE STRIP WITH FREE PARKING......WOHOOOO!!!!! 

Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!!

I would say that this is an OK place to book your hotel. 

There is nothing spectacular about the place except for the location. I wuold consider it good as it's near by a mall, Caesar's, Venetia, PAris and Bellagio. 

The pool is alright. Not too big, and not too cramped. 

The room price is here is affordable. I would recommend this for people who are on a budget or planning on spending their money elsewhere. Besides, you only stay in your room to sleep and take a shower. So why the big fuss if your bed is not made of 600 thread count and the pillows are not made of goose feathers? 

The crowd is young as the other reviewers mentioned. The vibe is hipper than before. Better for people who is looking forward to parties (though I don't recommend the lounges and bars here. You may want to get in Tangerine for starters- pre party but head elsewhere for better party scene).

Booked my Vegas trip through an outside agency 6 months ago and called last week to add an extra night. Today I show up and am told the company I booked through went bankrupt and the room was not paid for, I said fine, let me pay it. They come back with "their best rate" which is THREE times as much as I already paid.. There was no negotiating, they said due to the games that's their rate. After telling him I'm not here for the games im here to spend money in your casino, zero cares were given. Needless to say I won't be spending anything in their casino, they've already gotten all im willing to give them. Not only did I get screwed over by the booking agency, I got screwed over by the hotel. Needless to say, this was my first and last visit here.

We booked this hotel for my birthday weekend but were shocked by what you get for the high prices.  Incompetent staff, rude room service and housekeeping skips servicing the rooms.  Reported it to manager who was not customer friendly and puts the onus on you after explaining that we called down before we left for our day, requesting our room to be cleaned.  We were forced to enjoy our filthy room at day's end and then wait to have our room serviced.  Zero credit and useless apologies.  Stay away from this overpriced low rent hotel.

Of course TI isn't all fancy and ritzy like other hotel\/casinos on the strip, but for the price.. I'd say it's a pretty good deal.  I just came back from Vegas and I booked a package deal flight+hotel. I was kinda iffy about staying here because of the reviews, but I've stayed in worse places and I figured this place couldn't be that bad. And to my surprise... I was right! 

The room was cute, nice bedding, and the bathroom was clean.  I think the location is great. It was close by everything that I wanted to go to... and the parking in the parking garage was easy to get to. So, overall, I'd say this is a good choice if you don't care about luxury, but still wanna be comfortable.

Great location! Overall I am always happy when I stay here! Clean, lots of gaming options, pool is nice, kahunaha ville has good burgers. They also have better customer service then other places. Only bad thing I can say is I hope they figure out the outdoor pirate show, I miss that part.

Came here to eat at Senior Frogs which I didn't like. Years ago my mother used to work for TI and it was a really nice casino and the pirate show was always super cool ...never got tired of seeing that show. 

Now the place looks really dated and not very well kept and I have been told they stopped the pirate show some time ago now its girls dancing??? Clearly they aren't reinvesting much in keep this place a destination place.

We stayed here in 2009 during our wedding weekend. This was just after the hotel had undergone a renovation.

We booked one of the petite suites with a strip view. The room was wonderful - spa tub, gorgeous shower and the best bed I may have ever slept in. Seriously. My new husband and I did a LOT of sleeping!

We arrived super early and they allowed us to check in a few hours before checkin time. They sent a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries to honor our wedding! How sweet.

We really enjoyed our stay and felt the price was extremely reasonable compared to other hotels for what we received.

Plus, I love pirates.

beautiful hotel! was worried about staying here as i thought it would be amazingly tacky (even tho that can be expected in vegas!) but i was more than plesently surprised!
the room was stunning. Had a suite room (i believe one of the basic rooms) and we had two huge bathrooms with a lovely jet tub and the most amazing view out the window, down the strip.The bed was AMAZING! Comfiest bed ive ever experienced. It has to be felt to be believed! Highly recommended and definately, 100% staying here again. So far i have stayed in about 6 hotels on the strip ranging from excalibur to Aria and Trump - TI is definately my favourite. Wicked price too! AMAZING value for money.

I would gladly tell visitors to stay ANYWHERE else in Vegas.  There is nothing good about this hotel except location and the rooms were nice.  The customer service is non-existent.   Rude workers at check in. Waiting for 15 minutes at most food places before even being acknowledged. (there was NO line) Then another 20 minutes before any service.  Pool is small and SUPER crowded.  By 2:00, you cant even move if your in the water.  Not fun, not relaxing.  There are many more reasons NOT stay at this hotel.  The prices arent even great.  Definitely consider staying at one of the MANY other hotels on the strip.  I even emailed a complaint to the the hotel direct and havent heard a thing back.  Again, horrible customer service.

Wow! We were very happy with the service. I have never been in an hotel where all the staff were happy and smiled! Even the housekeeping staff were really nice and said hello as we passed by. Even the maintanence guys looked up to smile. 
They gave us a strip view room even though we didn't pay for it. (Thank God!) and the view was gorgeous. It is a little further down the strip but no far from Ceasars. 
If you reserve it at least 5-6 months in advance, you can get great deals. We stayed for 4 nights during a holiday weekend for only $425 (including resort fees). 
The pool is smaller than other hotels on the strip but there are more lounge chairs. I wasn't fighting for a chair but I was fighting for space in the pool. The pool is more of a hang out with drinking and a DJ in the afternoon. Not the most kid friendly pool. 
I love that there are 2 starbucks. One in the hotel and one just right outside. There are plenty of good options for restaurants that are good quality and reasonably priced for the strip. 
We will stay again and I would recommend it to anyone.

TI earned my four star rating. I don't was worried when this came up on Priceline as my 4 star hotel; but they earned that rating and maybe an extra 1\/2. The fresh flowers in the lobby were beautiful. The room was clean and comfortable. Would really like to have a coffee maker in the room though. There was no convenience bar either. That's got to change. Room service was good. CVS and Starbucks on site are sooooo appreciated! Even if the pirate show had to stop because of those features...would rather have the convenience. Gaming was good. I had a good time; better at TI than at the other casinos I went to. The spa was AMAZING!!! One of the best spas I've ever been to. The spa is FIVE STARS all the way. I checked out on my phone and it was super easy. I got a late check out and didn't get price gouged. I'd stay here again!
Great service. For a reasonable price. I like this hotel. The upgraded room is super nice

Where do I begin?!?!  This hotel helped make for the best Vegas weekend I've ever had.  I think the atmosphere was exactly what we were looking for.  Went to Vegas with 4 good buddies and our hotel was comfortable for us.  

The highlight of the hotel for us was the pool.  Oh my!  We spent Friday, Saturday and Sunday at the pool.  The DJ started around noon and the place filled up.  Pretty much turned into a day party at the pool.(Not intended for kids).  The best part is as you enter the pool area, the staff hands you a plastic cup to place your drink in!  Definitely will be the hotel of choice next time we visit Vegas!
The updated rooms are great. Service was great. I was able to get an early check-in with no charge and overall great experience. The tables have increased in expense.
Resort should have a place I can as a guest get a free cup of coffee in the morning after I spend  a bunch of money gambling and pay for a room

For the price, Treasure Island was great. It's a bit kitschy and the meals and drinks quite expensive, but the per-night rate, cleanliness, pool, and location were all fantastic.

Pros:
- Clean, spacious rooms with nice views
- Prompt, courteous bell, front desk, and housekeeping staff
- Location; right next to the Mirage, Venetian, Wynn, near Cesar's
- Lots of coupons for in-house drinks and activities at checkin 
- Pool clean, large, and pretty w\/ towel service, drink service
- Señor Frog's has good food and drinks (albeit at strip prices)
- Tram to Mirage
- Access to Mirage pool

Cons:
- The salon wasn't great. They were 45 minutes late to start our makeup appointments because a technician had called out that morning, putting them behind. We had to cancel our dinner reservation before seeing Celine because we finished our appointments an hour later than planned. This would have been avoided if we had been called before the appointment and advised of the delay; we could have finished doing hair, getting dressed, etc., and been ready to leave at the end of the appointment and made our reservation. The woman at the front desk was very helpful - She printed our show tickets and gave us a discount for the services when we requested it. They made it as right as they could, but I wouldn't recommend the salon if you're on a schedule.
- Prices of food, drinks, slots, and gambling match that of the rest of the strip
- Didn't love the service at Seafood Shack; staff grumpy and not very helpful
- Mystere is fantastic and more reasonably-priced than other Cirque de Soleil shows
- Not the best hotel for nightlife; Señor Frogs and Gilly's Saloon are the only bars; no clubs, etc.

Tips:
- Like most hotels on the strip, if you arrive before checkin you can check your bags beforehand for free. At checkin they will bring your bags to your room. Only cost is gratuity to the bellman.
- Ask for any extra coupons at checkin. These may include 2-for-1 drinks at a couple of the bars, 2-for-1 buffet, and 2-for-1 Mystere tickets.

The only reason why i give this place a 5 star rating is cause they hooked my ass up! 

Went on expedia.com to pay for a cheap ass room for sunday night, checked in and what do you know..i majestically get an upgrade to palozzoo suite (master suite)...all for under $80 without that vegas $20 trick bs.

I knew something was terribly fishy as i walk to my room door and realize that it was a double door as oppose to a single door. Talk about BALLIN!!!! anyways this hotel isn't bad. it's really not an upscale type like cosmo, encore, bellagio, etc..but for a room upgraded to a suite, you can't beat that!!!
Swashbuckling good time. And the rooms are above average.

I've gone to Vegas with family in Treasure Island...Going to Vegas when you're a 21-year-old is a bit of a rite of passage-- going with a group of fellow 21-year-olds group of girls is a whole 'nother ball game.  Of course, I had to oblige. Enter Treasure Island.

From the outside, TI is quite unassuming, especially compared to the newer hotels.  However, the rooms are surprisingly very clean, modern, and classy!  Ain't no janky decor here!

We stayed for three nights, although I'm not sure the third night was necessary, considering no one stayed there that night...

Internet, gym passes(although, really, who in sweet baby Jesus' name has the energy\/is sober enough to go to the gym during their stay in Vegas, I have no idea), and some other random shizz is included with the resort fee.  The internet is quite useful when you cannot get out of bed and you want to Yelp potential hangover meal locations.  The Gods of Partying must have been watching over us, because somehow, the resort fee was waived...? Schwing!

Another plus?  Starbucks... is... down... stairs... Yeah-- Ah-mazing, I know. 

This review is making me miss Vegas.  The plane ride back was hell though.

I really enjoyed my stay at Treasure Island. It was one of the more affordable hotels on the strip. Check in was easy and the check-in desk attendant was very friendly. She asked why I was in Vegas and I told her my boyfriend was there for his alumni association's conference and I was tagging along for vacation. I had booked the room and she made sure to put his name on the room also in case he lost his key and needed to come get another one from the front desk. I'm so glad she did because one night he made a CVS run and forget his key in the room. I had fallen asleep and security refused to let him up without a key so he had to go to the front desk.

There are a good selection of restaurants in the hotel and the CVS is so convenient. The location on the strip is great. Was it close to my boyfriend's convention hotel, New York New York? No, but it was a quick 8 min uber ride away. It is next to Fashion Show Shopping Mall and other great restaurants. 

My only complaints would be that there were a few light bulbs out in our room and the room could use a little updating but it was very clean. Housekeeping did a great job with keeping our room clean and giving us fresh towels. I would definitely would come stay here again in the future.

This hotel has a few things going for it, decent prices and pretty nice decor in the rooms.  The location on the strip is unbeatable. HOWEVER, don't classify yourself as a 4 star hotel when you don't even provide toothpaste!!! What kind of crap is that.  I'm addition don't expect to get great service from the front desk clerks.  What you will get is dry mediocre personalities that look miserable at there job!

Just leave and walk to the hotels nearby for true 4 star and above qualities!

Very poor.

No exhaust in the bathroom. As you probably know Vegas gets really hot, so this can be a major discomfort when steam builds up from your shower.

I broke out in rash (i thought it was bed bugs). I stay in hotels all the time, never had this experience before.

I was told I would get call from GM, never did.

Several staff members rude and unhelpful.

They wanted to charge me $17.99 per day for internet access. You could not get internet access in either of the 2 Starbucks on site. I strongly suspect that is because the hotel would not allow them. Even my 3G phone had very slow download.

I had 2 small packages delivered to my hotel. They charged me $21 to accept delivery of them, in other hotels I have stayed in that was a free service. I really got the feeling they wanted to squeeze every last dime they could out of you.

I would not recommend to anyone under any circumstances.

The Show has changed with the boats. Not really family oriented but Hey its Vegas get used to it. The Hotel rooms are nice and spacious. The Alarm clocks have Ipod docks. Flat screen tv nice furniture and desks. 
Even includes a wall safe. 
As for the Slot Machines i always stick to the penny slots with the bonus of Mr Penny or whatever its called. Cant go wrong with that. Very Helpful staff with checking your bags once you checked out. And great shuttle service to the Las Vegas Motorspeedway.

Truly the most disappointing experience I've EVER had in Vegas. We travel here almost monthly and have never stayed here, thank goodness, and have never been treated so poorly before. I have never been spoken to so unprofessionally and it was by the supposed assistant manager of this whole disaster of a hotel. My entire family came to celebrate my birthday here, bought show tickets, booked spa appointments, made dinner reservations at their below par steakhouse and after traveling with an 11 month old while I'm 3 months pregnant, we proceed to get to the lovely Treasure Island for them to tell me they have sold my room and will do NOTHING for me and my baby. They took my money for a room I never stayed in, AND wouldn't refund me for the show tickets or spa when I said I don't want to do anything here! They're great at taking your money, just failures at giving you the product\/service. Needless to say, their hierarchy of staff is pathetic and I wouldn't recommend this dirty, terribly ran, poor excuse for a Vegas experience establishment to my worst enemy. I will never have the misfortune of having another weekend ruined by Clinton in reservations and Mr. Bishop, B I S H O P, as he made clear when speaking down to my brother, ever again. Poor, poor management from the bottom up, they should truly be ashamed.

Two stars because the housekeeper was so sweet.  Suite was so run down.  Paint chipping off furniture, air con coming out of ceiling,s ink counter peeling sealants off of granite.  Lamps had burnt out bulbs, toilet running, TV guide didn't work, bed lamp screws all loose so they wouldn't stand up.  That's enough!  Didn't leave cuz it was the 4 th and didn't want to search for another hotel and ruin my week with my sis.  Just will not go back nor recommend anyone to stay here I did call front desk on day one to report all the stuff they only replaced light bulbs

I loved my stay at the Treasure Island.  Heck, with the mall next to TI, you basically do not have to leave the hotel.  TI has everything for you...restaurants, stores, bars, casinos, theatre (Mystere), Starbucks and many more.

TI is somewhere in the middle of the Strip, so everything is within a reasonable distance.  (The last time I was at Vegas, I stayed at the Stratosphere, which was at the end of the Strip.)

Anyways, had a great room on the 24th floor.  The bathroom was big.  My only complaints are that it was hot in the room even when the thermostat was on cool.  Also, the maids didn't restock sufficient supplies in the bathroom.   Also, TI doesn't offer free wi-fi.  You have to pay $13\/day.  

Other than that, I had a great time at TI with everything available.

Staff were very helpful from check in process to leaving (valet).  Room was very clean and spacious. Loved all the stores and eateries as well. Will definitely be returning. Also would like to note I left an electronic item behind and to my pleasant surprise housekeeping turned it in and lost and found reached out to me on how to have it shipped home. Overall experience was amazing.

Stayed here for my bf's best friends bday weekend. All I can say is it was more than we had expected! For what we paid we stayed in a super luxurious suite with a plasma, two bathrooms (one with a jacuzzi tub), view of the pool and a fold out sofa bed.  Needless to say our suite ended up being the party suite for our group of 12, since everyone else went the other route and stayed at the Hilton. (Ugh.) My only complaint was that the sounds from the hall echoed terribly into our room, making it sound as though people were at the foot of our room door instead of down the hall. Other than that, fantastic! Would recommend for anyone who wants a taste of affordable luxury.

Treasure Island used to be much nicer. We had to book room for soccer tournament. Got to hotel around 730 pm. The guy who checked us in walked away and spoke with another colleague and returned and gave us our room keys. Upon walking into room we were overwhelmed by sewage smell. I called front desk right away and they said they will have someone come fix it. The smell was so bad I called front desk again and asked to have room changed. They said they had no more double queen bed room and i would have to take a room with 1 king bed. We had booked the hotel months in advance for Two queen beds. Needless to say I was very disappointed. We stayed outside the room in the hallway because smell was so bad until new room keys brought up to us. After paying room fees plus resort fees. It's not really worth it. Next time I will encourage our soccer team to choose another hotel to stay at that doesn't give foul smelling rooms out.

How the mighty have fallen. This used to be my favorite hotel when I was growing up. Used to be is the key word in this review. Back in the day, it felt like a Treasure Island. There were pirate themed costumes for the employees to wear and there were wrecked ship parts and all that fun stuff. It was enough to make you cover one eye and scream "YARRRGH!"

Sadly though, it's prime has come and gone. Now, all I wanted to say was "ARGH!" We just got home from a four night stay at this hotel in Vegas. I won't lie, the hotel did it's job, but it should have done better. It should have been like how I remembered it. Oh well.

What I liked about the hotel: the price. It was more than reasonable for the strip. It's location. It's right next to the Fashion Show Mall and across the street from the Palazzo and the Wynn. This hotel is the home base for Mystere, one of the best shows in Vegas. The rooms here are pretty nice. The standard rooms are a little on the small side but they have a nice flatscreen tv and a radio with a dock for your ipod. That was a nice touch.

What I didn't like: the service. Aside from the guy who dropped off our bags in the room, it seemed like everyone had a damn chip on their shoulder. The people at the front desk were very rude when we were checking in. I mean these are the first people we see and the first impression means everything. We lost money here. I know, I'm sure everyone does but it's upsetting. Also, there aren't any good restaurants here except for the delicatessen. 

Maybe TI is due for an overhaul soon. Maybe they aren't. They sure could use it as this is no longer my favorite hotel on the strip.

I don't care for this hotel but I'll tell you both the cons and pros of this hotel. It's a standard hotel room nothing to horrid there is zero security cameras in the halls to guests rooms. There are no bathrobes or water bottles in the room like most hotels have. The staff at this hotel is horrible they could care less or even try to fake a friendly attitude. The food is also standard taste that you would find at a Denny's but with absurd prices! The plus is the location it's right across from fashion mall and Venetian. Another up is a few of the bars are fun but the drinks are not so great. It's also a good location if your in town for a convention at the sands convention center cause it's close by it. Bed and sheets are good unless your cold then you will freeze cause there is basically 3 very thin sheets on the bed.

try to check in 5 minutes early, the fee is $40.
Ask for a half hour more than 11am checkout.. Fee is $40
Rooms average with small tv
Slots bad
Rude service at restaurants and hotel check in
Crowded and very smoky
They tack on a $25 resort fee each day whether you use it or not.
Coffee is $3.95 a cup
Buffet way overpriced and crappy. Not like other Vegas buffets.
Most guests are either overseas Italians or drunken kids..
The language in most places in the Casino is worse than docks in NYC where I once worked.
Just a sampler folks.
Avoid
If you shop around you usually can find a good rate for this hotel. The casino is small but the rooms are okay for the price I paid. Good location but small pool.

I love the treasure and pirate theme here. It is a very fun experience. However, my problem was that I was made to wait for one hour when checking in and gambling was a real problem. I was asked for ID on several occasions while I was gambling on the slots even though I am clearly an old man. Why would they bully me like this?

My first visit to Vegas was a girls weekend with my best friend from college, she booked through Orbitz and I was able to check in to the room before she arrived by adding my name as a guest. When I arrived it was around 11 pm but felt like 2 am to me. Needless to say, the check in process was blurry. The key pass was tricky, but the room was as requested, 2 queen beds on the 18th floor which was nice. I was happy with the hotel amenities, including the shops and restaurants. The tv in the room was a bit fuzzy,  but we did not stay in the room to watch much tv. 

Buffet at TI for breakfast: 4 stars, good selection including omelets, fruit, pastries and good coffee. 
The Coffee Shop- breakfast twice, 1st time I enjoyed the service and food more than on check out day. The berries were delicious. 
Starbucks near the pool?  Yes please! 
Had a banana colada at the pool, the 25 person jacuzzi was nice! I wish that children weren't allowed in there, though. Didn't mind the DJ, music wasn't obnoxious.  

The room, the bed was very comfortable. No issues with the room or the view besides the tv. The shops were good, reasonable. 
Check out was easy. I'd definitely stay at TI again.

Fantastic Strip hotel. Rooms very clean, plenty of food\/drinking choices inside or nearby on the Strip. Reasonably priced, Gilley's is a good eating and drinking spot, breakfast at Kahunaville is a very good destination. Definitely recommend.

3.5 stars, but I round up

Pros: 
-great location on the strip (though my personal preference is mid-strip, this was more end-strip but a good location nonetheless)
-easy check-in, we were able to check in early with no problems
-clean and quiet rooms
-rooms cleaned daily, fresh towels every morning

Cons:
-Resort fee, though I knew about it so I calculated it into our rate
-Smoky casino, but this is Vegas

We did order room service and that took about 20 minutes to reach us, which was fine.  We watched the Sirens of TI.  My husband tolerated it but I wasn't impressed.

Treasure Island is a nice hotel.  We spent two nights there this past weekend.

The rooms are a good size with a flat panel television hidden in an armoire.  Desk space with plenty of chairs.  Nice sized bathtub\/shower with plenty of hot water but a little low on water pressure.   No in-room fridge.  

Bed was comfortable but not outstanding.  We had a corner room which gave us two sets of windows - which was very nice.

The ice is free but the vending machine bottles of soda are $2.75.  They are $2.25 in the gift shop in the lobby.

Ease of checking in:  4 stars
Ease of checking out:  5 stars
Cleanliness:  5 stars

Downsides:  
Internet access is : $12.99\/24 hours
Television stations are limited in-room.

We saw Mystere - great show.  Dinner at the Steakhouse - $300 for four people but the food was outstanding.

It was just an average hotel room - but the centralness of the hotel to the other things on the strip as well as the restaurants and shows in the hotel make it  worthwhile to stay there.

If you're planning at staying at TI, I recommend that you don't bring anything of value. You will leave with your bags lighter at the end of the trip. Our team stayed at TI for a conference and while I was out for a few hours the first morning of our trip, my iPad and digital SLR were stolen from my room. When I realized that my room had been ransacked (the intruder left drawers open and opened the closet to try and access the safe), I immediately called hotel security and filed a report. They took my information down and told me that risk management would be in contact with me in 4-5 days, despite me stressing that I would be leaving on a red-eye the next day. Feeling uneasy about receiving any resolution, I went down to the front desk to speak with a manager. They told me there was nothing that they could do that I needed to speak with risk management. This was repeated over and over like a broken record. The following day, I called security to try and get an update and they offered no further support. I was told again that risk management would handle the situation. He did provide me with the number to risk management and I left a voicemail after repeated attempts to get a live person on the phone. Feeling frustrated, I took time away from the event that I was attending and went to the front desk again, hoping to seek a sliver of assurance that my situation would be handled with care. I spoke to another manager who gave me the same run around - there was nothing that he could do and that I needed to speak with risk management. Wait until Monday, he said. He proceeded to ask me if I had my report number on a pink slip of paper, and a copy of my report. This was news to me as I had received no such information - which only heightened my feeling of being lost in the shuffle. My stay at Treasure Island was my first and last. Should you take the chance and stay at TI, you're putting yourself at risk and will receive absolutely no comfort from hotel management even if you've been robbed blind. Here I am 48 hours later, with no resolution or even a phone call to acknowledge the situation. Take my advice, and stay at literally any other establishment on the strip. There's no way their customer service could be as poor as TI. They definitely set the bar low.

We came for a business trip with the baby and I had the worst experience with the hotel crew, I asked for the crib and they wanted to rented out to me and also I ask for the water boiler for my babies milk and they wanted to charge me $25 even though I mention it that is for baby 
Everything in this hotel is about money if you don't pay they don't take care of you And it doesn't matter if you have a baby or not
It was the worst experience ever and I would never come back here

Married there 15 years ago this month so we thought we'd have a visit before they tore the place down. Arrived at McCarran and promptly realized that the hotel doesn't offer a shuttle, bummer. Forked out $40 for the round trip ride. The hotel rate showed $34 for the night, but with taxes and resort fees we were looking at $79. Not too bad of a deal. We booked two nights. Upon check in, we asked the Gentleman at the front desk if he could look up which room we stayed in for our wedding but unfortunately the database doesn't exist for that time period. Our room was on the end of the upper floor with a view of the pool and the other casinos. It was clean but laid out a little funky. Had to lay on your side in the bed to watch TV, but hey who goes to Vegas to watch TV? One thing that is a must have for us is a coffee maker. The rooms are not equipped by design which meant we had to either go without or rush down to the coffee shop and pay $$ with the rest of the hotel guests and hopefully get a seat or go outside to Starbucks and wait in their line. Starbucks won the toss, 2 coffees $15. On to the gambling...never won more than $10 at a time so we quickly gave up that idea. Didn't use the pool as we have one at home. Thought about going to the House of Blues and take in a Billy Idol concert but after researching tickets @ $380 for two people, we abandoned that as quickly as the gambling. Could not think of anything we wanted to do! Freemont street meant another $40 round trip and dinner at the Stratosphere's Italian restaurant would have also been another $40 round trip. The first night all we could hear were sirens and the music from the pool. Slept maybe 3 hours and that's being generous. Woke up, made it down stairs to the coffee shop where we split an Omelet for $18 and decided, screw this. Checked out with one night still paid for and hopped on a flight back home where we had some drinks by the pool and slept peacefully in our own bed. Could not get out of there fast enough. NO MORE TI OR VEGAS
It's good, it's good... They did some changes here and there but I still like it. It's for a different crowd. It's on the strip, it's cheaper than the rest, and the rooms are nice.

After having stayed one night, I like this casino! It's not as nice as some of the others I've stayed at on the strip, but for the price it's really good. No problems with the room. Nice and clean. The TV is a good size and the shower was spotless. I would say that I would stay again...but I like to stay at different hotels each time I go to Vegas.

Great stay here. I'll just list the basic pros and cons to make it easy:

PROS:
-Beds were extremely comfy
-Bathroom was clean and not worn down
-Hallways were quiet, no loud kids or screaming babies or drunk tards
-Housekeeping checked up on us when had Do not Disturb on the door at 1pm (we slept in)
-Vanity in the main room was fancy and large mirror, great for ladies
-Nice view of the strip

CONS
-Shower is extremely narrow and small. Not alot of room to move around due to an ironing board in the shower. Standing straight at the showerhead is a challenge. This puzzled me because bathroom itself was big....
-Doors are slightly hard to open. Girlfriend couldnt open it. You must pull down HARD.
-Not too many TV channels....wasn't an issue until it was late at night and we weren't going out.

Overall we had a pleasant stay and i would definitely stay again.

Treasure Island Casino and Hotel was perfect for anyone. Their hotel was clean, the staff was jovial as well as helpful, and the rooms were great! We also used the gym facilities which were quite nice too! I was impressed with the variety of workout equipment for the space. Part of the reason we chose this hotel was because it was close to a friends hotel which made things so convenient. After having known of this hotel for years, I'm highly satisfied with this fantastic experience!!!

A-OK. 

The place is super dark and smokey. The cocktail service was okay but that is about the only good thing I can muster. I definitely wouldn't try to order anything high end. And they may tell you that you got a Captain and Coke, but it's not. Instead, it's most likely a bottom shelf, diluted rail liquor.

They are known for the favorable 3:2 $10 Blackjack, which is a rarity on the strip. However, our group did not have any luck whilst playing here for a couple of hours. 

Clientele here are 40s to 50s, which could explain why my friend and I kept getting carded at the tables. If you are in your mid twenties and are looking for a lively, party atmosphere, this would be the exact opposite of that. 

We quickly caught the tram back to the Mirage with our tails tucked underneath.

I loved it! The rooms are kinda small, but they are very nice and clean.  The staff is awesome and the location is great.  

Go during the week and you can get a great deal on the rooms. It's a nice hotel very close to all of the 5 star hotels.

With my experience from my stay at this resort, I will say I'm completely appalled on how they treat customers, and my advice to you: avoid like the plague!!!!! Please go somewhere else!! 

From the moment I stepped into Treasure Island, I was not welcomed with  any kid of friendly service. They made it seem like they were doing US a favor (for doing their job). Upon checking in, the concierge was very unprofessional and rude and told us we needed to wait thirty minutes in order to pay an additional $40 to check in. That was fine with me, because we did get to the hotel a bit early, but it could have been handled in a different and friendlier tone.  We asked if there was any way to have our luggage stored for thirty minutes, while we got something to eat, which brings me to the next unfriendly and most unprofessional employee I came across. 

We went outside to the bellhop area and came across an employee, who stated his name was Mike.  He told us he would be happy to watch our luggage and gave us a stub, and gave us the directions on once we check in, to call the number to have our bags delivered to our room. He stated that he "works off tips" and if we are "happy with his services" to provide him with a tip.  I told him we would be more than happy to provide a tip and to please be careful with our four pieces of luggage because we had valuable items stored.  My friend and I were not expecting for Mike to say, once again, that he would appreciate a tip. My friend and I were appalled that someone would be asking for a tip, when no services were being done thus far. We are more than generous to tip employees once they have provided a service for us, which would be...receiving our bags into our room after they were being properly stored and taken care of.  Mike stated that because we had valuables in our bag, that if we were to tip him, our luggage would be safe.  Mike threatened our valuables, which is not okay at all.  My friend and I walked away to go inside to get change to go and tip Mike, because we felt threatened and were scared that our luggage would be tampered with\/not watched\/etc.  Having an employee threaten us to provide him with a tip is definitely not okay. This by far was the most unprofessional employee I have ever came across in my life.  

I am a club member of the Venetian, Palazzo, and M life group. This time, I wanted to give Treasure Island a try. The only thing positive going for them was their location. I was completely dissatisfied that my friend and I wasted our money by staying at this hotel.  I had emailed treasure island to let them know how unprofessional their employees were, and how appalled I was to be treated like that. I never heard back. I will never stay there again and please, I beg of you, avoid this place unless you want high blood pressure on your vacation.

I like TI, but I've been to Vegas too many times to know what a good hotel is. TI is a ripe off, they charge you $20\/night plus tax for some bullshit amenities "internet, gym, and newspaper" who the fuck uses those things? I came to Vegas to party and gamble! Not stay in my room to go online (and I have my phone for that), and to work out at the gym, it's my vacation, and who the fuck reads the newspaper?! in Vegas?! 

The rooms were clean, bed was comfy, water pressure SUCKS, and the toilet is outdated... it's at the northern part of the strip, it's a long walk to the middle of the strip. Also they have HORRIBLE check in lines, a line of like 100 people and only 2 staff. WTF right?! And the check out line is insane too!?! WTF is that right?! They don't have speedy check out like just calling them from your hotel room. Hella stupid management. I also booked for memorial day week, HORRIBLE rates, i paid $230\/a night, what a ripe off right?! DAMN NEVER AGAIN. With that pricing I could stay in Caesars or Bellagio with better amenities!

next time I would NEVER stay here again. I rather pay some extra bux and stay at Venetian or Palazzo, or pay less and be in the middle of the strip by staying at Flamingo or Harrah's.

Horrible hotel! Horrible staff! Shay especially is rude, aggressive, and just plain must hate her job. We stayed from 4\/19-4\/25 and I will never give this hotel another dime! My room was disgusting. There were brown stains on the matress skirt, hair on the ceiling in the bathroom boogers in the door frame, not to mention the general dusty and run downness of the entire room\/casino. My phone was stolen, noone cared. A man confronted me claiming he was a part of hotel staff, and turned out not to be, nothing happened. I did not feel safe or clean while staying here! DON'T DO IT! IT'S NOT WORTH THE SMALL AMOUNT OF MONEY YOU WILL SAVE!!! My "strip view" was a view of 3 parking structures. And I had to call and trac down anyone from housekeeping to get towels. I eventually took the vcleaning products from housekeeping and cleaned my room myself. Shay hung up on my 3rd party representative that I booked through and refused to hep me. Another hotel employee tried to give her a room for me to swap to and she didn't, she was aggressive and I wish i had met her somewhere else to slap her. She deserves to be fired My entire family stayed here and although you may have gotten our money this time we will never so much as gamble in this casino again! The only nice thing I have to say is that the vallet employees tried to help me find my phone using my gps. The large black man at guest services the morning of 4\/25 refused to get off the phone (an obviously personl call) to help me at all. Can't say enough about this hotel. it's horrible horrible horrible.

I bid on a 4 star hotel on Priceline and this is what I got.  I wouldn't call it a 4 star hotel....more like a 3 star.  It's in an excellent location on the strip.  They charge you a $20 "resort fee".  This is definitely not a resort!!!  You get to use the fitness center, get free wireless, and a newspaper.  This is ridiculous.  These are things that other hotels, outside of Las Vegas, don't charge for.  The fitness center is only opened limited hours-- it closed at 7 p.m.  it's not large enough to accommodate all the guests that want to use it during peak hours.  And, you must bring the ticket that they give you at check-in to show that you paid the "resort fee".  You can pick up your "free" newspaper at the front desk.  But, this desk is also only open limited hours.  I checked-in at 3 p.m., which must have been the busiest time because the line was very long.  It took 30-45 minutes to check in.

We don't stay in hotels on the Strip often.  Well, almost never.  We are not big Vegas fans.  And we don't gamble.  So, when my son gave us a Xmas gift of two nights at Treasure Island and a show, at first I was confused on how I should feel.

As it turns out, the show was the Cirque du Soleil, Mystere.  And it was showing in a theatre inside the casino.  That had possibilities since we would also not have to worry about parking. And the show was magnificent.  I can really appreciate the permanent stage, customized for that beautiful performance. Some evenings, there are other high quality acts going on.  Gotta give those acrobats some time off to re-charge, you know.

We arrived late Sunday, which it turns out has multiple advantages.  First, the traffic was all leaving LV.  We skated in.  Yay.  Secondly, since the masses were gone, I believe we ended up with a far nicer room, upgraded to the upper 5 floors (had a special designated elevator!) only because we had requested adjacent rooms so we could be next to my son's room.  Nice desk clerk. Beautifully maintained surroundings.

The room was very masculine, with black modern furniture, decorated in soft browns and autumn colors.  It was a gorgeous, spacious room that had a big picture window looking out on the strip. The bathroom, also, was quite large, with plenty of counter space and an attractively tiled shower-tub combo. And we had a fridge. No coffee maker or microwave, but that would do fine, since we usually don't use them anyway.

Just so you know, they do charge for wifi.  Fine...we didn't need it. I only needed Yelp on my phone.

This was a wonderful experience, happily\/partially financed by Groupon.  The seats for the Cirque show were moderately low end, but still good.  After I took out the retail value of the entertainment, I figured we had stayed in our upgraded room at Treasure Island for less than $40 a night.  Not bad.

Had a great time, loved our room, even though I still hate the smoky casinos.

We arrived tired about 8:30pm and had our room key within 10-15 mins.  The front desk lady was so nice and welcoming.  Our room was great.  Recently remodeled.  Very comfortable bed.  Really clean and with a great view of the pool and strip.  The music at the pool can be heard in our room but that was done by 10pm. I wish we would have gotten there earlier to go to the pool.  We enjoyed walking around the strip and ended the night at Gilley's which was so fun!  Can't go wrong with good music, line dancing and drunk ladies trying to ride the mechanical bull.  Great rates especially if you are a member of M life.  As far as the security issues in previous posts I never depend on security staff or even the police and am always aware of my surroundings and use common sense.

We have stayed at TI around 4 times over the past 5 years. This visit the hotel seemed to be feeling it's age.  The rooms were more worn though still very spacious and received a strip view room for the first time which was awesome view. Comfortable but definitely aging.  About half of the escalators or other mechanical items were out of order, basically if you could get up, then down was stairs only or circle to another area of the property.  Staff was friendly enough but no real enthusiasm or providing much in way of overview of features of the hotel, just hurry you on your way and move on to the next guest.  We were supposed to get some kind of champagne service free but nothing in the packet from the front desk explained how it worked so never bothered.  

Valet is a joke. Not enough staff and either poorly trained or poorly paid.  5pm on a Friday and they had two lanes open, one guy working and he forgot about the second lane.  You had 5 guests who waited 30 minutes to get service and another 15 cars that were served within 10 minutes, just depended on if you were in the unlucky lane. Morning was just as bad though plenty of staff working. Had guy that took four tickets, dropped one and didn't remember how many he took so left guest waiting for 30 minutes. Found the ticket and tried to hid fact it was lost, didn't bother to apologize and still had 10 minute wait to pull the car up.  

On the upside,TI is very conveniently located to reach fashion mall and several other casinos. Parking is easy and casino is easy to move around. On downside, not that much in comparison to other hotels to get you to stay and dine or play, more likely to head out somewhere more fun. Or with better food. Even places like Gilleys had older crowd who was mostly eating and no real excitement. The island grill had best crowd though didn't make it there to eat. 

Gambling was low key, didn't play much but slots and didn't win enough to keep playing for long enough to count.

Reasonable priced hotel, comfortable if older rooms, and convenient location would be reasons to stay. If looking for young crowd, high energy or exciting dining options, look elsewhere.

Great resort! Stayed 4 days and it was I believe a good value. Strong points are:
- Location - connected to the Mirage by tram (easy waking distance too). You also have walkways to the Fashion Show Mall, Palazzo\/Venetian and the Wynn\/Encore are on the opposite corner. All this to say you have access to TONS of restaurants, attractions, etc. 
- Rooms - we had NO issues with housekeeping or any of the other issues mentioned here on Yelp. The room was clean and comfortable. LOVED the size of the bathroom. Plenty of room (it seems a new theme in hotel design is to skimp on the size of the bathrooms and you no room or turn sideways to close the door. Lol!). The room itself was nicely furnished with a empty fridge to use, which was nice to have. 
- Restaurants - although Kahunaville is now closed  there is still plenty of selection to chose from. Senior Frogs is awesome and so is Gilley's. The buffet is so nice. 
- pool - the pool is great! Loved the DJ and plenty of deck space. The pool isn't as big as others but nicely kept with upgrade options for seating e.g. Cabanas and luxury loungers. The only frustration we experienced is they do not allow outside food and drink, even if you buy it from one of the TI establishments. 
- spa - beautiful place and it is well equipped with steam room, sauna, whirlpools and lounge areas. Prices are also reasonable to other spas. 
- resort fee - I know fees aren't ideal but I love the way TI breaks it down and demonstrates the value you receive. I don't think any other resorts do this. 

The only other recommendation I would make to TI for improvements is their ventilation system. TI seems smokey compared to the other resorts especially compared to Mirage or planet Hollywood. 

Great place to stay! Every single staff member we came in contact with was friendly and accommodating. If given the opportunity to stay again, we would.

I paid $75 a night from hotels.com.  It was a bargain.  I had no view but the room felt awesome.  Their mattress & pillows are so awesome that they can sell them to you new if you wanted to buy them for your home.

It has been around forever. However, this joint is in major need of a makeover, STAT. It's a fun vibe of a place but then you walk in and immediately get a stench...and I have no idea where the stench comes from. Perhaps this particular day was just a bad day to go because the last time I was here I did not encounter that smell. The Cirque du Soleil Mystere show that is here is fantastic though. There are a couple of decent places to eat inside too. But I would not go out of my way to come here unless you are seeing the show.

Last night I got back from a 4 day stay at TI (treasure island). I have to first say that this hotel had the most comfortable beds I had on a vacation. Pillow top mattress with large comfy pillows I was very happy after traveling from the east coast to a comfy bed. The rooms where spacious clean and modern. We had a great view of the strip facing the Mirage, Venetian etc... The negative was the noise level coming from the pool and our neighbors next door.  
All in all we had a great stay. This location could not have been better! A quick tram ride to the Mirage, walk across the street to the Venetian. Shops to the left of the hotel. The Perfect strip location. 
Restaurant wise I have mixed feelings Kahunaville was awful. Awful food and drinks.  Phil's Italian Steak House was delicious I stopped by for a quick bite and had the scallops and a side of asparagus. The food was delicious my only complaint was too much butter.  Beyond that the meal, drinks and service were very good.  Room service after hours menu is pathetic I should have just waited for breakfast or walked across the street to Dennys. The regular room service menu was very limited but the food wasn't that bad. I had the decent steak with french fries, my sister had a grilled chicken which she refused to eat due to the large amount of butter. 
The bar in the front center of the casino was a great meeting place. Good drinks and great environment... waitress could have been more polite and it completely blew my mind they kept reminding us to tip them....  Being told to tip someone immediately took their 25% tip down to 12%! 
The pool was nice however I do have major complaints about the pool #1 there are not enough chairs, Saturday we had to put our personal items on the side and sit on the ground. #2 understaffed wait staff they need to hire double the amount of waitresses they currently have. 
Kids - I know this is not an adult only hotel\/casino but the kids need to be sectioned off. In the restaurants, casino area, POOL area everywhere. There should be sectioned off areas so the kids are not a witness the debauchery that is happening around them. 
At the end of the day I will look at staying at the TI the next time I am in Vegas. All in all it was a great first time experience in Las Vegas.

I don't have any major complaints about this hotel. It was nice, clean and everything functioned as it should. They should definitely put some coffee makers and a microwave in the rooms. All in all it was a fairly pleasant stay. Nothing crazy and extravagant, no wow factor. I will probably stay elsewhere next time.

The front wanted to charge me an extra 40 bucks for checking in early, wtf?! We get to the room and it's clean, but tub didn't drain properly, filled up quickly, so you had to take a quick shower. The bottom sheet had a hole and there wasn't any coffee in the room. Even if it was free, I wouldn't go back.

I stayed here for a week - and the cost is respectable for the duration of the week. The room size is decently sized with dual queen size beds. I had the deluxe room, and I picked whatever room was available during the check in process. I had a shared wall with a shared door - while I could hear people speaking, it was difficult to understand. I just drowned out the external noise with my laptop speakers. I did notice stains on my work chair - but I'm not going to complain too much about it. 

I just covered it with pillows to make the chair more ergonomic to work in. Without the pillows, the lack of ergonomics can be a concern for those who type a lot - it can become painful to the wrists or shoulders, or lower back if they are not aware of their body posture. The pillows does help out - but doesn't eliminate the problem. 

The curtain does block all of the external light from entering the room, perfect for when I need absolute darkness for sleeping. The AC works well and there's a small fridge and a safe. I used the fridge to keep drinks cold - never did test the freezer capability. I did notice the lack of conveniently located electric outlets.  

Seems that there were only one available in the most unusual spot, away from the work area, and away from any place to do any ironing. Speaking about ironing, the ironing board cover could be replaced - it's showing its age. 

There are a few Starbucks located in the area. I counted two indoors and one outside. This hotel is located next to a 24\/7 Walgreens, perfect for those trips to acquire basic traveling necessities. 

The sound of the Siren show is annoying during the evening; the window could use better acoustic insulation. The noise from the hallway is noticeable - people in their drunken ways wondering through the hallways. Good thing I have ear plugs to remedy these noise issues. 

Overall, not a bad spot to stay in Vegas, and on The Strip as well. 

Tip: Check-in process is a total mess during after 11AM, or even 3pm, or even 5pm. There's lots of people checking in. Suggestion for this, plan to wait a while in the lobby, or just drop your stuff off at the Bell Desk, go amuse yourself in Vegas, and come back later, such as 7pm or 9pm.

Treasure Island is in some need of updates. What I remember from 10 years ago was a very lively part of the strip with pirate shows and a bustling casino. We stayed here this time based on that memory.

It was probably the least attractive casino with the smallest sports book on the strip.

The room was was okay, but the bathroom was aging. Most of the eight people in our group complained of the beds. The housekeeping staff did a great job, but it was the room with a strange thermostat that we couldn't keep at a good temperature. While I welcome security making sure that you had a room key to get to the elevators, it was not 24 x 7.

The restaurants were overpriced for the low to medium quality. The buffet prices went up on the weekend.

The tram to the Mirage broke down a few times during our one week stay. Not an issue, but there was no sign.

Great show (cirque du soleil), nice view, clean, pretty quiet, good spot (not too many taxi rides everywhere), affordable, good service. 
Our keys were deactivated for some reason but they sent up security right away. We also couldn't locate our room because we were too excited and blind at the moment, but they were so kind and responsive when I called. Also, thank you so much for promtly shipping my camera charger and battery that I'd left in our room when we checked out, for free. Not the most fancy hotel in Vegas, but I'd definitely go back.

OK, so check this out.  I know I have been long dormant with the Yelp reviews (bad girl, BAD GIRL!), so to make it up to ya'll, I am now embarking on a casino-by-casino tour of my new hometown of LV, NV, and will include reviews of each as I tour them.  Now, these will not include room stays, but just schlepping around the premises - eating, drinking, and checking out anything that moves or doesn't move.  Got it? OK, let's proceed...

Review #4:
well, it's mediocre, as you would expect; still carries traces of its Disney-type heyday, particularly the Strip-front pirate ships (which are actually kind of cool), so there's a fairly high family\/rugrat factor here; but most of the restaurants\/bars are more adult-oriented, albeit tacky & touristy (Gilley's, Senor Frog's, Kahunaville); it's overall a pretty nice place and low on the smoke smell; seems smaller than most of the Strip casinos, so you run out of places to explore fairly quickly here; best craft beer bet = believe it or not, Gilley's has a few decent selections, including some Alaskan Brewing Co. beers on tap, and Abita beers in a bottle.

TI is good if you're not looking to get a lot out of your room. They're pretty simple, they do the job of holding your crap so you can go out and do shameful things like you're supposed to when you're in Vegas. It's also a huge plus that parking is free and it's across from the Venetian, a hotel\/casino that's super fun to hang out at. Plus it's near the Wynn\/Encore, which are super fun as well. TI's biggest advantage is it's proximity to cool stuff on the strip, so yeah, I do recommend staying here. The casino is dimly lit, which is actually kind of a drag. Just go gamble in the Venetian.

TI a decent place to stay at for cheap on the strip. The rooms are pretty basic, but it seems like they renovated it since everything looked pretty nice. The beds here were more comfy than I expected. It's definitely not even close to the top-tier hotels on the strip, but you can't expect much when you're paying $150 per night... 

The only good thing is that if you are on a budget, this place is located right across from The Venetian and Palazzo and down the street from Encore and Wynn. For me personally, I don't need a nice room in Vegas since the whole point of being in Vegas is to be out and enjoying everything and not be stuck in your room. If you are planning on spending a good amount of time in the room, I suggest you check out Palazzo or go down the street to The Cosmo or Paris. Overall, I do like TI when I consider the location and the price.

If I could give zero stars I would do that, honestly the worst hotel I have ever been to. Came here with our friends to stay a few days and the tv in their room stopped working when they told the front desk hoping they would fix it they brought a new one up to the room and then informed them they would be charging them $700 for the tv!! Wtf? The tv just stopped working! It wasn't damaged in anyway by them so how do they think they can get away with charging them for it?? The management was no help and told them they would throw them out if they didn't pay for it, now it looks like lawyers will be involved. DO NOT STAY HERE! Hotel is outdated, the restaurants are terrible and the pool is small and obviously the management sucks
