So I am in this situation right now and wanted to documented in a timely manner and also a respectful chronological manner as it has been one day since the incident occurred.

I travel quite a bit -- this is approaching 50 nights away for this year -- and I have never ever ever been humiliated and demeaned by a hotel or travel organization like I was on August 23rd. In fact this really ruined my mood for what should have been a very exciting and relaxing getaway weekend.

Yes, weekend getaway at Treasure Island totally ruined and personally humiliated.

Hopefully this can be addressed and resolved by the appropriate folks but if not and this is how the hotel treats its guess, I thought that folks should be aware. Maybe this is the one exception and not the rule, I sincerely hope so for the other guests, no one should go through the situation that I went through.

P.S. Stephanie at the front desk during the initial part of the check in process was exceptionally helpful, cordial, and efficient. She was a joy to deal with and I'm sorry if I may have put a bummer on her day as I know it was the beginning of that day.

Update of of 8\/25 (review originally written on 8\/24 a.m.) -- TI Twitter folks did respond to me on Monday morning and said they'd look into this.  Then it was implied as Priceline's fault for not showing an opaque bid win code on the res, and I was asked for more documentation and Priceline apparently has been enlisted.  At checkout (normally I do it electronically), I went to the front desk to receive a final bill and verify if the resort fee charges were present.  When I matter-of-factly stated that it was under review (the Twitter folks had said so), the rep got hostile, requested my documents, and began to discredit\/disparage me (I was not asking her to review it or complaining). As I was about to leave, I attempted to take a pic of the rep's nametag (didnt want to write on bill but did want to fully document my experience details, incl. people), and she threatened me with Security removal for doing so (I'm leaving, luggage in-hand, huh?).  Then I arrived home to en email from the Marketing Dept (which did not respond to my polite "please help" 8\/24 email) that it was cancelling my future November res because of these "incidents.

This hotel is alright, it always seems too busy and you have to walk on the gaming floor to get to the elevators to the room.
The room was fine, but the highlight was the pool. It felt like you are at a pool party. BUT I got a none alcoholic drink at the pool bar and it costed me USD$13.....WTH!!! That is crazy!!!

It's an older casino- without some of the cavernous flash of the newer places- but that's perfectly fine with me.  I'm not really here for gambling; I'm here every year for a work trip- and I do my best to stay at TI.  The location is perfect for why I'm here, and it can be less expensive than some of the newer spots.

But what really keeps me coming back is the staff..  Without exception, they have always been very helpful and very friendly.  That gets lots of points from me.  From the people who check me in and check me out- to the housekeeping staff- to one of the performers in the cheesy Pirate show that takes place multiple times a night outside my room window- everyone has been sincere and friendly.  Whomever does the hiring here has something good going.

The rooms have always been clean and comfortable.  whenever I've had a problem (which is rare), it has been taken care of quickly.

There are lots of bigger better known places on the strip- but if you want to stay at a place that's a little more like an old friend, the TI is a great option.

***I want to start off by saying the only reason I'm not giving this hotel a perfect rating is because the rooms are a bit small. Everything else was really great though. Keep up the good work Treasure Island. I would stay again.  

Stayed a weekend in September 2014

Treasure island updated their rooms. They are on the small side, including their bathrooms although the shower is a good size !!! I booked a standard room. 

The maids were always prompt and the rooms were not only tidy but CLEAN. Meaning sheets were not stained, there was no dust, it was what you want when you pay over $150.00 a night for a room. 

We ordered the typical drunk room service at 5 am and the food was decent, prompt. 

Elevators were SUPER fast, clean and they had the elevators in sections of the hotel which was sooo nice so that you don't have to walk a mile on your floor to find your room and also, the elevator is never packed. 

The pool area was great, awesome DJs! Whoever is in charge of the pool area, kudos. It was fun as hell. 

Valet was free as it is in Vegas, and fast.

If there is a zero, I will definitely not hive this any star!!!! Very unprofessional!!! Terrible customer service!!! The tv ad special with no resort fee is a scam!!! As soon as I checked in they told me that the resort fee is mandatory!!! So don't even believe any of their promotions! A lot of hidden fees!!! Stay in a newer hotel and more established one with a couple of bucks you'll get much more and good service. Stay away from this hotel! Really disappointed!!!

While I usually wait till check-out to review a hotel, this place has been horrendous...

1) We called in at 11am to makes some room requests and see how early we could check-in.  They kindly took down our requests, but when we arrived, they had no record of anything. 
(2) we were told we had a nice view (after we previously requested a strip view)..it was a view directly and only of Trump Tower (yuck!!!)
(3) the rooms are older, which means the A\/C barely cools, and is certainly not cold, but there's no way to prove it
(4) it smells like a porta potty everywhere!!!  Why?!  It's so freaking gross

I used to have so much fun in Vegas a few years back, but this has been such a bad experience

I LOVE Vegas....ahhhhh I'm super excited to go back this spring :) Treasure island damn you gots some comfy beds! Ok so the last time i was here was Halloween weekend, it was sooo much fun we went to the Christian Audigier club which is located in the hotel and it was packed and if you are staying at Treasure Island you get in for free! The rooms are super nice Flat screen TV, Nice modern Decor and we had the room facing the Siren Show which i didn't get to see it cause we were so busy but i did get to see a little of the Fireworks they did that was part of the show. Service was good always had clean towels and bed made everyday! The hotel is located right across from the Fashion show mall,Wynn,Venetian and Mirage! I will be back!

For the Pool....$140 for Cabana which wasn't bad....service was horrible, they honestly had 3-4 girls for the entire pool, to include Cabana patrons.  Music was good overall, not a bad way to spend an afternoon....

I stayed at the TI last week attending a healthcare conference. At first I was POed that a lot of my colleagues got to stay at much more upscale hotels\/casinos but I was pleasantly surprised with the TI hotel and casino...

The Pros:
Nice location across from the Sands Convention Center
Updated modern rooms clean comfortable beds
Starbucks on the first floor
Couple of good restaurants on the property.. Liked Isla Mexican and their Vietnamese restaurant both were very good. Couple of people did the buffet and said it was OK... I'm not a buffet guy so...
Gilleys bar off the lobby is a good place to have a brew and watch the tourists get tossed off mechanical bull.
Casino has low minimums which is OK
Not staying at the hotels attached to the conference center meant I was out of the bedlam of trying to get a coffee in the AM or a drink in the PM with the thousands of exhibitors and attendees...

There are Cons:
Yea if I was taking wifey for a romantic getaway weekend the TI would not be choice number 1 or 2
As someone earlier mentioned the casino is smokey but others on the strip are just as bad
Make sure you request a room that is not facing the strip and their nightly cannon show.. I mean everyone has to sleep a bit even in Vegas.

One of the pit bosses said the TI is the best value and best kept secret on the strip. Yea sort of..

My husband and I were married at TI on April 24, 2016. Every single thing bout the chapel and staff were PERFECT. If you're planning on getting married there, go see Bianca. However, everything else was a huge disappointment. Our room was dirty, mostly the bathroom. The counter was dirty, there was hair in the tub and PEE on the toilet! (Yes, I took photos) In the corner of the room was a 10 in spider web, and and plastic corner molding was  coming off. To top that all off, The last night we stayed, we had ordered room service.....I ended up with the worst food poisoning of my life. I plan on sending an email; to management because I after reading reviews beforehand, I still gave this place the benefit of the doubt. My recommendation is to 1. Check your room before unpacking and 2. DO NOT eat room service. Or 3. just stay somewhere else.
While it didn't seem to feature any spectacular amenities, it was a nice hotel. Affordable and kept in good shape. I would stay here again. As for location, it's in a good central location.

If you don't bother reading the rest, read this paragraph at least: there is a free tram that connects TI to the Mirage (because they are sister properties). Use the fact that you're staying at the TI to get on the guest list for JET nightclub (at the Mirage); if you're a girl, you'll have an easier time, and it never hurts to just go to the Mirage during the day and talk to the bell desk. They say it's $30 more to get a strip view, but if it's low season, you might get the upgrade if you're very very nice. TI's club, Tangerine, was closed for renovations when I arrived, so that was a bummer. There is a skybridge that connects to Fashion Show Mall; go to the half-priced tickets counter at the Mall to get discounts on shows, including the onsite show Mystere.

There are so many things I loved about this hotel. First, if you stay here, you are steps away from what I consider the best Cirque du Soleil shows in Vegas: MYSTERE. I have a separate review for that. On to other things I like:

The pool isn't incredibly large, but definitely refreshing. More than enough towels to go around, and the poolside bar has friendly and engaging bartenders. The Caribbean tropical theme is alive and well at the pool, which made me feel like I was truly in a desert oasis. There is a young, hip feeling to the place, and not thousands of kids like you might think would be there. If you had a large group with you, it looked like it would be fun to rent a cabana for the day (about $250 during the week I think).

The casino area is attractive and not too large, unlike Caesar's or the Mirage. I always felt like I had my bearings there. The general layout of the hotel is pretty easy-flowing and the front desk provides you with a map. In general, I was very pleased with the front desk; they upgraded me both times I checked into the hotel (long story), and there are free coupons for 2-for-1 drinks.

I did not eat at any of the restaurants or get pampered at the spa, but the samples from WET (the spa) in the room were very delicious-smelling and luxurious. The hotel is going through renovations (when are Vegas rooms not...?). I stayed on the 34th floor, and the view was divine, but don't trust my words alone: see the pictures.

I absolutely loved TI. From the clean, sweet smell upon opening the doors, to the $3 All-You-Can-Drink champagne at the buffet.
 
PROS:
Comfy beds, nice room, gorgeous view, 2 for 1 buffet and drink coupons, 'free' wifi, clean smell upon walking in, attentive staff, amazing buffet, fantastic location, decent pool DJ, nice clean pool (our view overlooked the strip and pool so we were able to witness daily cleaning), decently priced, free tram to and from The Mirage, Starbucks, Ben & Jerry's and a pizzeria conveniently located in the hotel and next to each other, express checkout through TV.

CONS:
$20+ resort fee, no pizza delivery to room and pizzeria closes relatively early for Vegas, pool only open til 6, no minibar\/fridge.

Vegas Trip 11AM
I love this hotel. I will never stay anywhere else. We pulled our car in and enter the bag boys always want to help...LOL..If you tip...Did not have a lot of bag so we carried our own stuff..Check in line was not long but we did not go to that line we line up where it say's invited guest because that is what we are in this place always invited and always comp room. YES COMP ROOM....We get a phone call almost every month getting invites on when are we coming back which is almost monthly always staying one day only but on this trip we stayed for 3 days. We decided to gamble early because when it get's busy here it get's busy so hard to get a table to play that is why we end up playing in the high roller sometimes just so we get some play time. minimum $100.00 per bet per table. Did i lose any money YES on the first 15 mins. i am already asking the pit boss for a refill... DAMN my bill will be high this time but guess what i do not care LOL...gambled for about 2 hours and it is time to eat again...Vegas does this to me always hungry and always eating always gambling. Got a phone call from my peeps im suppose to meet up with and they decided to go to this asian bufffet located in rainbow blvd called BUFFET@ASIAN II. This would be on my next review...

It is a GREAT value for the price and overall. We got a deluxe strip view room (worth it), it also overlooked the pool. The room and bathroom were very spacious and the beds very comfortable! Moreover, your wifi is included with your resort fees (which honestly aren't even too expensive) as opposed to lots of other hotels that charge an additional amount per day. I didn't book any special package deal when we booked, but we still had a tonne of vouchers and coupons when we got there. Discounts on the Cirque du Soleil show that is featured there (Mystere, we didn't see it though as we had other plans). We received tonnes of free drink coupons, bogo meals at the restauraunts (which are all very good, I loved Seafood Shack and coming from someone who grew up on the East Coast of Canada, that says a lot). Kahunavilla had fun bar food and I had great huevos rancheros at the Cafe. The pool area was very nice as well but you have to wake up early to get a good spot! The poolside service was kind of hit or miss, the servers took a very long time to come back around but I think perhaps they may have been understaffed, but they were very friendly. Pool was really nice and warm and it was only April. Overall a fantastic experience and it's central location is really perfect for walking the strip. Highly recommended! Oh, and the 24 hour room service is perfect for late nights and bad hangovers.

What I really like about Treasure Island is that it is nice, without being hoity-toity.  One of the things I noticed about the famous Vegas casinos is that they're either nice but overly pretentious and 'hip,' or relaxed, casual, but outdated, and I found TI to be one of the few ones that is pretty balanced.

We were actually there for my child's 9th birthday. She wanted to see a Cirque show - and Mystere was one of the kid friendly ones. I just didn't want to be trekking the strip at night with 2 young kids. Prior to a couple months ago, I had never stayed anywhere in Vegas except the Bellagio - so my expectations ...........

I got the feeling that they are definitely moving away from the "kid friendly" vibe this place used to have.

First - "TI" as they now call it is not part of any of the "groups" in Vegas. So they don't "know" you unless you have stayed there before.

The rooms were ok - smaller than what I am used to, esp for a family of 4 (2 Adults, 2 Kids). Clean... but definitely dated. The beds... OMG - if I could have packaged up the bed and taken it home! The mattress and linens were luxurious!

The pool area was decent... went there mainly for the kids. Just a pool\/cabana's.

The resort fee is a bunch-o-crap .. I don't care if it is now the industry norm. You book online and pay for the room, then they hit you up for more money when you get there? Bad business IMO.

TIP -- don't go see the "pirate" show out front with the little ones. Should be considered soft porn.... even for the strip.

This was my first time staying at Treasure Island and over all it was pretty decent.

Reasons to stay here,

-It is cheap only $250 for 2 nights, in Vegas that is a steal!
-they have ihome's in the room so you can play your ipod
-The beds are amazing!  So comfortable it was hard to get up in the morning and not want to take a nap every time we came back to the room.  If you stay here for no other reason, stay here for the beds.
-The rooms have floor to ceiling windows and we had a really good view overlooking the mirage and the Sirens show they do outside.
-It is really easy to get to the elevator inside the hotel.  I hate some of the bigger hotels were it is a hike once you get into your hotel to get to the elevator.  But not here, they are very conveniently located near the hotel entrance.

I'd definitely stay here again! Our room was nice & our bed was comfortable! We had a view of the palazzo and the strip. Minus 1 star because of the $24 resort fee, but overall we had enough room to walk around. the bathroom space was perfect, water pressure was good, and our room had a nice little porno style cleopatra chair to lay on! Loved it! However the casino sucks! It took most of my money and the machines didn't let me win shit! They have a starbucks downstairs and a lot of other places to eat, pizza.., ribs, and Hawaiian food. it's also in the middle of the strip =)

My family loves TI. The location is great and they always gives good deals on rooms. They are right across from fashion show mall. Their buffet is one of my favorites and they have chocolate cover strawberries in their dessert area. 

However, this weekend I am very disappointed with their rooms. Our beds are uncomfortable. Our rooms had 2 beds and my mom, sister and I are all rolling around and could not sleep. I woke up this morning feeling more tired than last night and my back and shoulder hurts. The pillow stinks, good thing I brought my own but still that is disgusting. I know they do not switch out the pillows but if it stinks I think it would be a good time to do so. The shower and the sink does not drain. 

I usually love TI and we always stay here. It might be the room they put us in but this upsets me. Maybe next time it will be back to how it used to be.

My girls and I just stayed in their petite suit this past weekend.  Let me tell you, five days in SinCity is a little much.

The room was smaller than we expected, nonetheless it was still nice.  Let me tell you, their king size bed is to die for!!  I could probably stay in that bed forever!!!  Our sofa was a pullout queen sized bed.  We also had two seperate bathrooms both had the toilet, closet, and counter.  The only difference was one was a whirlpool tub and the other a shower.  The room was good enough for seven girls.  =) The hottub was amazing as was the room.  

Hotel was pretty nice.  We actually had housekeeping call us to ask us what time we wanted them to come by.  That was nice.  We always called for towels, and they were always accomodating.  The staff were all friendly.  

The dealers were nice, they were patient as they helped some of my girls play Pai Gow..in the process teaching me to play as well.  The resturants were pretty good, if I do say so myself.  I love the Kahuanaville (or however you spell it).  

Vegas treats its ladies right.  We never had problems getting in the clubs, let alone get it for free. =)  ahhh..vegas how I love thee...GO HERE WITH A BUNCH OF GIRLS!!!!  

the only downer was that the one time we went to the pool there was a BIOhazard...whatever that entailed...

Me and my friends, desperate to stay at the nicest, cheapest, on strip hotel we could find in Vegas, spent weeks and months scouring the internet for deals. After blood, sweat and tears were shed we finally settled on Treasure Island, and kept our fingers crossed that we'd made the right choice...

...and we certainly did. 

Great location, friendly helpful staff, large clean rooms, plenty of bars, next to Fashion Show Mall, tram to Mirage...  the list of reasons to stay here goes on and on. 

We originally booked for 2 nights, but decided that we needed another 24 hours to do Vegas justice. Very easy to rebook the same room, and cheap too - $109 including taxes and resort fees for four of us. 

The casino is a little smaller and darker than other casinos, but that didn't bother us at all. Also, the pool wasn't the biggest we'd seen - but with pool side DJ's and a great atmosphere, we couldn't have asked for more. 

Would happily recommend to anyone heading to Vegas.

Stayed here for one night. We should have stayed here the entire trip. The room was CLEAN and MODERN! Got a ridiculously good rate (probably because it was a weekday). Service was great, lots of activities are totally wallabies. What more could you ask for! Recommend!

The valet parking was slick.  Just make sure that you have everything you need from the car.  You cannot go to your car once it is checked in.  Someone will go for you.  When you leave, tip $5-10 when they deliver your car.  The front staff were friendly and the check-in was easy.  Our King deluxe room was very nice, but the edges of the carpet had not been vacuumed.  Also, there was lots of grunge on the toilet tank where the lid meets the tank.  Probably never been cleaned.  The room was advertised for $57.09 but after the Resort Fee and taxes, the final bill came to $85.09.  A resort fee?  Really?  Although I suspect that all hotels in the area are like this, it is pretty much a scam.  Everything, especially the food, is very expensive.  Nothing is cheap.  Oh, and there was no TV guide, so you have to flip through the channels; and there was a 2 second delay for every channel change.  And when are these Vegas hotels ever going to go smoke free?

Treasure Island- excuse me- "TI" has a great location (right next to Fashion Show mall and easily walkable from the rest of the strip). The Sirens show is perfect for waking you up from an afternoon nap, the Starbucks line is always long, but they have Mystere, the first Cirque show to have a custom theater built for it. It's my next show I'd want to see when in Vegas. Looks amazing. 

It's great because it's on the corner of Las Vegas blvd and Spring Mountain Road, so you can make a quick getaway to the freeway without having to sit in stupid Strip traffic. And the beds? SOOOOOOO comfortable. This may sound weird but they have the best smelling hotel hand soap. And when you enter the lobby it always smells like a fresh spritz of..something. I'm really specific aren't I? Either way, it just smells GOOD. That's all you need to know.

The room was affordable (for LV) and very nice.  The interior is updated and modern with a good style.  I enjoyed Cirque du Solei "Mystre".  The food (at Kahunaville and The Cafe) comes in large portions and is good but very expensive.  The pool is really just for adults and could use some renovation.  It smelled pretty bad as the heat increased.  All in all, I liked the hotel and would stay there again but will first try the other casinos.

My boyfriend and I just stayed here and although the stay was good, the hotel room needed a little up keeping. The headboard had holes in it (it looked like it was from the heels of a woman's shoes) and there were marks on the walls, as well as a brown stain on the comforter. 

The bed is very comfy but the PILLOWS ARE AWFUL! If you want a sore neck with a raging headache, then these are the pillows you want. They were so hard and felt like decorative pillows. 

Dear Treasure Island, GET NEW PILLOWS! :) 
Also, the pricing of the food at the restaurants is way too high for the quality of food.

Avoid if possible. Had reservations for one of their tower suites for the Memorial day weekend. Drove all the way out from Bay Area for them to tell us our room is unavailable. How does this happen? They charged us for the first night and we weren't even checked in yet. Yes, I understand it's a busy weekend...yada,yada,yada. But is this the way to run a business? Definitely not coming here again and letting everyone I know to avoid this place like the plague. The room was very dated and reeked of cigarettes. The pirate show is cool but that's about it.

This was a great place to stay!  We found a hotwire deal for this place for about half of the usual cost.  I honestly have no complaints, other than a somewhat bland buffet, but even still, we had a 2 for 1 which the front desk gave us.  No big deal.

Free parking (if you're from LA you'll understand how nice it is to park your car and not have to pay!); check in took 5 mins; nicely themed casino.  Was much nicer than I thought it would be.

The beds are SUPER COMFORTABLE!  I can't remember the last time I had such a good night's sleep.  The rooms are super nice and modern.  Nice shower with an oversized tub.

It's not the newest or flashiest hotel on the strip, and as long as you don't expect Bellagio levels of luxury you will not be disappointed. 

The one thing that I'd like to note here (and another thing I loved about this place), is that it's not ridiculously crowded like most of the other casinos.  Because there is no mall, etc. attached to it it is not nearly as insanely crowded as other properties.  This I loved.  It is certainly busy, but you aren't "over it" in 2 hours.  Walking around Caesars, The Venetian, Cosmopolitan (admittedly nicer hotels) I got tired of quickly because there are always people in your face.

Would definitely stay here again!

One bummer:  The pirate show has been permanently discontinued :(.

Great location! Close to the Mirage (could take a Tram to Mirage), Venetian, Palazzo, Wynn and Encore.

I got hooked up here on multiple occasions!  I got upgraded to a premier suite, luxury suite, and a penthouse on 3 separate times. It was newly remodeled, so the rooms were very nice and clean. 

Food:
The restaurants here are mediocre and don't get me started on the buffet.
1) Kahunaville
2) Pho - overly priced for wack pho and service!

Casino:
Low limit, so you if you have a budget for gambling, TI is pretty good place to gamble.  
Poker room - extremely small and not worth playing there. There's never a good amount of people playing.

Service:
Quick with room service (ie, rollaway beds, towels, cups, etc...)

We spent two nights at TI arriving 12\/23 around 3pm. Had seen complaints about long lines to register but it only took us about 10 min. (There were 7 CSRs working). I hadn't realized there was going to be an extra $22 per night for the "resort fee" when we booked and pre-paid 3 months earlier but after reading online reviews was not surprised when they hit me with it. They've gotten smarter probably because of all the arguing from guests and provided a list of dubious benefits which no longer includes the pool or VIP area of the Sirens show (since there is currently no show). I managed though to get them not to tie up my cc with their cushion for "incidentals".

We were able to get non-smoking and two beds as requested. The room was clean (we do the bed-bug check immediately) and though there was an odor of mildew in the bathroom, I decided not to complain about it because I was too tired and the smell didn't extend outside the room into the bed area.

At midnight when we were back in our rooms, my son tried to use his laptop but it was taking 5 minutes for the simplest of pages to load if they came up at all. Since the damn "resort fee" covered internet access, I finally called the front desk The guy who answered was polite and didn't seem surprised by my complaint. He said that probably too many guests were online as well. Someone delivered an ethernet cable in about 15 min. It didn't help. 

Pros:  quiet - didn't hear much in the hallway and only a little of the family next door through the adjoining door.
          clean - no funky smells
          beds - COMFY
        adequate towels - not exceptionally soft or fluffy but not too thin either
          easy access to and from parking garage to strip, highway, etc.
          great strip view
          ice machine clean and funtional
          housekeepers were all friendly
          elevators adequate - no long waits
          Canter's pastrami sandwich was a winner according to the man-          child
           easy, quick, polite check-out

Neutral:  tv remote and wireless keypad were noticibly dirty (sticky) but    I always clean and disinfect anyway.
              don't drink coffee so the lack of coffee maker is fine and doesn't   take up real estate

Cons:  whatever foulness of a scent they are piping in to the casino at the entrances\/halls is possibly a deal-breaker for a future return. I hate smoke but this concoction of both just makes it vomitrocious and a misery leaving and returning to the rooms. (I noticed that the Palazzo seems to have the same feature happening so note-to-self to do research for possible Feb 2011 trip).
            resort fee - if you're gunna charge it then just put in all into your    quoted rates
            poor internet access although it did improve after the first night
            some levels in the garage had large areas of standing water
            the up escalator to the garage was not working when we were departing - had to haul my butt up manually - no small task (no small butt)

My bf and I stayed here from Friday-Sunday.  We checked in Friday at ~10pm, which took us about an hour!  Their system is REALLY slow, but you know what, I was in Vegas and wasn't going to have a hissy fit (especially since the people working the counter were really nice.)  We got a non-smoking, 1 King bed, and I was really happy with what we got.  The air smelled clean-free of smoke, and the bed looked really clean and felt so luxurious and soft (I slept SOOO well).  They had all the "new" appliances like a flat screen TV and a fake iHome to plug in your iPod.  The bathroom was spacious as well.  My only complaint would be that the walls were REALLY thin and I could hear everything that the nerdy guys in the room next to us were saying, laughing, playing graphing calculator games?  Anyway, bring ear plugs!  We also got a free "late" (one hour) check-out when I realized that we were hungover in the morning.  Check-out was a breeze- just went downstairs to the desk and told them we were out.
Horrible!!! Waited over an hour just to check in.The forgot my wake-up call, the staff was rude. Would NOT recommend.

I stayed at TI from July 5th-9th. The check in was painless and the staff were friendly. I had no problem with the room card keys. Elevators were just fine. The room was nice though I thought the bed wasn't as comfortable as others have described it. Then again, I am used to sleeping on memory foam beds so this could be the case. I agree with the others about the Coffee Shop service and food quality. However, there were a few times when the service was really great so it probably depends on what server you got.  The music is totally awesome that they play when you walk back from the Fashion Mall. I didn't get to see the Sirens of TI show though because it was canceled due to high winds two times I tried to see it.  Valet was a bit slow but that's everywhere in Vegas. They were going as fast as they could. I recommend self-parking when staying at TI.  You can't beat the location of TI as it's right by the Mirage, Caesar's and across from the Wynn.  Minus one star just because it's an older hotel built in 1989 I believe and does not have the latest amenities. I did not get a chance to try the day spa at TI nor the Christian club.
Worst show managements after buying the ticket we have to wait we will never use this hotel ever

I had a pretty decent experience on my visit at the end of July. We arrived on Thursday prior to regular check in hours but were serviced immediately. I had a deluxe room which I ask the desk clerk if there were any Strip views available she more than happily accommodated at no charge. Although my room was far from the elevator the strip view was awesome.  When I arrived at my room I was please at the cleanliness.  The only down side of the room that I could pick out was there was not a refrigerator.  I mean really TI!!!!.  

Another downside of the hotel is the pool was on the small side compared to alot of the other hotels on the Strip.  The casino itself was ok  nothing to brag about.  I did not visit any of the restaurants based on the reviews that I read.

The staff I can say made my visit very pleasant.  The conceirge was very helpful when I needed assistance with places to go and the best way to get there.  The Bell Desk was very accomodating as well.

Overall, I would stay again if I come across another good deal.

Stayed here 11\/15-11\/17 and I wouldn't mind coming back. Paid a little over $300 for two nights, not too shabby, probably because it wasn't Comedy Festival time. The location is great which was very important to my club hoppin, heel wearin self. Like the other Yelpers mentioned, the bed was very soft, as if I were trapped inside a marshmallow. Decent eating options, still didn't get to try the Pho place but tried Kahunaville. The only thing I have to complain about are the surly workers but I don't blame them.

Loved this hotel! Check in was a breeze! We had a view of the strip and the pool area. The rooms were very nice and modern. We had a problem with the IPOD deck but I called downstairs and they brought one up promptly. The casino area wasn't hella big nor was it small. It was just right for me :). They had a bridge type thing that connects you to the Fashion Show Mall. It is outside and it was burning up but it wasn't to bad. 

The beds were so comfy, I wish my bed was that nice lol. Everything was clean and nice. 

Price wise: I got our hotel on a promotion deal they were having but I don't think their hotel is that expensive even without the deal I received. However, if they cont to have deals like that, they will see me every year I'm in Vegas lol! 

Overall, def will stay here again! I want to try out Cesar's Palace or MGM just to see what the other hotels are like but I def recommend TI.

TI Smells like crap, the first smell you get walking in is a fusion of coconut, sweat, and cigarettes. The rooms at least don't smell but they are very inadequate and not well maintained. In my 4 days there I found that: TV was barely functioning and incredibly small, mini fridge was either broken or extremely weak, bathroom had the bare necessities, and the staff was unfriendly as hell.  Room service as the previous reviewer stated is insanely expensive. Overall I regret trying to save money by going here for EDC. Fix your shit TI or at least try to.

BEST VALUE FOR YOUR PRICE HANDS DOWN!!!!!!!

I didn't really know what to expect, b\/c i had heard about the rennovations, but had no measure of comparison since I had never been before. TI DEFINITELY surpassed my expectations. The rooms are actually really nice: SUPER comfy beds, ipod docks, updated furniture, flat screen TV, granite in the bathrooms, etc. I wasn't expecting it to be as nice as it was. Only downside: NO FANS in the bathroom. Definitely a huge bang for your buck. Great location too (about 3 min walk to TAO!). The inside of the casino is pretty small and I wouldn't recommend the buffet (nothing special). I would definitely stay here again.

This hotel used to be my go to place to stay. However recently I have noticed maid service is iffy on quality and the food throughout is way less than iffy! My main complaint is parking. Although free parking, valet crew is not nearly what it used to be and self park at your own risk! My car was broken into twice in three weeks. Window smashed, glass everywhere and I found it, not security!! Second time it happened in broad daylight. And don't get me started on security! Most uncaring jerks on the strip, could care less what happened to you! Just hand you a form to write down what happened and say call risk management. Well I did and still waiting to have them call me back a month later!! I'm easy to please just don't treat me like you don't give a crap!!! Spent a lot of money here but I'm done!!!

This place sucks I paid for 160 to equal 200 for most of there resturants and I called down the day I checked out to make sure I wasn't over and they told me I had 17.82 left and then when I checked out they then told me I had a balance of 236.00 that I owed them don't stay hear they are liers and thieves

Pack extension cords this hotel has hardly any plugs ! It was awful for 2 adults with cell phones and flat irons. 
The pool is so small and so crowded and no shade unless you get a cabana, I asked about an umbrella the guy said they can't have them because the pool area is so small. I think it's time for an upgrade guys !

A decent choice for staying on the strip for a reasonable price.  Not one of the newest hotels, but a spacious and comfortable home base for exploring the strip-scene and taking it all in.  I stayed in one of the Suites on the thirtieth floor, which was equipped with a hot-tub, two bathrooms, and a huge bedroom area.  I was happy.

One thing that was kind of a drag was that the casino floor was packed all the time with people cranking cigarettes.  Hey, its Vegas but it still turned me off having to walk through it all the time. To be fair, most if not all of the casinos are like this.  

On the last day of my stay, the group I was with rented a poolside cabana which was great.  They bring your food and drinks right to the little hut, and attentively come by every half-hour or so to check-in on the group.  Definitely worth the dough if you are into poolside hanging out.  Highly recommended.

The only reason they get a 2 is because of location. Rooms are small (and ours was dirty). Pool is small. Service was below par. It's an old building and I'm guessing there is only so much they can do with it.

I have stayed at treasure island multiple times. And I will continue to stay there. I feel safe, it is clean, and there is always security around. It's not like other casinos where people are walking through it constantly to get to the next one. The rooms are always clean and the bed is pretty comfortable as well.
Senor Frog's is garish. Talk about selling out.

We just stayed here over the weekend and it was fantastic!

We needed a place where 6 girls could stay for about $1000 for 2 nights.  At TI we got a giant suite + 2 adjoining regular rooms for that price - best thing we found on the strip! That wasn't at some oober sketch place lol.

The rooms were awesome.  Completely updated, hot tub jacuzzi bathtub in the suite, tons of room, nice amenities, really just a great room.  We ordered room service one morning and that was great as well.

Definitely would recommend staying here if you're looking for a great affordable hotel!

We got a super great deal for staying during a weekend in June. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. We got a killer view of the pool and strip.. a major plus.

Downside of this hotel was the lobby area. It was so unorganized. Checking in on a Saturday took 45 min-1 hr. The line wrapped like a Disneyland ride. 

Although the food choices are slim. There's a Starbucks in the back towards the Mystere theatre so you don't need to go next door to the Fashion Mall.

I'd stay here again if the price was right... although they had some major construction going on around the front of the hotel and it made walking on the sidewalks a little harder than normal with traffic

I don't know why, but very surprisingly I really loved staying at Treasure Island.  We upgraded to a Petite Suite with a view of the strip; it was awesome.  Large TV, King size bed, 2 bathrooms (his\/hers) with a huge shower in one and a huge 2 person jetted tub in the other, a sofa (that pulls out if you need it), desk & pub table.  It was very nice and the bed was comfy.  They even gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne for our anniversary!  Plus they let us check in a couple hours early.  The maid service was efficient (although they knocked at 8a on our last day - boo!) and the whole stay was wonderful.  It is also nice because it isn't a behemoth casino and it is easy to find your way around, but they still have lots of shops, restaurants and games.  I would recommend.

We stayed at Treasure Island from May 7-10 and our experience was great! My boyfriend and I picked this place because it had the cheapest rates and was only a 5min walk to the palazzo where our friends were staying. When we checked in we found out were upgraded to an executive suite on the 28th floor--it was so nice we actually thought there must have been some sort of mistake. The room was HUGE with a massive king bed, living room, view of the strip, and two bathrooms--one with a massive jacuzzi tub. We called downstairs to thank them for such a great kick off to our weekend and we were told we were also on something called "the champagne list"... UMMM what?! All we had to do was call room service and say "im on the champagne list...." (With or without a hair flip), and guess what? A magical wonderful fairy brought us a bucket with ice and champagne!! FO FREE. I've noticed some complaints about customer service but every single person I encountered was friendly and knowledgable! 

Treasure island is really trying to change their vibe. It's not really a pirate themed spot anymore but more "spring break 4evr". They don't even call themselves Treasure Island.... It's the TI. We didn't really go to any of the bars in the casino but I loved how it wasn't so massive That I was always lost. There's a 24hr CVS in the casino which was the best ever because I'm the worst at packing and forget everything. Our stay including late check out was under $350 making this our best priced trip EVER. We are fully converted to TI, and already have convinced our friends it's the best location and price on the strip. Can't wait to go back!!

My only complaint... And this is silly... The lighting in the hotel room was kind of yellow and put a weird tint on all my selfies. Lol.

The rooms, pool and buffet were very nice and what I expected. The games were very tight and did not pay out much at all. The public spaces had a smell piped in that seemed like a mix of Ozone and Pina Coloda... very nauseating. Not sure if they were going for a tropical bar smell or just trying to cover up the smoking odors... however, none of the other hotels had this issue. We ended up spending most of our time away from our hotel primarily for this reason... I just could not stand the smell.

The drink and food prices were very spendy (as with most of the strip). The best deal was the buffet ... look for the buy 1 get 1 1\/2 off deal.

We wanted to play some of the tables, but we are not big spenders when it comes to gambling... we were thrown off by only seeing $10 on up minimum bet tables.

Also a complaint that I have in general (not just TI) is I miss the chink chink chink of the coins.  I was turned off my using vouchers for my gambling... I might as well stayed home and played my computer games... Much cheaper and enjoyable.

Needless to say we only lost about $50 between the two of us gambling in Treasure Island... if they would fix their gambling payouts and minimum bets then I am sure we would have lost much more.

My advice to you... if you can stand weird odors and price is an issue then TI may be for you... Myself, I will never return there. I will spend the extra money and stay at a different hotel that has better gambling and no strange odors that makes me feel sick every time I walk through it.

Great hotel for a great price. My
Friends and I booked the petite suite and it was incredibly spacious. It had a king sized bed and a pull out couch bed. Also, the two bathrooms was a HUGE plus. One of the bathrooms had a giant tub and the other had a shower. 

The view wasn't too great, as the window was tiny, but I didn't mind too much. The room was clean and conveniently located right by the elevators. 

The hotel itself is located on the strip and is right across the street from the Venetian and palazzo. Treasure island is conveniently accessible to these hotels via bridge. Additionally, there is a Walgreens across the street as well.

Also, the vibe at the pool was very cool. Probably not suitable for children as the pool is packed with drinking adults and a DJ blasting music.

I would highly recommend the hotel if you're looking for something nice, but within a decent price range!

Over all great customer service stayed in the suite private level all the way at the top 36 floor had a blast one of the best hotels in the strip budget wise highly recommended, would definitely sty here again.

Let me start by saying that, I'm being very generous with a 4 star rating here but honestly I have never had a bad stay here (2 visits). Nowadays I'll book here when I have to go on a quick trip or if I'm on a tight budget.

BASIC is the one word to describe TI. It was one of the mainstays in the 1990s and early 2000s, but as soon as the big boys started coming in, it sort of just fell back in the shadows.

However, if you're not looking to spend for some of the higher tier hotels but want to stay above some of the lower end joints (Flamingo, Harrahs, etc), TI is one of your better picks.  Rooms are clean and simple. The pool is comfortable but far from luxurious.  Casino leans towards mid-lower limits, so if you want a clean yet affordable place to gamble. the TI would suite your needs.

Also be sure to tip the representative at check-in. Super easy to get a strip view upgrade from the basic room and TONs of coupons (BOGO buffets, comp drink, etc)! 

My biggest complaint would be the lack of a nightclub. I like to pick a hotel where I can just drink beyond my limits on one of the nights of my visit and be able to walk right upstairs to my room and knockout. They had the Christian Audigier Nightclub a couple years back, but it closed down. 

This review didn't really sell TI as your Vegas destination haha. But if you just want a clean room to crash at, it's a great value. And the location is top notch. You're right next door to xS, Tryst, Surrender, Tao, and 1OAK Nightclubs, so you'll save a ton on cab fees.

Overall, a SOLID and great VALUE spot.

Just checked in and the lady who assisted had a major attitude when I told her my company made the reservation for me she quickly handed me a form I need them to fill out to charge card I was eager to check in as I had a long day so I paid for it. She didn't give me room options as she said it's the time I'm checking in. I'm like wth?! Ok so I just went ahead with whatever as I'm not one to complain. Enter the room it smells horrible! Like wet carpet thank God I had Lysol! The beds looked like someone already took a nap in them and the toilet had pee and pubic hair all around it! Don't think I would ever stay here again!

Hotel: I love staying at Treasure Island when I'm in Vegas! The rooms are also very nice. Beds were comfy, the bathroom was clean and spacious and the hotel room was very quiet. Also theres a free show in front of the hotel and Treasure Island guests get special VIP viewing. The casino is also nice and spacious not super crammed.

Location: The hotel is located right next to Fashion Show Mall, theres a tram that takes you next door to the Mirage, and also its a short walk to the Wynn and Venetian across the street. Its not in the middle of the strip, but it is definitely centrally located to some of the best hotels in Vegas. 

Price: Not bad at all, I believe we paid around $129 for 3 weekday nights including a Friday. 

Service: Friendly, checking in there was a long line but checking out was no problem at all. The information desk is also helpful and was able to print out our boarding passes for us (there is a charge but it is super convenient).

Atmosphere: Not a trashy or out dated hotel at all. I felt comfortable and safe here, no weirdos or troublemakers running around.

Ophelia Worlund who is the night time manager is a racist and a liar she should be reported. I will never come to this hotel again because of her. Remember the name Ophelia Worlund. Night Shift Manager who is a racist and a thief and a liar.

Ruined my experience

Stayed at TI last week from Tues to Thursday. At $50 plus $25 resort fee is a bargain. Located at the Strip and convenient to other hotels. All the hotels at the strip charges a resort fee ranging from $25-$30. Rooms are newly redesign and clean. Plus they give you a free buffet for one person for each day you stay there.

I was here in 2013 and it was for a bachelor party.  At that point it was great.  Lots of booze, a pool, and a casino.  We really didn't need more than that.

In 2014 I came with my wife and I came and stayed here.  We check in, we are informed that they didn't have the king bed we booked three months ago.  So we got a room with two queens.  I initially put my stuff on one of the beds and it just sank.  The springs in the mattress were well past their prime.  So we went to the other bed, it was fine.

Then my wife goes to take a shower.  She asks me to call the front desk and ask for a new shower head.  I ask her why and she tells me because we didn't have one.  Really?!?! someone stole the shower head from the room and the hotel didn't realize it and replace it before we get there.

They fixed the issue, but it shouldn't have occured in the first place

The room was large and clean,king bed comfortable. Descent for a mid range price( 330$) for 
 2 nights. The casino it's self obviously older, poor selection of over priced sub par food. Small pool. Lame set up, the parking is Far from check in. I did like the location,nice proximity to Wynn,Encore,Mirage. You pay for what you get,next time I'll spend more. No more pirates show,boo.

Mediocre hotel with less than desirable amenities. We stayed in one of their deluxe rooms which included one king bed, a desk, and... that's about it! There was no fridge (excluding the usual overpriced beverage fridge), bathroom was decently sized but nothing to boast about, and the room itself needed an update as it was pretty dreary and uninviting. We had asked for a late checkout (usually around 3:00PM) and the front desk said it would cost $100 PLUS tax! Likewise, be prepared to wait in a long check-in line!! If you decide to pay an extra $50 they'll allow you to check-in early, if not, be prepared to wait until 3:00PM!

Resort fees were $28 and included access to their gym (which wasn't all too impressive to say the least and closes at 7:00PM), wifi access for TWO mobile devices ONLY, two for one coupon for their buffet, and a few drink coupons.

The few positive things about staying at TI?...It's on the strip and there is a free tram that takes you to and from the Mirage Hotel. It's also walking distance from the Fashion Mall and the Vietnamese Coffee Shop\/pho restaurant inside the hotel is pretty decent for those late night munchies! The Cirque du Soleil show, "Mystere", is also located inside this hotel and it is decent for the price. We paid around $30 for our tickets at those 1\/2 off stands and thought Mystere was "OK" but nothing compared to "KA" at the MGM (my personal favorite) or "O" at the Bellagio.

As the saying goes, you get what you pay for. Yea, the rates may be lower compared to other hotels but, in all honesty, I'd much rather fork out the extra money and stay somewhere nicer like the Wynn, Encore, Caesar's Palace, Palazzo, Vdara, Cosmopolitan, Bellagio, or even Aria! You'll get better customer service, nicer rooms, and an overall better experience!

Bad survive you want to upgrade  your room they charge you  50$ per day no wifi soon as you walk into the hotel there is a really bad smell the stores are really expensive a burger cost 20 buck  in a honeymoon suite there isn't any champagne it'll bring up strawberries they don't have a copy machine they don't give you a wake up call didn't call you a cab it's really horrible service I wouldn't buy they want to go there I made we can look for them to clean and Amy give you shampoo or conditioner's  they leave you the old empty ones

Despite having a room on a non-smoking floor, the occupants of the adjoining room were smoking what was very likely marijuana. The smoke from their room seeped into our room through the service door, as well as into the hallway. As a result, our room had a very strong smell in it. While the bell desk did send someone up to spray our room and warned our neighbors not to smoke, the reprieve from the smoke smell was temporary. After leaving our room for a few hours, we found that our neighbors had smoked yet again, stinking up our room and requiring a second visit from housekeeping.
To make matters worse, despite our pleading, we were told that we would not be able to change rooms until the following night. As a result, we were forced to endure a full night of the stench of drug smoke.

It is understandable to not want to embarrass your guests by "busting them" for bad behavior (after all, Vegas strives to be an adult playground). If a hotel is going to allow such bad behavior in a guest however, it should not be at the expense of another guest. If someone wants to stink up there room with smoke, so be it, but don't make us have to suffer through it too.

We've shared our experience with all of our friends and will most certainly never stay here again.

They made a serious error by replying the $35\/day resort fee and gave us no service. Also, the hygiene standards are very poor that all of our family members were allergic to the sofa and chairs in the room. This is how I give it the worst rating of ruining my vacation.
Awesome location on the strip. Modern rooms. Great crowd.

We stayed at Treasure Island this past weekend for $88\/per night (before the $20\/day resort fee) that we got by booking on Priceline. 

The good:
*The walk from the garage to the lobby and guest elevators is not far.
*The hotel itself is not super large so it's very easy to get around.
*No cover for TI guests at Christian Audigier the Nightclub
*Good location - between Mirage and Fashion Show Mall and across from Wynn, Palazzo, and Venetian
*Despite booking on Priceline, we got a room with a Strip view

The bad:
*Rooms are nothing special. I have had nicer and bigger rooms at Hyatts.
*Trash on the floor upon walking in (it was just a plastic wrapper, but still) and a dirty shower curtain.
*Lackluster food and nightlife options.

The ugly:
*Despite having a "Do Not Disturb" sign on our door at 11 am on Saturday morning, maintenance still decided to know on our door twice to replace an air filter. Really? Really? Did he not see the sign on the door? Did it really need to be done that minute? It couldn't have waited until either we left the room for the day or when we checked out on Sunday? Needless to say we were pretty upset and mentioned it to the front desk when we checked out.

While not a horrible choice for a hotel, especially for a cheap price, there are much better options on the Strip.

Treasure island is my one and only favorite place to be in Vegas. From the time it takes to set up a quick reservation from a friendly assistant on the other line, to the beautiful and fun atmosphere, their amazing players card rewards, and their should be marked five star hotel rooms, this place is hands down a plus! I valet my car, and open the door and I feel like I'm entering my second home. I go to vegas five to six times a year because my best friend lives there, and For four years I've been bouncing back and forth between other places to stay and here, and none have come close.
Hidden fees check your paperwork. Every other guest was complaining about the same thing. Staff and management don't care once the have your money you are stuck.

This review is for the pool and cabana service. A day at the pool Labor Day weekend was perfect! Cabana was reasonably priced, came stocked with beverages and a complimentary fruit platter. All of the servers were friendly and sweet, food came hot and quickly and the cabana hostess checked on us often. DJ played fun music all day long. Cabana #12 had the perfect mix of sun and shade throughout the day. The only thing that could have been better was more food selections on the menu and dessert.

Enhance your Vegas experience by staying somewhere else. Overpriced for what you get. Unhelpful staff. The customer is at the bottom of the totem pole and the all-mighty dollar is at the top. I know that's more or less what Vegas is all about, but TI relishes in it. Two thumbs down.

We stayed here with the kids after we left the hell-hole called Circus Circus and the rooms were really nicely renovated and reasonably priced, it was like night and day!  

We ate at the buffet and it was okay.  

The pirate show was cancelled so the kids were disappointed.  

They did enjoy the gift shop with lots of pirate toys!  Hotel is great to stay at but I know they do have a disclaimer for the pirate show, and like other parents, I thought, it can't be that bad!  I was wrong!

So fast-forward a few months later and we finally get down to see the show. 

Seriously?  

It's like the Pussy Cat Dolls!  A bunch of raunchy maidens dancing around half naked, this show is not for kids!

To make matters worse, we were there on a Saturday night for the 7 p.m. show and on our way out to see the show we ran into so many drunk idiots in the lobby near the valet.  Lots of scum bags and scum bagettes.  I guess because there's  a honky tonk located near the entrance so all the hillbilly's staggered out of there after a binge day of drinking Coors Light!  Security!  

With that being said,  we left early before the show ended.  Plus the fireballs during the show are enough to light your hair on fire, good thing I stopped using Aqua Net!
It's outdated and lacking amenities. There aren't enough plugs in the room which is very inconvenient when traveling for business. The rooms are small, they are worn out, and everything is just meh.

HORRIBLE PLACE!!!  The name speaks for it self!  The original Treasure island was for criminals.  It appears this place is as well.  When security takes their time to get to a room when a guest is being choked by an intruder pretty much sounds like an inside job to me.  The staff was completely rude when the complaint was made, they wanted to keep it hush hush.  And didn't want the cops involved.   So if you want your stuff stolen, to be attacked, or treated like complete garbage well this is the place for you.

VALET DENTED MY TRUCK'S REAR BUMPER AND THEY WONT RETURN MY CALLS. I did a claim before I left, I saw the dent right when they brought me the vehicle. Trying to get ahold of them is nearly impossible. The rude woman that keeps answering the phone said to stop calling, they would call me back, and hung up on me several times. She didn't want to give her name. I know who you are ALEXIS BROWN! This is what I am dealing with people . DONT STAY HERE. I WONT ANYMORE.

If you're in Treasure Island Hotel, Las Vegas Management team or prospected guest interested in staying at the hotel, please read this:
         I'm a 33 year old engineer with a graduate degree and have been serving the US Navy for almost a decade.  I rarely complain about services I pay for, so I am a happy customer 90% of the time, but my experience with Treasure Island Hotel in Las Vegas was absolutely devastating and the worst service I have ever paid for in my life.  I had to write this letter since no one from the hotel's direct management team has been neither responsive to my issue nor cooperative.  Please read my story below if you think you can help or if this could affect you.  
         On Friday 17 of Feb 17, my wife Sarah and I decided to celebrate Valentine's weekend in Las Vegas. We had not had a romantic getaway since our beautiful baby (Sophia) was born eight months ago. We were extremely excited for the trip and enjoyed the drive from San Diego, CA. We checked in at The Treasure Island Hotel and Casino (on Vegas Strip) Friday night of the 17 of Feb 17 and we were planning on checking out on Sunday 19 FEB 17. We also were very excited to see Circus Du Soleil show in the same hotel for Saturday night since we paid for the tickets as part of the hotel package.
        On Saturday 18 Feb 17 around 5:00 PM, the fire sprinkler systems in our room was accidentally activated. I am tall guy (6"4) and I was moving my hanged clothes from the bathroom to the closet when a hanger barely touched the sprinkler setting it off (I found out later that the sprinkler had no casing around it even when regulations clearly mandate it). Water started pouring and the room was flooded in no time.  Sarah panicked and went outside screaming for help. It took maintenance and management over 15 min for them to show up and shut the water off. It was too late and water damage had already occurred in the room by the time they showed up. Our personal belongings were damaged as well (clothes, cell phones, and laptop). It was a nightmare and what made it even worse is how the hotel security and manager treated us.
           Firstly, the hotel security and manager were extremely rude assuming that the incident was intended and that it was our fault.  They all marched into our room completely infringing leaving us no privacy.   We were treated like we just committed a crime. I asked for privacy since I was wearing only my underwear boxer briefs and needed to change quickly into something dry, but they bluntly stated that they're not leaving the room.  One of them was a really big bouncer who clearly threatened us that if we don't willingly pack our stuff, pay the damages, and leave the hotel (even though we paid for that night), he was going to forcefully and physically throw us out on the street.  We were completely wet, startled, and covered in some kind of black chemical that came out of the sprinkler with the water, so the idea of not even being offered a room to shower and change into dry clothes was just shocking to us. On top of all of that, they prohibited us from attending Circus Du Soleil show which was happening that same night at the hotel auditorium, which I still cannot understand why until now since Circus Du Soleil is a separate company and our tickets were paid! 
          We had no choice but to give away our show tickets to a stranger, take our stuff, and get into our car completely disappointed and livid. This was around 8:30 PM Saturday night of President's Day weekend, so everything was sold out or $$$$\/night.  After about 2 hours of calling hotels, we were able to stay in a low stars Inn for $200 and drive back to San Diego the next day.
        Today 23 FEB 17, I received a bill from Treasure Island Hotel and Casino for $7056 for room damage. We are given two weeks only to pay the full amount or they will send the bill to collection. I honestly do not have the money and I believe we were treated so horribly with zero customer service. We were forced out the hotel in the most disrespectful way possible before our check out date wet on a cold and windy winter night, they did not let us go to the show for which we had pre-paid tickets, forced us to find a cheap hotel room for $200, and claimed that the incident was our fault charging us 7 thousand dollars! 
        We could not be more disappointed with the way Treasure Island Hotel and Casino treated my wife and I. No one deserves this treatment. My wife and I are both highly educated (Masters degrees) and we both professionals working for the Federal Government. 
I will never step a foot again in the Treasure Island Hotel and Casino. I do have pictures and videos of the room and the way we got treated from the hotel staff.
          I am hoping this issue gets resolved without going to court because I am going to do everything I can to correct it and gain my dignity back.

Just checked in and the jerks downgraded my suite!  While the counter clerk was nice, the manager was arrogant and only offered food vouchers.  You just insulted me and checked my room out - what makes you think I want your food?!  Worse no refunds...I am sure I will still have a great time, but based on this experience and what I have heard do not stay at TI or Treasure Island under any circumstances!!!

When Treasure Island tried to re-brand themselves as T.I., they should have used the rapper as an inspiration. Then, and only then, might I have found some enjoyment at yet another whole hotel doing the stupid Vegas theme shit.

Rooms are nothing special, though they charge ridiculous fees for things like daily newspapers and wi-fi (the former which we didn't actually receive, the latter which should be free.)

Oh and to top it off, Christian Audigier has a club here too. So not only do you get to deal with all the normal dumb tourists, you get the stupid bros and hos who go for that stuff too.
Gillys Gillys Gillys!!!   Need i say more???  You have to go on sundays if you are ever in vegas on a sunday!!   Bikini bull riding is awesome and beer is pretty cheap also!!!
For $50 a night, I have no complaints. The room was cheap, clean, huge and it definitely was what I call a resort. Staff is super friendly and they offer free parking. Awesome.

Ohhhhh Vegas...you damaged my liver, my pocketbook, my sleep pattern and who knows what else.  I want to see you again.  Soon.  Mi amor.

Enough about my problems, the question is, will I stay at t.i., fka Treasure Island again?  

The answer: Yes.

While t.i. is not a 5 star resort, it is a solid option for something mid-grade, decently priced and centrally located on the strip.  It was a perfect spot for a bachelor party that was not spending a large amount of time in the room.  It also begs the question, if you're in Vegas, why are you spending any time, besides sleeping...errr, passing out, in your room?  There are funds to be lost at the tables and drinks to be had!

Highlights:
1. The Coffee Shop was a great morning and late-night stop for food.  Decently priced as well.
2. The pool had a good amount of talent walking around, though 1 in every 2 gals had a tattoo.  And  of those tattoos were tramp stamps.  Sign of the times I guess.
3. Location, location, location!  It's a quick walk or taxi ride to all the hot spots on and off the strip.

Lowlifes:
1. The maid service was slow...if it even showed up at all.  While they did a decent job at cleaning the room, they forgot to re-stock the towels (among other things.)  A call to the housekeeping desk did not get it done either.  Swiping some from a passing maid cart was how I did not have to drip dry on my ensuing shower.  
2. The buffet was just gross and over-priced.  I've never been a big fan of buffets anyway and this confirmed my prior beliefs.
3. The Sports Book:  I wish they read a book on how to make a good place for watching and betting on sports.

Keys to getting the best price:
1. Booking online with the hotel directly or calling the hotel directly had the best pricing.
2. If you are a AAA Member, you can get a 10% discount off your room rate.  Though you do need a separate AAA card for each room.
3. Book early!  The hotel was sold out by the time we had arrived and the rooms were over $150 more than the price we got it at.
4. Want an extra bed?  A single sized rollaway is only $20\/night.
Pretty good restaurants and things to do in the hotel,  room service sucks, nice looking place.

Mediocre hotel on the strip. My room was mediocre, the lines to check in and out were long, and I've stayed at several other hotels on the strip (most of which were nicer hotels) that didn't assess an "early check in charge!" Wi-fi and resort fees may now be common practice, but "early check-in fee" was a new one. And pretty shady, in my opinion, especially since I was flying in from a different time zone. I also felt insulted by the staff during check-out: I was just standing at the taxi stand, holding my bags so I didn't forget anything. The attendant said "Oh, you don't want me to touch your things, huh?" VERY sarcastic. And I told him no sleight was intended, it was just early in the morning and I didn't want to forget anything. He was still nice enough to open the door of the taxi for me while the driver stowed my bag, and I did thank them both, but again the TI attendee very snarkily said "You're WELCOME." I wasn't sure if he didn't hear me thank him or just being ugly (again), but I'm pretty affronted about the whole thing. My company booked me into TI, I will lobby for a different spot next time I go to Vegas!

I wondered when was the last time they dust the room. Spending almost $300 a night and i had to dust my bed headboard so that i dont have to sneeze all night. And finger prints all over on the funiture like CSI  came in to investigate.....just disgusting.

NEVER AGAIN. I had booked a room for two nights in Treasure Island. We reached the hotel at 2:30am and they refused to check us in despite the room having been paid for. They said their system was being updated and gave us no time frame. After an hours wait we walked away. The hotel even refused to refund us our money. I wish I could give a Negative stars- Treasure Island would have got negative infinity.

Treasure Island was kind of a disappointment for me. I stayed here with a few girlfriends for a bachelorette party and I really wanted to love it but I just didn't!

ROOM: The room was just ok. It was clean but not very roomy. I thought the room was rather small. The bathroom was clean though, bonus points there! Another bonus was the radio\/alarm dock in the room so I was able to play my music from my phone while we were getting ready to head out. The gross part was that my comforter had these nasty looking stains on them! At least swap them out for a comforter that doesn't have stains! Yuck!

CASINO: T.I is pretty big, filled with tons of slot machines and tables. The tables were always packed and the limits were pretty high. I actually got lost a few times heading up to my room! But like any other casino\/hotel, once you're there long enough you eventually figure out your way around. What I really didn't like was how I had to play MAX on video poker in order for my drinks to be compt. And on top of that, the bartender paced us, only allowing us to order drinks between 15 minute intervals, super LAME! Read my review for Harrahs and you'll see why this is super lame!

STAFF: Besides the bartender eyeing every drink we ordered and double checking to make sure we were playing MAX bet, the staff was friendly and attentive.

What I do like about T.I is that I was able to sign up for a slot play and I actually came in third place and won $150 credits on my T.I card, whoo-hoo! I took my credit to the high limit slots and played there and won like $200! Totally made my last day in Vegas! 

T.I was just ok for me. It's at the end of the strip too. Would I stay here again? Most likely not unless it's free!

The rooms are clean and manicured, along with a great lobby and central location right next to everything. The valet service was abrupt when we first arrived and offered no help for our luggage, which is the main reason for the 4 star rating. Great place, Tao club across the street and shopping right next door. Definitely a clean and friendly hotel!

I will be back for 4 reasons:
1) location
2) price
3) comfy bed
4) easy to navigate throughout the casino

The room
Stayed in room 35065 with views of traffic and Fashion Show Mall. My room was missing 2 lamps and a hair dryer. Lack of lighting will make your makeup application a hassle, so pull up a chair in the bathroom. The fridge was broken. 

The service
Omg the check-in line moved slower than my airport and the TSA line combined. Took 2 calls for housekeeping to deliver a hair dryer, but at least they came... 1 hour and 15 minutes later.. after INSISTING I wasn't looking hard enough. Also, if you're staying for just 2 nights they will replenish your towels, but will not clean your tub. It's a soaking tub too, but not as big as I had hoped it'd be.

Comfort
Loved their bed! Hated their pillows - it's much too high\/fluffy for my bf and I (I'm 5'3", he's 5'9") The heater is quiet. No water sounds from your neighbors!

Location
This place is small enough that you won't get lost while sober. If I was staying at the Venetian, I'd somehow end up in the Palazzo and can't find my way back to my room.  I like TI's tiered elevator system which probably goes from level 1-15, 16-30, and 31-36. Up the escalators will take you to the bridge which crosses to Fashion Show Mall. Across the street is the Venetian and Palazzo, where you'll be able to have better choices for dining.

My girlfriends booked two rooms here and a suite for our friend's bachelorette party.
When we arrived, our rooms weren't ready despite our request for early check in and calling in before hand to confirm. That was somewhat annoying because we were on a time crunch to set up the room and decorate it with panties, phallic-themed goodies and all the bachelorette fixings. 

Regardless, we were able to get in after a 45 minute wait in the lobby.
ROOM:I was surprised to see how renovated and nice the rooms were. Usually you don't think luxury when you hear "Treasure Island". I was expecting just very plain décor, but the rooms were nicely furnished, clean, spacious, and had modern décor. They looked newly renovated! 
The three rooms we booked were adjacent, so it was a large suite basically with a total of 3 beds. Also, I forgot to mention that the lobby offered 3 bottles of champagne (one for each room) as an apology for the late check in. Not too shabby. When they delivered the bottles we had finished decorating the room and hung up the bridal panties by the door so I'm sure the room service guy thought we were funny lol. 

POOL\/AMENITIES: We rented a cabana by the pool for our party and the service from our waitress was excellent!! She was so sweet and so attentive. They have beer pong tables to play, lots of lounge chairs to lay out on, and the cabanas are close enough to the pool yet far enough for some privacy. The food was SO good!!!! I ordered a kale salad and it was ENORMOUS and super flavorful. Everyone rolled their eyes that I got a salad, but those beezys were taking it all back when I let them try the delicious salad. The other girls ordered pinwheels (mini wraps), stuffed jalapenos, fruit, and other finger foods. As far as I remember, it was all really good. For drinks I ordered a canned coconut vodka that I saw on the menu. I also got eyerolls because of that. But hey guess what, it was also BOMB! Ingredients were just unsweetened coconut water and vodka, and that's it! the waitress put it in a cup with ice and she threw in fresh fruit and viola! It was amazing. 

NIGHTLIFE\/RESTAURANTS: 
They have a senor frogs here at TI so we decided to eat there the first day (lunch). It wasn't too packed and there was a air-balloon lady making us crowns\/hats. it was all in the name of fun. 
We also saw that they have a Latin Night on Saturdays so we came for that (we're a group of Latinas) lol. The line was CRAZY long but we had a bachelorette, and just went to the front of the line, perked up the girls, and got in no problem LOL. 

Overall: our stay here was fun and stress free. rooms were great, location of TI is good (nearby the Venetian\/Palazzo), and the things to do in the hotel were cool (pool, senor frogs). 
I'd definitely come back here!

Price is great and location is right in the middle of the strip.  It maybe a little older than the other resorts but probably a better deal than the Mirage or Caesar's. It's easy to get to--you technically don't have to drive on the strip to get to it and once you park in their garage, you can leave your car there until it's time to go home.  The rooms and the hotel in general may be antiquated but the amenities are there without the added cost of a "name" brand. If I were to do it again, I'd stay here again.

Stayed this past Fri-Sun.

Room was clean and well taken care of while we were there.

TV had issued that never really got resolved after a couple of attempts by the hotel to fix.

Breeze Bar staff very hit and miss.  Sat and watched some Sat FB while playing Video Poker at the bar....with free drink coupons and credit for playing cost my companion and I only $5 overall.  But the bar tenders on a Sat afternoon are far from energetic or engaging....just going through the motions.

TI Buffet is one to avoid.   Got two free passes when checking in but only good Mon-Fri so we decided to use them for a late dessert on Fri evening but ended up snacking on other items as well.  It was close to 10pm closing time so did not think much of Buffet being sub part at that time.  Then had BOGO that we used for Sun Brunch with free Mamosa's....breakfast was no better than later dinner.  Overall spent $30 on four total meals and still feel a little disappointing.

Checked out the Sports Book on Sunday before leaving to get some scores on the early games and found this to be the smallest and least accommodating SB on the strip.  The big screen TV's on the wall look like they are from the 90's and still 4x3 aspect ratio, low definition rear projection from the looks of them.  Could not even read the scores on some it was so bad.

Overall, most staff was friendly and helpful, room was nice and location not bad.  But for $120 a night all in with the $28 "resort fee" and taxes I think I will try someplace else on the strip next time.

Great location (walking distance to the mall + food court, close to encore and wynn, a few minutes walk to venetian, palazzo) 

room was spacious and clean. lots of restaurants inside (starbucks! didnt eat at any of the restaurants though...pretty overpriced.) 

the pool was pretty spacious as well, and they were playing good music allll day. ;) our room faced the pool and we woke up to music booming from outside...had to get out of bed to join the fun downstairs! :) 

only thing is: our room didnt lock. it closed..but didnt lock. and we found out the second night. nothing was stolen, and they fixed it right away with one phone call to the front desk..so it was no biggie. just...check before you leave. :) Oh, another thing is..the check in line is soooo long. and i think my friend had a bit of an argument with them about our rooms..(we had requested 2 rooms to be next to each other..)  

But other than that, I enjoyed my stay here. i mean, how much time do u really spend in your hotel anyway? :P the location!

Treasure Island was sort of a disappointment during my last visit.  Granted, it was Labor Day weekend, so super busy, but.....

1.  Requested a non-smoking room, and was given a room that smelt like an ashtray.  Minus a point.  Went back to the front desk and they gave us another room that smelled fine.  Plus a point.  Was only given a 5th floor room though with a view of nothing.  Minus a point.  

2.  The bedsheets had margarita salt on it.  Did they even clean the beds?  Minus a point. 

3.  Sink and bathtub drains were clogged with something that looked like a wad of hair and toilet paper.  *GAG*  Minus a point.
