The rooms are decorated nicely and clean but lack in modern amenities.  Outlets cannot be found.  Look for a multi cell phone plug in on the landline phone set.  Otherwise there was only 1 other outlet in the room we could get to that was by the window.  Bathroom was big but the 4 gang outlet was on one wall. Pretty much made it impossible to get ready "together" in the bathroom.  Also there is no where to put your towel while you're in the shower.  NO COFFEE IN THE ROOM.  Ugh, for the price of a room over 150.00 throw in some coffee! Motel 6 and 8 do.  Please note, they do not do the pirate shows anymore.  Pool is nice and the set up great.  Rented a  cabana for 6 hrs for 80 bucks that included a TV, music (but the music in the pool area is too loud to play it) a safe and mini fridge along with seating and lounge chairs and a mister system that was a little to far away.  All in all pool was a nice set up and the casino not to huge that it made it mind misery to get around.
Great service, the room was very nice facing the pool. The only downside is that checking in is about an hour wait or you can pay $40 for express check in.

I was in Las Vegas for a conference. Decided to stay an extra couple of days to see the city. Treasure Island staff was friendly. Elevators were well guarded, as they were right off the casino. I was here without my husband (because of the conference) & felt very safe. Nice that it was connected to the Fashion Show Mall--gave a place to walk around when the weather was too cold to be outside comfortably at night. HOWEVER...the ceilings are low, so the smoking inside made the ENTIRE hotel smell musty & old. I was in a non-smoking room--which itself was fine. As soon as I'd walk out to the elevator, though, I felt like I smelled like an ash tray all. the. time. Also, since it was toward the end of the strip, I didn't see much other than the hotels immediately around it. I don't gamble so I can't comment on the casino. Overall, decent room for the price comparatively. I might splurge a bit more next time so I don't always smell like a cigarette.

Treasure Island was one of the few hotel we hadn't stayed at yet.. We arrived to Las Vegas late (all flights were delayed), there was only One person at the counter and it took over an hour to check in. The room looked nice at first but we were extremely tired. As the weekend continued; every time we went into our room there was a really foul smell! We think it was coming from the toilet or the person next door went #2. I called and let them know and they didn't seem to care. They never offered to switch room. Saturday morning, the music was so loud from the pool, we couldn't sleep. Saturday night as we went to our room to change: a guy across the hall was being back two women to his room. We giggled and thought nothing of it: until we were leaving our room and we heard them having sex. On Sunday morning, we were woken up by the people next door with a crying baby. The walls are too thin! The staff doesn't seem to care that you wanted to sleep and relax on your vacation.

Located at the end of the strip, it was quite a walk to get to places\/shows. It was great exercise though. LoL. 

The check in line was SUPER long....the lady that checked me in looked super grouchy. 

The room I stayed in was on the 30th floor and had the view of the strip. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was big. The shampoo\/conditioner could've been better. (And I guess it's the Japanese in me, but I wish they had room slippers. LoL)

For a name that sounds like a childrens' theme park, this place is very nice. They can do without the show, because their hotel is nice. Our room was very fancy and economic and was confortable. If it wasn't laid out like any other confusing Vegas hotel, It probably would have a perfect score.

This place is absolutely disgusting, from the first moment we got out of the taxi.
We wanted to see if we can check in early but no rooms were available (no big deal) but when we went to go check our bags in our 
Bellmen are aggressive and kept asking us if we need change continuously during the interaction and saying we are strictly tip salaried. After ignoring him he kept following us and asking if we needed change AGAIN. 

FAST FORWARD TO A COUPLE HOURS....

We checked in went up to the room and the room was dirty.... There was residue of fecal matter and urine around the toilet sink, the fridge had milk still and food in it from the previous occupant, room smelled like rotten mold. 

COUPLE MORE HOURS....

Do not disturb was on the door we kept having hotel staff knock and knock and knock for BS reasons! (I'm here for work.... I'm not here to party) the least you guys can do is respect paper on the door that reads "DO NOT DISTURB"  

Again disgusting hotel... NEVER AGAIN!! please don't waste your money in this DUMP!!!!!

They got a one star because we couldnt give them a zero. The customer service staff was awful, requests for basic information (where is the pool etc.) were met with blank stares, and the bellman screamed at my very sweet girlfriend, when at the end of the vacation we needed help with a bell cart because our large package of water bottles (which we needed because the water is undrinkable) broke and we warned them we had no tip money on us but needed assistance which we would have done ourselves was very rude. No microwaves anywhere to warm up our $20 dollar burger they couldnt seem to cook well done anyway. Constant snobbish uncaring juvenile attitude. Avoid at all costs. Terrible hotel.

If I could give ZERO stars or negative stars, best believe that I would.

After years of relying on Yelp to help me select restaurants, spas, auto mechanics, dry cleaners, doctors, etc. I am finally opening my own account because I need to write this review for Treasure Island.

I come to Vegas all the time...and this was the first time I stayed at Treasure Island.  Worst hotel experience of my life in Las Vegas.  DO NOT STAY HERE.  

They charged our credit card for the wrong amount and caused all sorts of problems with our bank.  The entire staff was completely over-the-top rude. I got denied from their lame ass bar called "Gilley's."  This is how it went:

Manager at Gilley's: (looking at my ID) You're not 21.
Me: No, I'm not. I'm 23.
Manager: This isn't you.
Me: Yes it is.
Manager: What's your sign?
Me: Gemini.
Manager: This isn't you.
Me: What the hell? Yes it is. I look exactly the same. Look, here's my credit card with the same name on it.  And here, look at my phone.  My background has my last name on it.  And I have my e-mail address saved on here with my name.
Manager: You're not getting in.
Me: What? We've already been to like two clubs tonight.  Look at our stamps.  I'm clearly over 21.  Why don't I go to my room and get my entire wallet to show you my student ID and all my cards?
Manager: Don't bother.  We reserve the right to refuse service to anyone and you're not getting in.


Oh it gets worse.  Then we try to go to the pool but you need a hotel key to show as proof that you're staying there.  We checked out already so we had returned the key.....I understand that the guy was just doing his job but he was SO RUDE in the way that he told us.  Finally my cousin found a key in her purse that she thought she had lost so he let us in.

But I'd say the worst thing that happened at Treasure Island was the fact that the VALET TRIED TO STEAL MY FUCKING CAR.  I got my car back after waiting half an hour for the stupid valet and the anti-theft had been activated.  The car computer had been completely disabled and someone had made several attempts to crack the code.  All my radio stations I had saved had been changed...A CD that was in the disk drive had been removed, and to top it all off the jumper cables that I keep in my trunk had been stashed under the driver's seat.  COMPLETELY SHADY. And they returned my car to me like that!!!

Complained to the manager and he said next time we come to Vegas we can get a free suite there.  I told him it wasn't worth it.  I will never stay there again.

I've never had a worse guest experience than when I stayed at Treasure Island June 22-24, 2013. In room 30-058, my boyfriend and I shared a bed for two nights and were attacked by bed bugs. 

The morning after the first night, he woke up with 22 bug bites all over his arms, chest, back, and face. We called housekeeping and told them that the room was contaminated. They offered to move us to a different room, yet we were on a tight schedule for the day and didn't want to wait over an hour to be moved to a room. Since we decided to stay, they assured us that the sheets were changed and the room was clean. The next morning, I woke up with over 10 red, swollen bites all over my arms. I called the front desk and they told me they'd immediately send someone up to investigate it, but immediately for them meant an hour. 

The "engineering team" came up to the room with snarky attitudes and not much to say. They seemed to take the situation very lightly even know I was covered in red, swollen, oozing bites all over my arms. They gave me the paperwork to file a report, but were so vague on when I would hear back and how to get into contact with them.

When I got back home to California, I went to the Emergency Room to see what had bitten me. It had gotten to the point that I was so itchy I couldn't even sleep. I spent $100 to be seen in the ER, and the doctor confirmed that I was bitten by bed bugs and I had an allergic reaction to them. She advised me to dry clean all of my belongings that I brought to Las Vegas, and even suggested that I stay home from work.

I spent over $70 dry cleaning my clothes, assuming that Treasure Island would reimburse me for the fees that I had incurred since the incident.

A week has now gone by and my boyfriend and I are still covered in bites. Just this morning I spoke with Ashley from Risk Management, who said they didn't find bug activity in the room. She said that the room is being rented right now (GROSS) and that they aren't responsible for anything that has happened to me. She didn't apologize for my inconveniences and in fact, she HUNG UP ON ME before our conversation was over. I even asked her what she would do in my situation and she hardly had an answer.

I am so disgusted and disappointed with the quality of service and treatment provided by Treasure Island. Every single staff member that I encountered was rude and unsympathetic. They are completely lying when they say you're a "valued guest" because it's obvious that they don't give a damn who you are and what your experience was. 

I will certainly never give this hotel another penny of mine and I know the same is true for everyone I tell of this incident.

Did not stay there but wanted to bring the kids to see the pirate show.   Our daughters 7 and 9.    This is not a show for kids at all.   Well at least the one side.   You couldn't see both sides at the same time.  One side has the boat that arrives with the pirates on it and the other side is all the hoe'd up girl pirAtes all dancing like they were in a strip club.    Just really inappropriate for kids which was a shame

My awesome hubby and I stayed in the tower suite, which is the best room you can be in, in the hotel. It was super awesome! I loved this hotel, I felt it was great!!!!! Right in the middle of strip, close to everything! The casino isn't confusing, it was our favorite hotel we've stayed in so far, that's of course not including cesars, bellagio, or palazzo, they are in a different category. So wonderful stay, and worth every penny.

Don't listen to any negativity it's a place anyone would love to stay.

We stayed here a couple of months ago.  The wait for check-in was 45 minutes, and when we finally go the room, IT WASN'T EVEN MADE!!!  There was trash all over the room, candy wrappers and other food waste on the blankets and all over the floors.  I called the front desk to complain and they said I had two options:  Wait 1 hour or longer for housekeeping to make the room, or walk back down to the front desk and get another room key.  I chose the 2nd option.  You'd think that after a royal screw-up like this, THEY should come to me instead of asking me to make the 5-minute trek back to the front desk.  Or at least offer a free dinner buffet, which would have made me forget the whole ordeal..  But I got nothing other than "Ooops sorry".  And once I returned to the front desk I had to wait another 10 minutes to get the new room!

What a joke. 

And it's not like they're that cheap that they can be excused for shoddy service like this.  I've stayed in $60\/night 2-star hotels and none of them ever screwed up like this. 

** ZERO STARS FOR THIS PLACE **

Stayed here with a buddy for free with 2 complimentary nights comped on his behalf. The hotel is the whole pirate theme but it's a step up from some places like Excalibur (which is still not a bad deal for a cheaper option stay). The room was spacious enough but parts of the room sorta didn't make sense like one side of our wall didn't have any outlets so you'd have to plug in any electronics on the opposite wall. The drain to the shower lagged. The room was stocked with plenty of towels though.  The casino seemed like a big enough place to play so I'd say its standard size for Vegas. The hotel is in close walking distance to the fashion show mall and the Wynn so that's a plus...room rates from what I saw were mid level for a strip hotel. There's also a Starbucks right outside the entrance. Not a bad place to consider for a stay.

You can't go wrong if you stay at TI.  The rooms are fairly cheap.  The location is great, between The Mirage and Fashion Show Mall.  Across the street from The Palazzo.  I have stayed in the Deluxe Room and Petite Suite and both are great.  The beds were comfortable but not their roll-away bed.  I had drinks at Kahunaville which were alright and cheap.  I've eaten at The Buffet and Canter's.  Both are great and fulfilling.  They also have 2 Starbucks.  The hotel is open till midnight and the one on the Strip is 24 hours.

Class class classic. Awesome hotel. . My opinion best for your buck. Every time I visit TI I am treated like a VIP. The drinks in the casino could be a bit stronger, but hey....I ain't complaining....they're free (plus a tip to the nice person serving them). The place is clean, and every one always seems like they're having fun. The night life in the casino is always festive, and the rooms are amazing. Clean, good size, and great views. TI is home away from home for me. I always look forward to coming to Vegas when I am staying at treasure island.

First of all  we cant be happier with the great service we got from a very nice lady name Jessica ,who upgrade our room to a suite ... it was my husband's birthday so she truly made our trip worth it. The view was great and the room was perfect. I was very skeptical due to all the negative feedback ppl have been giving this hotel . Regardless I still booked and  I am absolutely happy with both service and quality of hotel .

Our room was affordable, comfortable and clean, and you can't beat the location: it's next door to the Mirage, across the street from the Venetian\/Palazzo, kitty-corners the Wynn\/Encore, and within walking distance of Caesar's and Harrah's. If you're going during an off-peak time, check online for coupons: we got a free buffet for every day we were there. We'd definitely consider staying here again!

I have stayed at TI previously under MGM ownership and had no problems with service. Under the current ownership the service is terrible and the I will not be staying here again. The front desk personnel at checkin and checkout were rude and not very helpful, I had to talk to several people just to get the rooms our reservations were supposed to reserve for us. TI customer service makes customers feel like they are doing us a favor by letting us stay at TI. When MGM owned TI, I never had a problem with resevations, checking in, or checking out, but thats all that happened out entire time a TI on this trip. Definitely not coming back to TI again, too many other places to stay! One star is one star too many.

Never stayed here, but always play here. It is always hit or miss on the tables for me here, but keep coming back because all the dealers are super nice. They make it more than just a 9 to 5 job and actually talk to you or make the game more fun. Will definitely come back the next time I am in Vegas.

Here for a Respiratory Convention and got a hotel not to spend my whole day in. More for a place to sleep. Rooms are nice beds comfy but the seepage of smoke which in fact is a non smoking area is pretty strong. Who am I too complain when of course this is Vegas!!  Another minus was the resort fees WTH!!! Thinking I scored with the reasonable fees heck no!!!  Treasure Island is more like Pirate Island. They take your money.

Still a nice place to stay and play.  It's pretty much in the middle of the action.  The only issue is it is no longer part of the MGM Family... so comps are harder to come by.  They were the official Los Angeles Lakers Casino so I've dropped by a few times to check it out.  Steve Wynn did it right by building this oldie but still goodie!

This is billed as a 4-star hotel, but my experience here (in Spring of 2008) was more like 2 - and that 2nd star is pretty much for the bed. 

First off: I long for the Treasure Island of my youth. With a good old-fashioned pirate show - that means shit blowing up, and non-6 packed Pirates saying ARRR and being menacing, not the Showgirls-esque, Fabio sirens and pirates of today with the big dance number and cheesy ass romance plot-line. But, I digress. 

T.I., as it is now known, is definitely not a place I would ever stay again. For roughly $180 a night, I was expecting a lot more than we got. True, the rooms were nice. Bed was comfy, etc. But the first night there (after a horrific drunken Flair Bartender contest at Kahunaville), we were awoken at 9am Expedia Commercial style by jackhammering. Yes, a JACKHAMMER. At 9am, with raging hangovers. How is this possible, you ask? Well, when I called down to the front desk, I learned they were doing CONSTRUCTION ON THE FLOOR BELOW US. 

Here is the conversation I had with the front desk: 

me: Hi...um. We were woken up by a loud noise that sounds like a jackhammer, and it's still going on. 

desk: Oh...yeah. It looks like we're doing construction on the floor below you. Do you want to move?

me: .... (thinking: do I WANT? to? move?) Well YES. We would like to move, since it's so loud.

desk: Okay. Well. Hmm. We could send someone up to get your things, but we're busy and I have no idea how long it would take. Can you just come down with your luggage and we'll get you another room?

me: ... Yeah, whatever. 

So after that, we went down to the front desk to even more horrible customer service (also while packing up my stuff, I noticed that the last person's dirty socks were under the bed). No sorry! None! NO SORRY, whatsoever. Just an annoyed sigh, and head nod, some bitchiness, and a new room key. I was so pissed I was afraid of what I might say, so I gave myself some time to cool down. In the meantime, my mom decided to ask for a manager, who said "Whoops! Sorry about that. Yeah...that's a problem". That is it. That's all he said! 

Now look, I was not expecting a huge discount or even drink comps, but how about a little compassion and some admittance that perhaps you screwed up by booking people into rooms above a floor with jackhammers??? 

Add in the worst buffet food I've ever had (at $18 a pop) AND the fact that the pool closes at 6:30 on a Saturday night, and I'm out, T.I. Keep your damn scantily clad sirens away from me... 

(as a side note, this dude at the pool early Sunday morn told us he LOVED T.I. but he was staying in a suite and obv. had some major cashola. I suspect they only treat their big spenders well here).

3 stars. But if you were to grade Treasure Island\/TI on a curve with other Vegas hotels, particularly its neighbors, this place is a 1.5 stars at best. If I were to personify Vegas hotels, TI would be that guy in his thirties that still attends college parties. On one hand, you got to almost respect that he is still going at it after all these years and at times his age is almost more of a novelty than inappropriate. But, on the other hand, eventually you resent him for not realizing this crowd doesn't take him seriously. Because the party has changed over the years but one thing remains constant, Pirate themed hotels just aren't chic. And no amount of re-branding is going to change that. And although you do have really comfortable beds , clean rooms, and a central-as-it-gets location, you just aren't up to par. Your pool is pitiful, tiny, and has an undeniable Daytona Spring Break vibe to it. Your restaurants are a joke. Your staff has an attitude, almost as if they keep applying for positions at all the great hotels popping up next door but no one will take them seriously because they are treasure island employees. 15 minutes on hold for the front desk? Drink coupons that none of your bars would redeem for different reasons? Half finished drink left unattended quickly thrown out by grounds crew who ignored the several empty cups in the same spot? A surprise 'facility use' charge sprung upon us at check-in?
And to top it all off, you booked Carlos Mencia to perform in your theatre. throw in the towel Treasure Island. Or better yet, walk the plank and let that great piece of real estate youve been letting go to waste become the next phase of one of Steve Wynn's projects.

Stayed here for the first time this past weekend and wasnt sure what to expect with the mixed reviews. We stayed Thursday-Sunday in a tower suite.  Check in went quick.  Finding our elevator was easy. Be prepared to show your room key EVERYTIME you go to the room elevators. Inconvenient yet it made me feel better knowing random people weren't hanging in the hallways.  The room was nice. Double doors, very spacious, 2 restrooms. 1 with a walk in closet and dresser. Vanity with ottoman and magnifying mirror double sink,  toilet and jacuzzi tub.  The second restroom had a huge shower, toilet, sink with tons of counter space and closet with safe.  This restroom had VERY dim lighting.
 The king size bed with extra pillows was super comfy,  as was the HUGE "L" shaped couch.  Good size glass top table,  coffee table,  TV, entertainment center with mini fridge and desk furnished the suite. The view is spectacular however the windows were filthy. Kinda took away from it. I was pretty surprised just how much this hotel had to do. From 1,000's of slots and tables,  restaurants,  show,  pool,  cvs,  starbucks,  it was easy to not have to venture out. I did run into a few issues this trip.
 Housekeeping took 2 phone calls and over 2 hours to bring up an extra blanket. Apparently the first time I called the person answering "didn't let anyone know". No apology no owning their mistake,  instead 2 hours later I had someone literally kicking my door yelling housekeeping.  When I opened the door I was basically thrown my blanket and the person turned around and walked away before I could even get a word out. Also head an issue with getting the Jets to work in the tub. Called front desk and asked for any tips. Was told I'd have to wait for maintenance could take an hour. Not really what I wanted to do. Asked for a better ETA and was given major attitude and told I just needed to wait. When maintenance showed up he was rude and seemed very bothered that he had to do HIS JOB!!! Resort fee is lame especially since the items included you don't actually get.  Had to have front desk print my boarding pass since the computers that are meant for that use are not updated and would not work.
Not sure if I would stay here again. Great location, best variety in gaming and restaurants,  however the staff was very rude and not helpful.

This place is ok. Stayed here for 3 nights when visiting vegas for the first time with a friend. Our room was great, nice bathroom, good sized room, very clean and comfortable. Didn't spend much time elsewhere in the hotel as everywhere else on the strip is so much better. 

If you want to spend a day relaxing by the pool, this is not the place to do it. Very cramped, lots of people and loud music. As with most places in Vegas, the drinks are VERY expensive and not that great. 

The man working at the bell desk was very forceful in asking for a tip. As someone who isn't from a country with a tipping culture, it's hard to know when is right to tip and how much to tip. I handed him my 3 bags and he said, in a kind of rude and patronising tone, 'tips are appreciated'. So I asked him how much is normal to tip someone who has done nothing more except tie a tag to my bags, and he didn't want to tell me. Eventually I got him to suggest a $1 a bag, so that's what I did. I just think, at a hotel, people should be prepared to teach people from different cultures the local customs in a polite way.

 There was nothing really wrong with my stay here, I would just probably choose to go to one of the other famous hotels on the strip instead next time.

I have stayed at many hotels on the strip, wanted to try a new one, out of curiosity, for our 25th anniversary.  I will NEVER do that again! 

Here are the Pro's: large room, very nicely decorated, great view, excellent security at the elevators, CVS on site.

Cons:  the check in staff was rude and difficult!  Willing to take my money but not helpful and completely unrealistic!

No heat in the room.  It was 45 degrees outside and when I complained, they did respond quickly BUT to show they'd been there and fixed the problem, they turned the heat up so high we walked into a sauna.

Toilet running and was fixed by my husband twice.  They had to come fix that too!

No blankets in the room and when we called down for them they brought an extremely thin, old, rough blanket that was like sleeping under sandpaper.  Remember, we had no heat!

Maid service was extremely lax...they never even wiped the bathroom counters as evidenced by the water marks from our water glasses.

No coffee pot.

All restaurants were extremely expensive.  

For $200\/per night I expected better...and don't forget all hotels in Vegas have a "resort fee" that's on top of the nightly rate.

First and last time we will stay at the TI Hotel!

Great location, and a fair price.

This stay was more ballin' than my last because we got upgraded to the 34th floor (out of 36 floors).  I went to check-in, and the lady laughed at how my friend requested that we get an upgrade on the reservation.  She noted that he sounded super polite, and had correct grammar.  I said we were teachers-it's natural!  She said she'll give us the only room available on the top floors.  Sweeeeeeet!  She was super fun to talk to :D

One con-they don't have toothbrushes (two people forgot theirs), and they said anytime they have to bring something up (we asked for a wine opener) it would cost $5.  'Er...?  Even the cheap motels have both for free.

No good clubs here, but the gambling's decent.  I couldn't find WAR, however!!

Oh, and even though we all had full bars, none of us could get data on our phones.  Boooo
Ok so yea TI is no Wynn or encore but if your looking for a decent clean room with a excellent location? Then TI is the place for you! Definitely one of the best times I've had in Vegas!

This is for ADMIRAL: he works at the desk and takes care of your show\/room reservations. He works from 2PM-930PM! Awesome man, and he will definitely take care of YOUR INTERESTS.

He is so kind and he really does look out for you, even when I called several times (which I'm sure is annoying to most reps). He answered all of my questions with so much patience and went far and beyond in customer service. Actually, probably the best customer service I've ever had. If you need help or suggestions or even just want to talk to a nice representative to make a simple transaction, ADMIRAL is awesome!!! (Not sure how the other reps are, but hopefully they're all as nice as Admiral!) I hope TI gives out bonuses or some kind of reward or recognition for reps that make a difference to their customers!

He helped me get Mystere tickets and a hotel room after a reservation through Groupon failed... I really appreciated his help so much that I'm writing a review for him! Also, I realized that I talked to him about a week ago as well as today, when I needed to ask some general questions about Mystere. He was really helpful and nice at that time too.

I love nice people :)

Great location. Good price. 

Check-in was a breeze as we came on a Thursday afternoon before the weekend rush. Our front desk agent was very friendly and great in suggesting restaurant options. Also she was nice enough to give a us a room with a strip view! *high five!* Within five minutes we were on our way.

Treasure Island (TI) is a great location depending on the activities you want to do. Luckily for us majority of the things we did happened to be on our side of the strip. It's within walking distance to the Venetian Shops and Walgreen's and if you go out of the hotel and make a left you hit some shops and restaurants.

Their pool is a nice size and plenty of chairs to lay on and you can even order a fruity drink like the Miami Vice (Pina Colada and Strawberry Daiquiri mix) from one of the serving girls while sunbathing! Hungry? Kahunaville has an outdoor patio where you can chill and order some grub.

Our room is average, nothing too rave about, and every time we leave and place our "room need to be clean" card in our key card holder it's always clean and towels restock upon our return. It's very welcoming to come back to a clean room after a tiring day in the sun.

We didn't have any issues or complaints. Would stay here again to save money esp. since we're not in our room often, but to sleep, shower, or get ready.

I am writing to address a customer service experience that I encountered with a telephone representative. I called reservations tonight 12\/8\/16 at 10:45pm hoping to make a reservation for next weekend. I explained that I had a few questions since I was reviewing rates online directly through your website, and I encountered 3 different rates due to current promotions being offered. I was hoping to get a little bit of explanation as to the different rates and what they offer, but instead Anna responded to me with "It says it on there." I understand that it lists amenities and such for promotions on your website, but I still wanted a little bit more clarification on whether there was a difference between terms in the offers. I then attempted to ask another question regarding a detail I read in the fine print, but instead of letting me explain myself, the representative just cut me off in a rude manner, I attempted to clarify my question again, and again she was rude and didn't care to let me explain my question. I was so frustrated, and insulted that I didn't feel comfortable making a reservation with her anymore. I have booked reservations several times with your phone representatives, and each time the service was excellent. Which is why I was so disappointed in the service I received tonight. I just wanted to advise you, because i wouldn't want anyone else to feel the way she made me feel. Thank you for taking the time to read my feedback.

If you have rewards from the players club be sure to book the room with the rewards people because they will not honor those rewards after the fact. And that made me upset but this is what really got me. The front desk says the rewards desk will help and the rewards guy says they will evaluate it when our weekend is done based on how much we play but we should go to the front desk and talk to the manager there. So, we go back to the front desk and the girl at the counter is now reading, with her eyes moving from left to right and lips moving, what seems to be pages of notes that the rewards guy wrote on us from our conversation with him. why would he tell us to talk to the manager at the counter if he was going to write a book in the computer about why we do not deserve the deal that was mailed to us?  And why do I have to be evaluated on our play time at the end of the trip when I was mailed deals based on previous play?  So, we normally do play at the hotel we are staying and very little do we venture out but this time we did not gamble here and only stayed here to sleep.  Bad customer service. Oh, did I mention it was my birthday...

After staying at the Excalibur the last time, I was really looking forward to a better hotel. I found a great deal for this place, and so I went here with a friend for Spring Break. 

The rooms are very nice and a decent size. It's also at a nice location on the strip. My only complaint about the place were the lines to check in and out. They don't advertise their TV checkout option enough, because most people didn't know about it, and it would have saved us a lot of time and hassle to do that. 

I would say that overall I prefer MGM Grand to this hotel, but it was a nice place to stay, and the customer service was a lot better than in other places.

Went on a business trip and I enjoyed it, no complaints. The show was fun. The room was clean and room service was great. I would stay there again. It was quite a few years ago so not sure if it's changed since then.

Employees steal your electronics,, cell phones etc.  they have cameras but only for their best interests, not yours.  Spend your money elsewhere.    ,,,,,,,,,,,, STAY AWAY FROM HERE !!!
Okay so now we are leaving and the valet was hot rodding my suv so the ice chest tipped over and the inside is now saturated with water.  Their response ,, it should have been secured.  Asked for the supervisor and he said he was.   Again STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE and all MGM hotels.

Treasure Island may not be the fanciest of the strip but it holds its own and is well above other "middle-upper class" hotels like the Luxor, Excalibur or NY NY.
Its always very well kept, good stores, great location and you can't beat the free show at night!
It might not be upto par with other Vegas shows but its free and it involves scantily clad women fighting, whats not to like about that?
Worth a stop on the strip for sure.

I have to say I was very surprised. When my Darling told me we were going to be staying here with friends, I thought "really? TI?". I was very mistaken. My impression of TI was that it was a run-down and possibly dirty hotel but after going through a nice renovation, it was very clean and well-appointed for the price point. This is not the Bellagio but it is definitely worthy of note. It is within walking distance of the center of the strip (which I define as the Bellagio and its environs haha). This hotel is incredible value...it is a mid-range hotel but deserves to be at a higher price point for what it offers. I even liked the toiletries which is unusual for me (unless they are Aveda or L'Occitane). Overall, quite impressive.

Review is for casino only, since I have never stayed in one of the rooms.

(+) In a great location on the strip, you are connected(via tram) to the Mirage and within walking distance to Venetian, Palazzo, Wynn, Encore, Harrahs, and Caesars. Also Fashion Show Mall just north of the property. Prime location, actually!
(+) Slots have always at least given me some play and every now and again some money! One of the better places to play on the Strip, if you ask me.
(+) casino is not too big and rather easy to navigate
(+) Home of the first ever Cirque show on the Strip, Mystere. Great show. See separate review. https:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/cirque-du-soleil-myst%C3%A8re-las-vegas-2
(+) Plenty of food and store options to choose from. Personally, I think I enjoyed Gilley's the most.
(+) CVS on site near the sportsbook actually has some great prices for toiletries and whatnot that are very good considering your location.

(-) I am not a fan of the some of the changes of recent years, namely losing the Pirate show, losing the skull and crossbones sign, and building that brown monstrosity of a building in the front of the bay. To me, it looks very out of place. I miss the old Treasure Island in a lot of ways.
(-) Pool area is rather small considering the size and location of the property its self.
(-) Some of the food outlets are not very good at all. Namely Senor Frogs and Kahunaville (which apparently just closed permanently!)

For the location, I believe TI offers a lot of value in a lot of ways. That being said, I do miss the old TI I remember from the 90's and early 2000's. I still swing by here a lot and bring friends and family by when they visit. It is still A-OK.

3 stars.

I totally fine experience at Treasure Island.  In my head I thought it would be really kiddie like Circus Circus but it wasn't like that at all.

Granted its not as new in terms of amenities as Wynn and Encore across the street but obviously you're paying less here. 

Came here for a friend's bday and we got two rooms next to each other.  The beds were comfy and bathroom was fine. 

What was surprising in the pool area! Again I thought it would be a bunch of kids and\/or old people but it wasn't!  There was DJ there and people had their drinks in the pool!  That's so awesome. 

Late at night when I was stumbling back to my room the Vietnamese place was still open so I ordered some BOMB vermicelli!! 

Its a nice central location on the strip too.

One stars because the view was nice and the ceilings were high...Now my blood is boiling just thinking about this trip and this was over two weeks ago!! so my friends and I went on an all girls trip to lv checked in on 05\/05\/17 treasure island was decently priced our first time staying here. long story short at 3pm in the afternoon we had our music playing in the room well we were getting ready apparently it was too loud so the manager and this "security" man on steroids came up to our room like they were doing a raid and they were the local police! the manger was decent but the attitude on this 'security" was absolutely unprofessional and by far the rudest I have ever been treated. I answered the door and came out to the hall so we can talk and he pushed the door open refusing to let it shut behind me ummm why exactly? excuse me I have women in there getting dressed why can we not shut the door?? I mean you came up here for music why all the aggression??? he scared me and what's the deal with the music anyway its 3pm in Las Vegas I can understand if it was 9 or 10 pm but 3pm? is it really a crime and if so great we wont be staying here anymore but why this security felt he needed to have such attitude and aggression towards woman is beyond me..Do Not Stay Here!!!!

Fridge don't work...
No toilet paper in the room!!

MUCH better the second time here! Granted, we had a large suite with a whirlpool tub and two bathrooms. The weird smell was gone, though the walkway from the parking garage to the hotel was perpetually stuffy. Much less people than other hotels, which was nice. Okay treasure island, you won me over. Still don't have much food places and I need to get out of the hotel for everything, and your upkeep is still only mediocre, but I will come here again for the room rate specials and to escape the crowds everywhere else.

Treasure Island hotel was a lot of fun. But watch out for the hidden fees. They charge $25.00 a night for a resort fee in which I knew about from reading the fine print. But what they don't tell you about until you get there is the deposit you have to leave for a petite suite. They charge 100.00 a night more for a deposit for a petite suite then a regular room . Which I think is a crock and the resort fee is a rip off too. I got a great deal on Expedia but after all the hidden fees I could have stayed at a better hotel then this. Also the casino  slot machines were not paying out to much at all. I went down to the Bellagio and made way more. There were maybe a 100 people in the casino and you never heard any machines going off as winners. Lame casino, now the food no way would I eat there again. The food was over priced and was the worst food I ever ate. Try the Venetian right across the street it was great. Overall the bed was soft and the room was clean and the staff was friendly. So if your looking for a good night sleep and don't mind the extra cost in fees then this is the place. The only great part was the location it was on the strip and close to everything.

I booked the Treasure Island through Southwest Airlines for a wedding I had to come to.  The rooms are dirty, they never vacuum the carpets.  They don't bother to tell you after you purchase food at the  gift shop you can't take any outside food to the pool because they want you to spend money with them.  My key had to be recharged each and every time.  The folks that work here are the most unpleasant people I have every come across.  They should be happy they have jobs and stop being so unplesant to folks.  There is also the $25.00 resort fee.   It's a joke, never stay here!

I went to Vegas over the Lunar New Year weekend (which also happened to be Super Bowl Weekend.. and the weekend of the fight @ mandalay).. I don't come to Vegas often. The last time I came to Vegas, I stayed in the Palazzo. Needless to say, I was a little skeptical about staying here, but the price was the best on Priceline.. and I thought the hotel was the best location, since I didn't want to stay on the other side of the strip. 

The lobby of the hotel was nothing amazing. It was actually a lot smaller than I thought it would be. The staff was nice, but the guy who checked us in seemed a little awkward. Maybe he was aiming to appear more "proper", but... it didn't really work out that way.

I have no big complaints about our room. The AC\/heater was a little outdated though. The temperature was never right - it was either too hot or too cold. The TV was also surprisingly small. However, the beds were big and comfortable and no complaints about the restroom. 

Overall, this hotel isn't bad. It's not amazing either. I'd definitely stay here again, but I'd much prefer to stay at the Palazzo (obviously).

Oh! and the $22 resort fee per night was a rip off. The end.

I stayed here over the Labor Day weekend, and the stay was better than expected. When we first arrived we were going to valet because it's not an extra charge, just tip, but the valet was full and we just parked in the structure.  During the summer the structure can feel hotter than it is outside, so just be warned.

The rooms were clean, the room I was in had a view of the pool area, which I didn't visit because the friends I went with didn't want to go and I didn't want to go there by myself.  The rooms were a little dated, but there was a flat screen in the room to make it more modern.  I thought the beds were comfortable.  My only complaint is the lack of available electrical outlets.  There was one at the desk and maybe two more in the bathroom.  You stay with four people in the room, four cell phones (you know everyone probably has a smartphone), three plugs you do the math.

There is a monorail the takes you to the Mirage, but it's not 24 hours, it closes at 1 or 2am depending on the day.  This was not a bad stay.  For Vegas, as long as the hotel is clean, I'll be happy.

Hey, I was just happy to be on vacation.... but... we got there and the line to check in was SO LONG. It literally took us OVER an hour! They came by with water, so that was cool I guess. At least they were thoughtful. Anyhow, we get to the front and are informed that there's a $20 per day resort fee for the pool and the use of their internet... there's no way around this, we get charged an additional $80 for crap we don't need. 

The room itself was pretty decent. Modern, and we had a great view of the strip. I loved just standing in the window and looking at everything that was going on out there. I could see the Volcano at Mirage, the gondolas at the Venetian and even the tip of the watershop at Bellagio... kinda neat! 

The bed was amazingly comfy. I drunkenly passed out in it several times.

We ate at Pho... it was good, but it was no different from pho at home that is 5 bucks a bowl and somehow in Vegas we spent like 50. I don't remember what happened with that, because again... I was drunk :)

Kahunaville's food kind of sucked I think...but then it was breakfast and I was hungover, so maybe it was me.

We ended up going to the pool (hey, we paid $80 so we figured we should use it)... it was rediculously packed. It is only waist high and you are packed in like sardines. Grossness. We did get some kind of ultra sugary drink with a test tube of liquor and a gummy worm in it - WIN!!

The hotel has a tram that takes you to the Mirage which was nice. The buffet at the Mirage was awesome. 

I don't think a coctail waitress ever came over to me while gambeling and so I never got any free drinks... and that's lame. 

I wouldn't NOT stay here again, but I was kind of pissed about the resort fee that NO ONE tells you about while you're booking your room. Then again, my boyfriend paid for the room so I shouldn't complain at all. 

Maid service was good and always restocked our room for us. 

Bell staff was awesome and they even held our bags on check out day so that we could walk the strip for a few hours before heading to the airport for our 9pm flight.

Not impressed.  This review is for a trip back in June of this year.  We had a Groupon deal for 2 days and 2 nights, 2 tickets to Cirque de Solei, pool cabana reservations for a day, and a bottle of champagne with chocolate covered strawberries.  We were charged extra for the show, and by extra I mean full ticket price for two seats.  This was resolved, fairly quickly, but unfortunately wasn't the last financial problem.  We were charged for strawberries and champagne, and to top it off we were charged for the room.  I noticed all this once we were back home and received my credit card statement.  They had no idea how to deal with Groupon deals apparently.  I pity anyone else who bought this deal.  Wouldn't stay there again, especially since the suites are outdated by 20 years at least.

Pros: Reasonable pricing, but still somewhat upscale feel; good location
Cons: Hotel layout, especially for checking in; "somewhat upscale" in Las Vegas translates into lagging a bit behind the pack

Stayed here when we went to the Gamestop Expo (awesome!). We only stayed two nights and pretty much didn't venture outside the hotel or the convention center, so my review may be a little lopsided, but here it goes...

The first thing we noticed was the awkward layout which made check-in cumbersome. The TI's only parking is in a parking structure in the back of the hotel. The front of the hotel is mainly for valet parking services, taxis, etc. So to check in you have to drive into the parking structure, take all your bags with you (unless you want to make a separate trip back for them after check-in), drag them all around the hotel until you get to the front lobby, and then drag them back to the center of the hotel to the elevator, then to your room. Since you start off in the parking structure, there aren't any luggage carts around. I suppose you could walk bagless to the check-in desk and then ask for help, but we just wanted to get to our room.

Otherwise the stay was nice. Our room safe wasn't working, but a call to the front desk and about an hour and half later they had the technician in our room. Everything else worked like it was supposed to and the beds didn't leave me with a sore back. Room was nicely decorated and clean. It looked upscale compared to my usual middle-of-the-road Comfort Inn.

Unfortunately, Vegas is also pretty lavish and posh, so what is a little upscale compared to all other hotels is on the trailing edge when compared to all Vegas Strip accommodations. The TI was still a good value, though, considering its location next to the shopping mall and across the street from the Venetian; CVS downstairs is really convenient. Since I am out and about during the day and only use the hotel room to sleep in, I would definitely consider the TI on a future trip.

We arrived in Vegas at about 8 am and decided to try and check in.  The Bell Hop informed us that we wouldn't be able to check in until about 12 pm, but they'd hold our bags and after we check in, we can call down and they'll deliver our bags.  So we decided to have breakfast in their 24 hour coffee shop and gamble until then.

We were able to check in at 11 am and my BF asked if there were any room upgrades available.  The lady who was helping us was very nice and friendly, she said she'd see what she could get us and then delivered us a corner room with "panoramic" windows.

We had a pretty high room (25th floor) and a view of the strip - Palazzo right in front of us and Fashion Show Mall to the left.  It was a nice comfy room with a comfortable bed.  The bathroom is roomy with good counter space and lots of towels for the 2 of us!  The only bad thing I can think of, is that there wasn't any toilet paper in the bathroom when we arrived!  There was a roll, but it was empty.  Good thing I noticed way before I had to go!

We could see and hear the show from our room, but it's hard to understand what's going on if you haven't watched it before - which we haven't.  And when I say "hear", it's all muffled noise!  Haha...if you're a light sleeper, the noise and fireworks may wake you.

We didn't go down to the pool, but the slot machines were pretty good - lots to choose from and lots of table games also.  There are a handful of restaurants to choose from, and some fast food options - something for everyone.

I did read someones review before we left that the casino area had a distinct smell.  Which it did - almost like a strawberry incense smell - very strong and noticeable - unlike other casinos.  Every time we walked in from the outside or came down from our room, I noticed it.  Not irritating, but just very noticeable.

This was a good hotel to stay in - close to other hotels and good to walk the strip on cooler days, which we did on our first day (June 24th - a few days before the 117 degree weather hit!).

TI is still my second favorite hotel in LV.  Right behind The Venetian.  The service is great and you can still get wonderfully decorated and clean rooms for a good price.  The other stuff like shows, etc do not really do anything for me as the other reviewers.  I go for service, price and value.  And TI has all three!

Stayed here labor day weekend, it was dope. Pool parties everyday and you could see the whole strip lit up at night from the hotel room. Theres free parking too although everything thats worth going to in Vegas is within a 5 minute walk from the hotel.

I've stayed at TI on several occasions. In fact, I go to Vegas for my birthday each year, and we always stay at Treasure Island. I honestly don't have one negative thing to say about it. So I will mention what I loved in detail:

1.) The rates are insanely affordable (depending on the dates) for a four-star place on the Vegas strip. This is not the Tropicana or Circus Circus. But you get a clean, beautiful, and modern room for nearly the same price.

2.) The rooms are always clean. Everything always works. The housekeeping is excellent. You can tell that the hotel was remodeled recently because the tile and decor in the bathrooms are gorgeous. I stayed in the petite suite one weekend and the spacious tub there is amazing. Don't get me started on the beds! SO comfortable. 

3.) I LOVE the Coffee Shop. That's one of the cafe-type eateries located on the first floor of the hotel. The breakfast menu is the best part of the restaurant. I usually have the smoked salmon plate and they give you enough food for three people. Make sure to share the entrees.

4.) The entertainment at the pool is fun. For instance, you can usually find the DJ either playing the latest music, or having people play games.

5.) The check in and check out is effortless. Even if you run into a long line, the concierge make sure to have enough people working so the line passes by fast.

In conclusion, TI rocks and those who were unhappy with their stay are insane nit pickers.
The seafood buffet at TI. Extraordinary for the consistency of the mediocrity of the numerous selections (including the coffee and dessert). Major disappointment.

It was the night of Sept 22nd, 2016. We parked (free and easy) carried our Styrofoam cooler into the lobby and checked in to our "suite." After calling Treasure Island a week or two before I did manage to bargain a suite and 2 free buffets. I think they bundled it all. ANYWAY..

My Styrofoam cooler broke in the middle of the lobby. Ice,water, beer went everywhere. I was laughing so hard. 

The room was big. 2 bathrooms. No view really but who cares. Location is fair I would say. Probably give it a B. Buffet was average, just like other buffets I've been to, MGM, flamingo, Excalibur. 

They do give you a lot of nice offers. So I give it 4 stars. Wish I would of gotten the strip view though. 

Damn Styrofoam cooler....

You know what I love about the TI.........and you can call me CRAZY, the parking garage is the SPOT!!!  
GREAT VIEW!  No wait, it's a SICK VIEW!  
And besides that, the TI is central to so many things.  When you're struggling to find a spot at the Fashion Show or the Venetian, you should have parked at the TI.
Take my word for it next time and give it a try, you'll understand what I'm saying!  :)

It is a good option when staying on the Strip.

While it lacks the 5 star quality of the nearby Venetian and Bellagio, TI does offer cheap room rates, comfy beds, big rooms and a great casino floor.

I had a view of the volcano, and it was cool at first, but then every 20 minutes having an explosion outside my window became annoying. Luckily they have great black out blinds. I enjoy these since most of my Vegas mornings need to be in pitch black, since my head, eyes and stomach hurt from the night before.

I checked into room 25068, and the room was hot, I turned the ac on high and the air was very limited, I then try to go to sleep and there was this vibrating noise through the wall because of the ac only heard when you're laying in the bed. I tried to go to sleep but it was too hot and adding that vibrating sound, it was driving me crazy so I called the front desk and moved to room 25070. The ac there was much better and but it still vibrating through the walls, not as much as the first room, at least I wasn't go crazy as the first room. But now my only complaint is that the room was not sound proof. I could hear people slamming doors, laughing and walking outside my room. I can hear the police sirens as they past by the building. It was difficult to relax and fall asleep, I eventually did. And the tv guide takes forever to load.

Haven't even officially checked in yet and already got shitty customer service, thrice. Maybe Treasure Island should pay their employees more and they wouldn't be so rude and unhappy about their jobs? No one's willing to help, and when someone does they look pissed about it. Check in has been a mess. Everyone we've come across is so unorganized. We paid the extra fee for express early check in and were sent to the regular line and told there is no line for express check in, then why would we pay the extra $40 fee?! Big sigh. I usually have a pretty high tolerance for bad service but this has been ridic. Anyways, done ranting now, walking up to our room. Oh, but holla at the cutie working at the guest services\/business center.
I love this hotel. its clean, across the street from venetian. all the young people stay here. when you walk into hotel, it normally does not smell of smoke like other hotels.

From the moment we got out of the car which was first thing in the morning 7am I had a porter ask whether I needed help with my bags - I said "no thanks" he mutters under his breathe "you can't check in" whilst walking in the opposite direction.  My first encounter with the "American" lovely! 
I head to the front desk to check in - which we had planned with the travel agent to pay for the extra night so we could in fact check in early as we had a long flight. (Sydney to Hawaii then obviously Hawaii to Las Vegas). Then to be told "check in isn't until 11am" when I tried to explain to her we get to check in early she wouldn't have a bar of it and told me that in fact they are fully booked and there's no way to check in. Once again I tried to explain to her the situation, she wouldn't have it. I was about to explode but decided against it as my children were there and my husband pulled me away as he knew what was brewing and the potential damage that could've been done. We walked away and decided to go have breakfast. We went back at 11 to be told it could be as late as 1pm! I nearly lost it when a lady checked my name in the computer and saw that we had been able to check in early. She also went on to say that we were supposed to call 48hrs prior to confirm our booking. Sorry, what!?! I've paid for a week stay and I have to call to confirm!? I thought it was the opposite- you call to cancel. I've never heard of that before. She went on to tell us that they had cancelled our booking. GREAT! Thankfully they hadn't booked out our room. She went on to give us a free buffet meal as an apology. 
As for the hotel Save your lungs! Before you even walk through the doors you get a massive cloud of smoke! Disgusting. It's old, dated and drab! The buffet breakfast is gross, the pool is overcrowded with very limited seating. The only good thing about this place was the gym. Such a crap way to start our 6 week adventure to the USA. 

Do yourself a favour - steer clear of this place!

If I could've given this place no stars I would've

Really nice sized rooms, looks like recently updated.  Mini fridge is always nice touch and is located in closet.  The closet has light switch that illuminates when doors open!  We were told not single kings, and opted for double queens.  We requested higher level and got 32nd floor with awesome view of the south strip and mountains to the west.  The rooms are fairly quite and the blackout curtains cut out almost everything.  
The staff is a little pushy with housekeeping, they wait outside and jump at door when you leave.  I guess this is better than any other service here.  The staff is very friendly, and yeah you're stuck a high resort fee.  But the location is great, short deuce (bus) rides to almost everything.  Twenty minutes to freemont st and new york new york, if you drive you can go off strip and get here very easily (AVOID STRIP at all costs).
I'd come back here.

Do yourself a favor and eat only breakfast at buffet.  Their are better eats all around you than their restraunts and bars

I'd definitely stay here again! The view of the 3rd floor roof was kind of lame for the price that was paid, but the bed was comfy. What I liked best was the bathroom (of course!). Nice and big and the shower was too hard water-y. 

Oh yea, the cool pirate show that is live with real actors is pretty awesome. Just don't get disappointed if they have to cancel it due to high winds or unpleasant weather conditions. 

Overall, it's not my favorite hotel but there's a Walgreens across the street that is open 24 hours so its really convenient to purchase your snacks and h2o.

Stayed at the hotel, it was def cheap but the rooms were smaller than some of the other hotels I've been too. Nice thing is they had a pool so it was good to just to tanning somewhere so close. They also had a pho restaurant and a cafe so i didn't have to travel very far for food. They also had the cirque de soleil mystique show there so I didn't even have to travel very far for entertainment. They gave $10 in free slot play which is always nice. Overall it was a good experience, the only thing is it was a little far from the strip but I could manage for a good price.

Very friendly staff at every turn. Beds are comfy and bathroom is nice. Room was clean and ready when we arrived. AC was a little warm, one call to front desk and filter changed in no time. We reserved and received a room with a strip view, all I can say is wow. 26th floor. Received bogo for the cirque show and was able to buy two get two even with on room. Great customer service.

We booked this hotel directly from the website thinking we would get better rates straight from the hotel, boy was I mistaken!!! We arrived at hotel from Utah early morning, front desk told us there was a $40 charge for early check in as I was standing there trying to check in not happy with the fee other people came up wanting to check in and they were told the same thing (fee of $40 for early check in). We did not get the room we reserved on line. People at front desk were not helpful and were very condescending. They gave us the room keys and did not tell us where to go. That night we wanted to get a good nights rest and tried ordering room service, after placing our order(just three sandwiches) they told us it would be 1hr before we got our food and that we had to have cash, then why do we leave the open credit card at the desk if not to charge it to the room. We ended up canceling the order and going out of the hotel for food. I have been to Vegas and stayed at other hotels on the strip and I have never stayed in a hotel with such bad customer service. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Such bad, bad service.

Las Vegas's premier ship themed hotel! I have to say we were not expecting much here seeing that it is one of the cheaper hotels on the strip.  The rooms had very comfortable beds and were very quiet.  We are a very loud and rowdy group.  One group of my friends was next door and I could barely hear them when they were going absolutely ballistic at 4am.  That is some accomplishment. We have been kicked out of other hotels.

The casino had nice dealers and very favorable rules for blackjack players.  3:2 blackjack with surrender with $15 minimum on a Saturday night?  Nice.  $10 minimum on other times.  They had 2 deck games too at $15 but watch out for 6:5 tables.  Some did not have it on felt, it was on the sign which is misleading.

The food in the place wasn't really good.  The coffee shop type place had massively disappointing breakfast.  They have a Senor frogs where you can get a drink 2 for 1 even on Saturday night.

Pool is tiny but not that bad.  Definitely one of the worst pools but rowdy and cool crowd.   

Walk to strip is not through a mile of malls like some other places, it is very close to the door!

My friend and I stayed here on a recent trip. Considering how cheap the price was, I wasn't expecting much. 

My mind was blown. The room was pristine, the bed big and cushy, the view was great, and they threw in a free buffet. I would totally stay here again!

Extra perk? Starbucks is just next door. ;o)

Sorry TI, I am not impressed. We dropped a grand for 5 nights. Booked a king bed non smoking. Were told at check in that no king bed non smoking rooms were available. Anything for the inconvenience? No. Got to our two queen bed room and the bathroom is dingy. As in fixture falling off in tub area. Mirrors were not clean and there were someone else's hairs in my tub. Went to the buffet the first morning, not a huge selection of items, and then my husband and I were stuck on the toilet for about two hours each with Montezumas revenge. The only good thing about this hotel was that it was reasonably quiet and the bartender at kahunaville. Save your money and go to a $50 a night hotel.

We came here during holiday seasons.

Horrible long line when we arrived around 4:00pm; People are sitting on the floor and all over the place. After 30min wait time we decided to leave and come back at night time. 

We went shopping and dinner around the city and ended up checking in at 11:00pm at night; there was no body there waiting. The gentleman at the check-in desk was very friendly and nice; he even upgraded us to a nicer room that has spa bathtub without extra charges. However, the room was extremely smelly; I guess people were smoking inside and party with a lot of people (stinks).

The bed was somewhat comfy, didn't have any issue sleeping for the night; I liked how they have many options in television channels. They have channels for American, Chinese, Vietnamese, etc. 

When we checked out the other day, we experienced long line again; luckily there was a key drop-off box. Another thing we didn't like is their parking lot, it's 3 miles away from the front lobby! Not to mention when we have heavy luggage; we spent almost 20min one way to get our car. They should have designed a better system for their customers; perhaps a shuttle between lobby and parking lots.

Thursday - pre-paid for room
Friday Arrival: 12:00am(saturday morn)

Line was long....2 -4 people working the frond desk and about 2:15 I got to the front of the line. At this time I was told despite pre-paying they had no room.....

They gave us the option to drive a couple miles down the road and pay for a room there then come back the next day w\/ my receipt to be reimbursed. I took the option to come back in 1.5 hours when they'll have a room ready for me. 

Got in the short(check-out line) for 15 minutes at 3:45....STILL NO ROOM!

Asked to speak to a manager......20 minutes later....no manager....

Asked for more options.....They offered us a room the Trump Hotel. This time....no having to pay and get reimbursed....just go there and check in. Bingo....we too that....Finally got checked in...at 4:30am after being awake for 22 hours.....

Saturday.....noon-ish......went back to TI.....STILL NO ROOM!!!!!! Spoke to assistant manager....said he'd put a rush on the room...etc and so on....when I asked if it was what we ordered...(strip view\/King bead)...NO.....so they had to do more searching....then told us to come back in an hour...but gave us our key etc so when it was ready we wouldn't have to get in line again.

Finally....an hour later....we have a room....it was a nice room...but nothing like the Trump.

Pool looked like a frat party...so we skipped it......the next day we tried to again but after we checked out so we had no proof of being patrons and were turned away.....


This was my 3rd anniversary with my girlfriend.....we spent hours in line....had to check in to 2 hotel rooms(and check out as well)....half our Saturday was ruined due to sleeping in so late due to our check in time.....

I'm still waiting for a response from emails and a receipt that was supposed to be emailed to me.....

I will now begin to tell everyone I know how bad my experience at TI was.

I was pleasantly surprised with my stay at Treasure Island. Yes, this resort is not as up to date as many of the others, and the hallways smell like stale cigarette smoke. BUT it's inexpensive, staff is friendly, they offered complimentary bottle of champagne and coupons to bars and restaurants upon arrival. There are many restaurants to choose from that also have a reasonable price point, and it was a huge bonus that there was a Starbucks inside. The room itself is a standard room, but very clean and comfortable beds. It's nothing fancy, but comfortably gets the job done.
The suites were spacious and had two full baths! Definitely coming back for a get away trip. Great prices for rooms

Stayed here last week , room was great , service was great . Restaurants and buffet need work , they are old and need to be refreshed . Pool is nice , gym is great ,.
Beds have agronomic mattress Slept like a baby :) 
One of the best located hotels on the strip with easy access to the car garage .

Will stay here again !!!!

My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night in the Deluxe King Room and we had a great time here!

Check in is at 3, but we got to check in earlier (around 12), I'm assuming it's because we went on Wednesday.  The room wasn't too big and crazy, but the bed was soo comfortable!  The bathroom also included an oversized tub :). Checking out was fast (thanks to express check out) and we also sort of got a late check out (until 1 instead of 2).  I'll probably stay here again, since the $20 you pay for once you check in gives you a $20 credit for your next stay.

Overall I had a good experience at the Treasure Island the only problem I Incorporated was I was hoping for a strip for you I even put it in my request from 6 months ago but unfortunately they would not honor that other than that I had a nice clean room we opted to go for the junior suite which had two large bathrooms which was convenient if one person was taking a shower we could use the other bathroom if you love the mountains and also the Trump Tower was gorgeous so I'm not too unimpressed with the view itself the beds were a lot more comfier than the lower in rooms so that was also a plus there was more room to stretch out I even enjoyed how convenient it was to go downstairs and have a nice drink at the Gilley's bar for $13 their drinks are well worth the price and they're open late, and have awesome nachos! convenient free parking which they've now at the other  hotels in the area starting charging :( to stay here it is convenient to everything in right across the street from some of the most beautiful hotels in the world that offer lots of shopping and there is also a CVS right outside the hotel

After a major screw up by me, booking the room for the 22nd and driving up to Vegas on the 21st, it was not until I hit state line when The Jennifer mentioned today is the "21st" until it dawned on me that we have no room and no place to stay unless I want to us to shack up with my buddy and his new found girlfriend. Not likely...I called the front desk and explained to them what had happened and they said they can't switch my date. I used my salesman skills and talked my way into the switch with terms like : I know you can really use my business, look at my account, look at my points, I have always had a great experience here, etc, etc, and walla! I got us the room but had to pay the difference; fair enough. When we checked in, we even got a corner room with dual windows!! 
Only problem during our trip was when housekeeping took the floor mat in the bathroom, leaving the bathroom with no floor mat so when you come out of the shower; water is everywhere. So we called housekeeping and they did manage to bring one up - half hour later. It was a small issue, the room was clean and nice. It rained so we can't use the pool since they closed it because of thunderstorm. TI is always a good value and is close to everything. 
TIPS: 
If you stay at the Hotel, you get VIP standing for the Sirens show if you want to see some of the hot chics in Fish Nets bellow out some cheesy pirate lyrics. 
Also, the Video Black Jack and Video Roulette does not give points on the gaming card...WTF is up with that??

Now that the wonderful PIrate battle has been replaced with the 
idiotic VIxens or Sirens or Sluts of TI,there is little to recommend 
this hotel. No great restaurants and guest rooms are very ordinary
and overpriced. Check out the clubs,but stay and gamble elsewhere.

This hotel is okay. It is near the north strip. Close to the bus stop that will take you to Chinatown Area or the West side.  We stayed here because we knew we would be eating more in Chinatown area.  The room we stayed in had dirty glasses and the fridge was inside the closet. No microwave.  The view we had on the 33rd floor was towards the TRUMP hotel.  I hate their check in line it can be pretty long and their resort fees. What do you expect? It  is just a place to shit, sleep, and shower.

This weekend was my 12th trip to Vegas, and my first time staying at Treasure Island. I did a ton of searching various third party booking sites, looking for the best rate, and I finally ended up booking via Treasure Island's website. Such an affordable rate, and we got two free vouchers for the buffet!

I like the location of TI, the Wynn, Encore, and the Fashion Show mall were all within walking distance. 

We ate at the buffet twice, once for dinner (free vouchers!) and once at brunch (bogo free given at check in). Selection was good, the line wasn't too long, and there were complimentary mimosas at brunch!

The rooms were tastefully decorated, and the beds were surprisingly comfortable. The pool was fun, with plenty of lawn chairs, and a dj spinning in the afternoon. Drinks at the pool bar were strong, if somewhat overpriced. 

I'll definitely look into staying at TI the next time I'm in Vegas

Wow.  I am totally surprised to see this place has more than 2 stars.  Aside from being one of the cheapest places on the strip, I really do not see the pull for this place.

The updated rooms are ok, but the bed was one of those beds that I can feel it every time my wife flinches.  The whole place smelled like the carpet was flooded and not cleaned properly.

Here is my biggest beef of all; we paid for the room and got 2 free tickets to Mystere.  We went to the will call to pick them up, and were told to get confirmation from the front desk.  The other couple that were there had our print-out, and the front only referred me to another useless employee.  We were the 4th couple that day to be stiffed on their "promo."

I expect to receive no more sympathy, and would not stay there if it were free.  The other couples said the same, and they have stayed there for the past 5 years.  I guess they lost a lot when the management\/owners changed.

Avoid it. Spend a few more a night, and stay across the street.

We went to Cirque (awesome) but wanted dinner. We went to Pho-Vietnamese. So disgusting I ordered Mongolian Beef I am not sure what it actually was but I think it was Alpo. It was a bowl of gravy with a million onions floating around. Do not go there

First time staying in the strip in Vegas and we really enjoyed it. The pool here was the best part of the whole experience! They did have some trouble with our reservation and even charged us more than what we were told which was frustrating to say the least. But other than that the hotel itself was great!

Disappointed with this hotel! I do not recommend it.  Below is the email that I sent to their management. I hope someone reads it and makes some changes. 
 
I wanted to take this opportunity to let you know how disappointed my husband and I were during our stay at Treasure Island this past weekend.  Initially, we were excited to stay at your hotel because from the reviews it sounded like a good option.  I went on your website and I was impressed with all of the promotions that you offer.  In addition, I became a part of your MyTI member to take advantage of your special "FIRST OFFER" deal.  I was disappointed how I was given a cheaper deal and within an hour when I attempted to book, the price had increased.  Then I decided to use your free buffet offer.  I noticed that the offer would not appear on the reservation, even though I added it.  I read the fine print and it said that unless I mentioned it upon check- in, it would not be honored.  When I checked in, I mentioned it and was told that it was not valid.  I was not given an acceptable explanation, except that it was not a part of the reservation.  What is the purpose of your promotions, if you do not honor the codes upon check in.  I do not understand why in your fine print you state that the customer has to mention it.  Why not make it easy for the customer and allow us to add the code(s) to our reservation, and clearly show it on the confirmation.  The promotions sound great but you make it difficult  and confusing for the customer. 
 
With regards to our reservation, when I made the reservation I received a confirmation on-line with a price for each night.  However, when I received the confirming email it had a higher price.  I emailed you with my concern and never received a reply from anyone letting me know that the adjustment had been made.  That made me feel as if you did not care about my business.  As you know, customer service is everything.  I would suggest that you reply to emails when a customer has an inquiry; it goes a long way.  
 
When I made the reservation I reserved  a deluxe non-smoking room, with a king sized bed. Upon our check-in, we were told that you did not have the room that we reserved available and gave us a deluxe smoking room, with two double beds.  What is the point of reserving a room, when you can change the room at your discretion.   Nevertheless. we our bound by the agreement to pay you whether we stay or not but you are not willing to comply with your part of the agreement. It is seems very unfair.  Anyway, the reason I chose a non-smoking room was because my husband has asthma.   
 
In addition, your valet service was horrible.  We waited about 15 minutes for our car. There were three families that were there after us and they got their car before us.  When I asked the person at the desk, he told us that the reason some of the cars were brought before ours was because it depended where the car was parked.  I thought his reply was  ridiculous, there should be a comprehensive system based on the customers that arrive first.  
 
Due to my experience with your hotel, we will not be staying at it again nor will I give a recommendation to my friends.  I will yelp my experience and hope that we can prevent this situation to occur to other families.

Treasure Island wasn't as bad as I expected it to be from all the reviews. 

Me and my boyfriend ending up staying here because it was the cheapest hotel for the weekend. We spent about $260 for 3 days and 2 nights, thats including the resort fee. The room and bathrooms were nice and spacious. The beds were super comfy and the pillows felt like clouds. 

My only complaint was that the cleaning person did not come and fix the room. We left early Saturday morning and came back in the afternoon thinking we were gone long enough for our room to be cleaned and it wasn't.

Overall our stay was nice. Check in was fast, but that was probably because we came around 8pm on Friday. Check out was easy, we just did it from our TV in the room and dropped the keys in the drop box by the elevators on the first floor.

Summary: Was really happy with the hotel. Stayed for one night in a room with two queen beds-- the room was clean, well maintained and spacious enough for the three of us staying there. It had a bucket for ice, a nice bathroom, a safe, a mini fridge (hidden in the closet), ironing board and iron, nice flat screen tv, and a bunch of space if you need to unpack your luggage in drawers. We had a room which looked towards the lonely Trump Hotel up north. Other than that, the hotel staff were friendly enough, the casino was pretty standard with all the usual gambling tables and slots, though we didn't really gamble much there. 

Location: The hotel is located at the northern end of the action on the strip, across the street from the Venetian and the Palazzo, and down the road from the Mirage and Caesars Palace. I personally wouldn't book a hotel any further north than this (ie Circus Circus or Trump) if you are planning on walking around throughout the course of your stay, or else you'll be taking a long long walk to get to the fun.  

Downsides: It is a bit of a trek walking from the self serve parking lot to check-in, so best to have wheelie luggage.
